Mauler.name: Mauler
Mauler.description: The feathered bear gains a +4 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures they have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Feathered Charge.description: The feathered bear Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, the feathered bear ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain, and they can move across air as easily as solid ground. If the feathered bear doesn't end their movement on solid ground, they fall as soon as the Strike is completed.
Feathered Charge.name: Feathered Charge

Bond with Mortal.name: Bond with Mortal
Bond with Mortal.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The spirit guide forms a bond with a mortal creature. While the bond exists, the spirit guide increases their current and maximum Hit Points by 20, gains a +2 status bonus to their attack and damage rolls, and can communicate telepathically with the bonded mortal as long as the two beings are on the same plane.

The spirit guide can only be bonded with one mortal at a time, and they can take this action again to end the bond or to form a new bond (which also ends the old bond). The bond also ends if the spirit guide or the mortal dies.

This bond strengthens the spirit guide's connection to the Universe. While bonded, the spirit guide loses the incorporeal and spirit traits, loses their immunities and resistances, and changes their Strikes to deal the appropriate physical damage (typically piercing or slashing) instead of force damage.

Guardian's Aegis.description:
30 feet. All allies within 30 feet of the feathered bear gain a +1 status bonus to saves against magical effects. The bonus increases to +2 if the effect originated from a fiend.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.AL7E03DYahfDhbcR]{Effect: Guardian's Aegis}
Guardian's Aegis.name: Guardian's Aegis

Bonded Strike.name: Bonded Strike
Bonded Strike.description:
Requirements The spirit guide is currently Bonded with a Mortal

Effect The spirit guide makes a jaws Strike. If this attack hits, the bonded mortal can spend their reaction to Strike the same target.

Avenging Claws.name: Avenging Claws
Avenging Claws.description:
Trigger A creature within 10 feet damages the feathered bear's ally with a melee attack

Effect The feathered bear immediately Steps toward the triggering attacker and makes a claws Strike.

Smoke Creeper.name: Smoke Creeper

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The smoke creeper ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Painful Exhalations.name: Painful Exhalations
Painful Exhalations.description:
Requirements At least one creature within 40 feet is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} from the smoke creeper's Choking Swoop

Effect The smoke creeper flaps its wings, violently drawing the lingering smoke free from all creatures immobilized from its Choking Swoop within 40 feet. Each target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). Regardless of the result, the creature is no longer immobilized from the smoke creeper's Choking Swoop.

Smoke Form.name: Smoke Form
Smoke Form.description: The smoke creeper can move through the spaces of other creatures but can't end its movement in the same space.

Choking Swoop.name: Choking Swoop
Choking Swoop.description: The smoke creeper Flies up to its Speed, moving through the spaces of other creatures and leaving traces of itself behind. Each breathing creature it passes through must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save. On a failure, the creature inhales part of the elemental and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 minute by the pain of the smoke rasping in its throat and lungs. A creature can attempt to end this condition by spending an action coughing and succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save.

Smoke Creeper.publicNotes:
Smoke creepers shift and modify their appearance as they float through the Plane of Air, but they prefer to take on a vaguely insectile form with wings trailing choking fumes and glowing red eyes.

Some elementals embody aspects of air, such as smoke, lightning, and fog.

Easily Misled.name: 易受误导 Easily Misled
Easily Misled.description: 双头巨魔在对抗欺骗检定时察觉DC承受-4环境减值。

Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Electric.name: 再生20（电击或火焰使其无效） Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Electricity or Fire)

Collaborative Chomp.name: 协作啃咬 Collaborative Chomp
Collaborative Chomp.description: 巨魔对单个目标进行一次爪打击并擒获之。如果两者均成功，另一颗头可以使用其反应动作对该生物进行一次颚打击。

Independent Brains.name: 独立大脑 Independent Brains
Independent Brains.description: 双头巨魔的每颗头都有自己独立的先攻和回合。两颗头均不能使用延迟。当一个头的回合开始时，这颗头获得两个动作和1个反应动作，每个大脑只控制双头巨魔一条手臂，但两颗头都能移动双腿。任何能切断双头巨魔头部的能力（例如斩首武器）都不会导致双头巨魔死亡，只要他还有另一颗头，但会导致他失去被切断的头部的回合，动作和反应动作。以单一生物为目标的心灵效果只会影响双头巨人的一颗头。

Head Regrowth.name: 头部再生 Head Regrowth
Head Regrowth.description: 双头巨魔的再生可以重新长出被切断的头。通过再生恢复生命值后，双头巨魔尝试一次@Check[flat|dc:10]检定。如果成功，失去的头便会完全复原。如果一只双头巨魔失去了他最后的头，他就会立即死亡。

Two-Headed Troll.name: 双头巨魔 Two-Headed Troll
Two-Headed Troll.publicNotes:
遭受严重头部创伤后，巨魔可能再生出两颗头，每颗头都承载着部分旧有性格以及对躯体的控制权。作为整体的分离部分，两个头除了最基础的任务外难以达成共识。这些任务通常涉及觅食以满足两个口腔的需求，即便它们共享着同一个巨型胃囊。内海诸国的农庄里，人们总在私下传颂双头巨魔贪婪食欲的恐怖传说。父母用双头巨魔来吓唬顽皮孩童已经是一种习俗。"做完你的家务，"父母常这样训斥顽劣的孩子，"否则双头巨魔会在夜里把你叼走，一口吞下！"这种阴森的传统为何盛行至今已不可考，但无可否认的是，双头巨魔确实嗜食"小点心"——那些能一口吞下的小型生物。

巨魔是张着流涎的巨口，有着剃刀般锋利爪子的高大蛮兽，贪婪的掠食者。他们与土地的联结不仅能重建躯体，更催生出无数变种，每种巨魔都映射着它们汲取能量的地形特征。迁徙至新领地的巨魔会随着身体各部位的再生而逐渐蜕变，新生的血肉与旧躯缠绕交织，最终导致畸形的生长。

Moose.publicNotes:
Moose are a large, solitary type of deer. They're majestic, territorial, and extremely grumpy-traits that make them dangerous to unwary travelers and would-be predators alike. Males are instantly recognizable, standing 7 feet tall at the shoulder, with large heads and thick necks to support their impressive palmate antlers. They shed their antlers come winter and grow a new set each year at a rapid rate.

For most of the year, moose roam tundra, forest, and wilderness territories by themselves. Their hooves are wide, allowing them to more easily traverse the frequent snowfall of their native terrain, and they typically journey alone. Moose come together only during mating season, a time in which they become oddly social with one another, loud, and even more aggressive to other creatures than usual.

A moose's diet consists of leaves, woody plant matter like twigs or bark, and buds of trees and shrubs. Moose are so large they prefer to eat the leaves of trees taller than humans instead of lowering their giant heads all the way to the ground. This can make them easy to track, though hunters will find actually killing a moose is a far greater challenge than finding it. Despite their size, moose have many natural predators, especially pack animals like wolves and large carnivores like tigers. Large humanoids like ogres and trolls dwelling in the wilderness sometimes make sport of chasing down and wrestling moose.

Despite their large size, moose are expert swimmers in both fresh and salt water, and they readily feed on aquatic vegetation. Moose rarely swim into open seas, however, and usually stay close to land, though ocean predators have been known to hunt swimming moose. To an observer watching from the safe distance of a dry shore, the large branching antlers of a swimming moose can sometimes be mistaken for a tree bobbing along in the water.

Cold Adaptation.name: Cold Adaptation
Cold Adaptation.description: The moose reduces the effects it suffers from cold environments by one step.

Thundering Charge.name: Thundering Charge
Thundering Charge.description: The moose Strides twice and then makes an antler Strike. A Medium or smaller creature damaged by this attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Kick Back.name: Kick Back
Kick Back.description:
The moose bucks and kicks back with both hind hooves, making a Strike with a -2 circumstance penalty to the attack roll. If it hits, it deals an extra @Damage[1d8[bludgeoning]] damage.

This counts as two attacks when calculating the moose's multiple attack penalty.

Moose.name: Moose

Gnokesh.publicNotes: 诺刻什的形貌如一只由古代典籍盘绕而成的轮盘，这也映照它在天国中的职分。它们是天界学识的化身，尤其体现在对研习与考据的持久精进。每一位诺刻什都将自身奉献于某个领域；这一领域同样塑造了它的自我认同，或许只有神使同族才能真正明白其中的分量。这类圣使会尽量避免妄起兵戈，因为追求知识才是它们的毕生事业。它们更愿意与同族聚于宏大的书库，或是承担记录与训导之职，服侍司经、学者、统帅、谋士，以及其它能施用其所掌学识之人。

Light of Diligence.name: 焚膏继晷 Light of Diligence
Light of Diligence.description:
触发 一名15尺内的自愿盟友在一次检定中大失败

效果 该盟友改为得到失败的结果，且在1分钟内对焚膏继晷免疫。

Alluring Knowledge.name: 智识之诱 Alluring Knowledge
Alluring Knowledge.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 一幅由纯净辉光凝聚的符文卷轴浮现在60尺内一处未被占据的空间。邻接于符文的每名生物必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:22|basic]豁免。若失败则受到@Damage[3d8[mental]]伤害，且还会额外在魔符持续期间被其@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]。魔符持续到诺刻什的下个回合结束。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Archon's Protection.name: 圣使护卫 Archon's Protection
Archon's Protection.description:
触发 一个敌人伤害圣使的盟友，且该敌人和该盟友皆距离圣使15尺内

效果 该盟友在对抗触发伤害时获得对全部伤害类型的5点抗力，圣使可对触发本能力的敌人进行一次打击。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.JZVSXgzu52tJGO6D]

Gnokesh.name: 诺刻什 Gnokesh

Grioth Cultist.name: Grioth Cultist

Echolocation (Precise) 20 feet.name: Echolocation (Precise) 20 feet
Echolocation (Precise) 20 feet.description: A grioth can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

No Breath.description: A grioth doesn't breathe except to speak and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as an inhaled poison).
No Breath.name: No Breath

Grioth Venom.name: Grioth Venom
Grioth Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} (1 round)

Invoke Haunter of the Dark.name: Invoke Haunter of the Dark
Invoke Haunter of the Dark.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The grioth cultist waves a hand in a complex pattern to invoke dark powers, dealing @Damage[3d8[mental]|options:area-damage] damage. Each non-grioth creature within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes stupefied 1 for 1 minute.

Shock Mind.name: Shock Mind
Shock Mind.description:
The grioth cultist makes a Strike with a voidglass weapon.

If the Strike hits, it deals an additional @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage, and the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:20|traits:incapacitation] save (this has the incapacitation trait) or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Grioth Cultist.publicNotes:
Grioth cultists represent the lowest tier of their remorseless cult-worshippers of the Elder Mythos tasked with leading scouting missions into new worlds. Though ranked above scouts in the chain of command, they occupy a lowly place in the overall religious hierarchy. Though whispered rumors describe the legendary rituals needed to wrench worlds from their suns, these cultists don't learn this potent magic. Such secrets are left to grioth high priests, who are always the last to arrive in a colonized world.

Most grioths worship the Outer God Nyarlathotep in one of his many incarnations, although some worship other entities of the Elder Mythos such as Azathoth, Nhimbaloth, or Yog-Sothoth. In the highly rare cases where a grioth is cut off from their society and given the opportunity to explore other religions, they still lean into faiths associated with the stars or the night, such as Desna or Zon-Kuthon. However, these grioths are loathed by others of their own kind, who view them as dangerous heretics.

Planets that drift out of orbit from their stars grow cold and lifeless as they float through the Dark Tapestry. Such dead worlds are coveted by the horrific creatures known as grioths, who endure the awful cold on these wandering worlds and convert them into planetary temples devoted to the dark gods of the Elder Mythos. From these bastions of frozen darkness, grioths seek out warm, living worlds to tear away from their respective suns through forbidden rituals, a process that often takes numerous generations.

A single cultist typically leads a grioth scouting party, and the group seeks out a disused or forgotten location on the fringe of rural settlements as their initial invasion point. Over several generations, a grioth settlement grows powerful and conquers the surrounding cultures, and eventually, powerful grioths descend from the stars to begin the next stage of planetary conquest.

Grioths speak a language composed of trills and clicks. While capable of speaking other languages, they do so in dry, raspy voices. As grioths have wings, wriggling tails, and four-eyed, bat-like visages, many cultures mistakenly associate them with the evil Outer Planes, but they very much belong to this reality.

Okenevem.name: 躬允者 Okenevem

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Archon's Protection.name: 圣使护卫 Archon's Protection
Archon's Protection.description:
触发 一个敌人伤害圣使的盟友，且该敌人和该盟友皆距离圣使15尺内

效果 该盟友在对抗触发伤害时获得对全部伤害类型的15点抗力，圣使可对触发本能力的敌人进行一次打击。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.JZVSXgzu52tJGO6D]

Divine Defenders.name: 圣性庇护 Divine Defenders
Divine Defenders.description: 60尺。躬允者的圣性在圣使之间占有崇高之位，因而吸引着较低位的圣使趋前护卫。若有敌人在灵光所及之内对躬允者发动敌对行为，云状的低位圣使集群便会显现，拱卫其身侧，对该生物造成@Damage[2d6[persistent,slashing],2d6[persistent,spirit]]伤害。该持续伤害会在该敌人于一整轮内未对躬允者做出敌对行为后自动结束。

Humble Bow.name: 谦退之节 Humble Bow
Humble Bow.description: 躬允者迫使被其打击命中的生物在无限的敬意中俯首。其必须成功通过一次@Check[will|dc:36]豁免，否则被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。每当该生物于其下回合结束之前试图站立，则其受到@Damage[3d8[mental]]伤害。若该生物通过豁免，则会在1分钟内临时免疫。

Sublime Vision.name: 崇高圣景 Sublime Vision
Sublime Vision.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 躬允者施放神威如岳法术，但有别于常规情况，其会在100尺内召唤出天堂的神圣景象，且受影响的目标将会在谦恭中陷入自省，而非向圣像行礼。

Okenevem.publicNotes:
"天堂的圣山上有第六层，名叫尤迪卡（Iudica）。权能最盛的圣使多居于此"，躬允者（Okenevem）也位列其中。躬允者由卑微的佐阿姆（zoaem）渐次升华至今的形貌，但他们仍怀更高的潜能——所受的恩宠足以越阶进入天堂巅顶的乐园。然而他们选择不入，只是在门前俯伏，甘心安居其外，由此得享喜乐。躬允者以谦卑朴实为首德，在天堂的巍峨荣耀前躬身致敬，并另以多种方式尽其勤役。

躬允者很少离开天堂，除非奉该境诸神所托的特定使命。大多时候，他们被差去训导某些司祭恪守谦卑德行：这些司祭或抗拒天主旨意，或违乱天堂秩序，或自以为与其所奉的神明等量齐观。躬允者致力引导他们弃绝傲慢大罪，常以身作则，行事给他们看，借此导正其途。"

Interlocutor.name: Interlocutor
Interlocutor.publicNotes:
Interlocutors are the most talented surgeon-sculptors of the velstracs, carving away flesh and replacing it with new body parts of muscle, sinew, and metal. Each interlocutor structures their individual appearance carefully, but all are towering, multi-limbed amalgamations of the strongest limbs, densest bones, and sharpest metals they can find. They continually search for new material to graft to their forms, and their slain foes are rarely found intact, as little is more valuable to interlocutors than a powerful opponent's legs, eyes, or even brain. Due to their unique properties, deposits of skymetals sometimes draw interlocutors to the mortal Universe. Interlocutors average 9 feet in height and weigh approximately 800 pounds.

The shadow-dwelling fiends known as velstracs all share a horrifying preoccupation with the search for ultimate sensation through self-mutilation. Velstracs transcend their stoic detachment only when inflicting pain and terror upon their victims, practicing new forms of torture, or turning their agonizing practices back on themselves. They consider themselves enlightened beings, transcending such limitations as morality or mortal taboos, but their victims know them as emotionless tormentors who inflict sadistic suffering. These fiends claim to seek perfection in thought, form, and action, although they don't recognize any refinement that doesn't require the painful excision of the flesh or spirit.

Velstracs manifest from the souls of the most extreme masochistic or sadistic mortals who are judged and sent on to the Netherworld. They take on forms that suit their vile predilections, ranging from the low-ranking augurs to the maestros of suffering and mutilation, the eremites. The process of transformation warps the soul step by step, with other velstracs conveying their new members through untold chambers of pain among the dark reaches of the Netherworld.
Interlocutor.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Painsight.name: Painsight
Painsight.description: A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} conditions as well as the value of those conditions.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Glimpse of Stolen Flesh.name: Glimpse of Stolen Flesh
Glimpse of Stolen Flesh.description: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it sees pieces of its own body amid the interlocutor's form. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:29|options:inflicts:stunned] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Shadow Siphon.name: Shadow Siphon
Shadow Siphon.description:
Trigger The interlocutor would take damage from a spell or magical effect

Effect The interlocutor takes half the triggering damage instead.

Focus Gaze.name: Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: The interlocutor stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The creature must immediately attempt a Will save against glimpse of stolen flesh. In addition, if the creature was already stunned, on a failed save, it feels its internal organs twist and writhe, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 minute. After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune to Focus Gaze until the start of the interlocutor's next turn.

Surgical Rend.name: Surgical Rend
Surgical Rend.description: This functions as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.3JOi2cMcGhT3eze1]{Rend} ability, dealing claw Strike damage. In addition, if the target is a living creature with organs and muscle, the interlocutor opens a precise wound. Until the creature is restored to its maximum Hit Points, thus closing the wound, Strikes against the creature deal an additional 1d6 precision damage.

Whisper Dragon (Adult).publicNotes: 低语龙是敏锐的谣言和秘密收藏家，花费几个世纪来磨练他们的信息网络和人际关系。它们这样做通常并非出于想要控制他人或利用这些信息来进行阴谋，而仅仅是因为学习和收集信息的过程本身就是一种满足。与其他龙的财宝相比，它们的巢穴较为简陋，因为它们真正的财富——秘密——都藏在它们的脑海中。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Diplomatic Solution.name: 外交解决 Diplomatic Solution
Diplomatic Solution.description:
触发 低语龙进行先攻检定

效果 低语龙将其视线内60尺范围内的所有敌人作为目标，施放环级等于低语龙等级一半（向上取整）的安定心神（@Check[will|dc:28]豁免）。低语龙无需维持此效果，但如果低语龙对受到影响的生物采取任何敌对行动，则对所有生物终止该效果。

Distracting Whisper.name: 干扰低语 Distracting Whisper
Distracting Whisper.description:
触发 低语龙成为攻击的目标

效果 一个神秘的声音在触发生物耳边低语，使触发攻击受到-2环境减值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qsvSWxRqVQofjDdH]

Cogitation Breath.name: 凝思吐息 Cogitation Breath
Cogitation Breath.description: 低语龙释放出一股迷惑性毒雾，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[10d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied]豁免）。豁免失败的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（大失败则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}），持续1分钟。低语龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cogitation Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用凝思吐息。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 低语龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 低语龙的打击重击时，恢复凝思吐息的充能。

Unveil Secret.name: 揭开秘密 Unveil Secret
Unveil Secret.description: 低语龙探知60尺内一个生物的思维，搜寻其秘密，除非目标通过@Check[will|dc:30]豁免，否则低语龙会知晓一个该生物会觉得尴尬或羞耻的事情。目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，且在1分钟内或在低语龙揭露秘密前无法降低惊惧状态。当受影响生物尝试检定时，低语龙可用一个反应动作揭露其秘密使其难堪，迫使该生物投掷两次并取较差结果；这是一个厄运效果。

+2 to Sense Motive.name: 察言观色时+2 +2 to Sense Motive

Information Network.name: 信息网络 Information Network
Information Network.description: 低语龙可以尝试一个社群检定来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]以代替搜集信息检定，从先前的线人处回忆情报。

Steal Knowledge.name: 窃取知识 Steal Knowledge
Steal Knowledge.description:
低语龙从60尺内一个生物的意识中摘取知识片段，选择一个技能作为影响目标。该生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:28]豁免。

成功 该生物不受影响。

失败 在接下来的1分钟内，该生物使用该技能的检定时承受-1状态减值，而低语龙在使用该技能的检定中获得+1状态加值。

大失败 同失败，但减值为-2，加值为+2。

Whisper Dragon (Adult).name: 成年低语龙 Whisper Dragon (Adult)

Skittering Slayer.name: Skittering Slayer

Agitated by Light.name: Agitated by Light
Agitated by Light.description: When exposed to bright light, the skittering slayer must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save. On a failure, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). The skittering slayer then becomes immune to being agitated by light for 10 minutes.

Discorporate.name: Discorporate
Discorporate.description: When the swarm strider is reduced to 0 HP, their constituent creatures collapse, scattering on the ground under their space and each adjacent square. If even one of the creatures gets away, the swarm strider can eventually re-form over 1d10 days (potentially longer in areas where there are few invertebrates). The scattered invertebrates must be destroyed within 1 round to destroy the swarm strider permanently. The invertebrates have a collective pool of 32 HP, and the same AC, saves, immunities, resistances, and weaknesses as the swarm strider. The invertebrates can't take actions but they escape automatically once the round elapses. At the GM's discretion, clever means of trapping or eliminating the creatures might be sufficient to destroy the swarm strider.

Scatter.name: Scatter
Scatter.description:
Trigger The skittering slayer is targeted by a splash attack or would attempt a Reflex save against an area effect

Effect The skittering slayer scatters in place, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and Reflex saves against the triggering effect.

Clinging Remnants.name: Clinging Remnants
Clinging Remnants.description: A swarm strider's melee Strikes and ranged Strikes made against targets within their weapon's first range increment deposit biting vermin on the target, dealing @Damage[2d4[persistent,piercing]] damage.

Draw Bugs.name: Draw Bugs
Draw Bugs.description: The swarm strider draws more arthropods from the environment around them to reconstitute some of their damaged body. They regain @Damage[10] HP. At the GM's discretion, the swarm strider doesn't recover HP in areas where there aren't enough arthropods to call to themselves.

Squirming Embrace.name: Squirming Embrace
Squirming Embrace.description: The swarm strider Strides. If they end their movement sharing a space with a creature, they deal @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage to the creature, with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic]. The swarm strider can Burrow, Climb, Fly, or Swim instead of Striding if they have the corresponding movement type.

Swarm Shape.name: Swarm Shape
Swarm Shape.description: The swarm strider collapses into a shapeless swarm of their constituent creatures. They drops all items in their possession. In this form, the swarm strider can't use attack actions and can't cast spells, but they can move through areas small enough for their constituent creatures to fit without having to Squeeze. They can use the same action to coalesce from their swarm shape back into their normal form.

Skittering Slayer.publicNotes:
When a warrior's last thoughts are of bloodlust, their body can become so suffused with rage that it infects whatever eats their corpse. This singular emotion binds together the resultant swarm, combining the insects' will to survive with a berserker's deathless rage, creating an indomitable combatant. Often made of roaches or similarly tenacious insects, skittering slayers rarely develop long-term plans, instead scuttling about in search of dark refuges and passionate fights. These swarm striders tend to avoid transforming into their swarm shape, preferring to face their foes directly whenever possible.

All living creatures eventually become worm food. Yet if a creature perishes while gripped by overwhelming emotion or unfinished business, its flesh can become infused with those obsessions or a simple refusal to perish, infecting whatever detritivores feast on the body. As they feast, the invertebrates awaken to a type of collective intelligence, including some of the dead creature's memories and motivations. Once the body is stripped bare, the vermin swarm together and intertwine to recreate the dead creature's form out of thousands of wriggling bodies. These reborn are known as swarm striders.

Though many swarm striders are accidental creations, a few rare mortals purposefully transform themselves into swarm striders through powerful rituals. Most often, this process involves specially preparing a grave with ample scavengers and enchanting the site with occult magic to anchor their soul until it can live within the swarm. Through transformation, these intentional swarm striders seek out the power to slip past any defense or claim the virtual immortality of an ever-regenerating horde, as a swarm strider can reconstitute their form from even a single worm. However, the transformation inevitably scars the creature—often causing emotional detachment, the disintegration of old taboos, and a dissociated sense of self now that one mind has become a thousand. In their transformed state, even the best-intentioned swarm strider might embrace villainy and lose any semblance of their former selves over the span of many years.

Aghash.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Cursed Gaze.name: Cursed Gaze
Cursed Gaze.description:
The aghash fixes their gaze on one creature they can see within 20 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect,inflicts:frightened,inflicts:stunned] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and becomes either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (the aghash's choice).

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Sandstorm.name: Sandstorm
Sandstorm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The aghash creates a temporary sandstorm in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] that lasts for 1 minute.

Creatures within the emanation take a –4 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|options:area-effect] save. On a failure, they're forced to hold their breath or else they start suffocating. A creature within the sandstorm at the end of its turn takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage.

Divs are immune to all effects of an aghash's sandstorm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.f8rncEs06bqcn3LZ]{Effect: Sandstorm}

Hatred of Beauty.name: Hatred of Beauty
Hatred of Beauty.description:
While aghashes hate all mortals, they particularly despise beautiful objects and beautiful or charismatic mortals. When not in physical peril, an aghash is compelled to destroy art and other works of beauty. An aghash can't enter an area of pristine beauty without first marring it in some way.

Given a choice, an aghash attacks a foe with the highest Charisma score first. If barred from doing so by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn.

Aghash.name: Aghash
Aghash.publicNotes:
Walking embodiments of curses, misfortune, and the evil eye, aghashes wander the deserts of the Material Plane, searching out the arrogant, charming, and persuasive to humiliate and undermine. Aghashes are often mistaken for some strange form of hag, and like those creatures, they're masters at curses.

Some fiends want to tear down the multiverse; others dedicate themselves to creating chaos and carnage, or to rule over realms with an iron fist. Divs strive toward a different, if equally reprehensible, goal-they seek to thwart and ruin the schemes and works of mortal beings.

Long ago, divs were once genies bound to serve ancient mortal empires lost to the passage of eons. In the beginning, these genies were masters of creation, working alongside gracious mortal partners to create works of subtle design and powerful magical potential. What started as a collaboration with mortals soon morphed into abuse, disrespect, and even slavery and bondage. Eventually, these genies rebelled, but in doing so, they came under the sway of a nihilistic demigod known as Ahriman. Their new master twisted their form and granted them the power to avenge themselves upon their mortal overlords, leading to the birth of the first divs.

Since that first wave of corruption, new divs arise from the spirits of the most wicked and hateful genies who die on the Material Plane, or those truly betrayed by mortals and overcome through their desire for vengeance. Upon such a death, instead of returning to the Elemental Planes, these genies' spirits are trapped in the dread orbit of Abaddon, where Ahriman reshapes them as divs and hoists them back to the world to wreak vengeance upon mortals.

Shade (Astral Plane).name: Shade (Astral Plane)

Planar Incarnation - Astral Plane (The U.name: Planar Incarnation - Astral Plane (The Untethered)
Planar Incarnation - Astral Plane (The U.description:
All shades are formed from and personify the nature of the plane on which they manifest, and their statistics are adjusted as summarized below. They also gain any trait associated with creatures from their plane.

Astral Plane (The Untethered) These appear as astrally projected versions of their mortal forms, yet they lack a silver cord

  • Language any one spoken in life (such as Common)
  • Additional Ability fly Speed 20 feet
  • Melee 1 fist +7, Damage 1d8+2 bludgeoning

Shade (Astral Plane).publicNotes:
These appear as astrally projected versions of their mortal forms, yet they lack a silver cord.

When a mortal dies, their soul travels to the Boneyard in the Outer Planes where they're judged by Pharasma, the goddess of the dead. Once judged, their soul is sent on to their final reward or punishment and, in the process, transformed into a creature known as a shade. This transformation grants the soul a new body, one whose shape is determined by the prevailing philosophical forces of the plane to which they're sent. A shade's memories from their former life usually fade, reduced to a few hazy fragments akin to half-remembered dreams. Regardless of the shade's size, power, or nature in life, they're a Medium creature in their afterlife.

Existence as a shade can last for eons but isn't necessarily eternal. Deities, powerful denizens of the Great Beyond, or even the Outer Planes can further alter a shade's nature by either reducing them into raw quintessence, spiritual essence that's then used to expand a plane's physical manifestation, or by transforming them into a new form of supernatural life such as a celestial, monitor, or fiend. Should a shade die, their body breaks down in a process akin to decay, their form reverting to the elements that make up their plane. This represents the true end of a soul's journey—their life essence reuniting with the heart of the Great Beyond to be recycled into Creation's Forge, fueling the creation of new souls.

Tripkee Rain-Caller.name: Tripkee Rain-Caller
Tripkee Rain-Caller.publicNotes:
Influential within their communities, these wise druids hold power over water and weather.

Tripkees make their homes in the treetops of jungles and forests. These frog-like humanoids are uniquely adapted to their environment, with oversized eyes that give them keen vision in both light and dark and large toes that allow them to easily scale trees. Tripkees vary widely in physical appearance, with their physiologies influenced by their surrounding environment. Typical tripkees stand just over 2 feet tall and weigh approximately 30 pounds.

Whatever region they come from, tripkees tend to be peaceful hunter-gatherers. They cultivate mushroom patches and gather a wide array of fruits from the surrounding wilderness.

A History of Neutrality

Tripkee villages rarely get involved in the conflicts of other communities despite various trade-based alliances, preferring to focus on maintaining relative peace within their own small societies. Legends explain this attitude with a tale of a tripkee champion who dragged his people into a war between humans and charau-ka. The stories differ as to which side the tripkees took, but every version ends with the bloody deaths of the hero and his family. Since that time, village elders claim, tripkees have done their best to remain far from the conflicts of others.

Jungle Passage.name: Jungle Passage
Jungle Passage.description: Tripkees ignore difficult terrain in forests and jungles.

Abdomen Cache.name: 腹腔藏物所 Abdomen Cache
Abdomen Cache.description: 甲虫外壳的腹部可以安装一个简单的铰链，使其可以打开并用来储物。腹部可以容纳一个体积中型或更小的生物，一个体积大型或更小的集群，或类似数量的货物。甲虫或储存在其中的生物可以通过交互动作来打开舱门。如果甲虫外壳受到钝击武器重击，进行@Check[flat|dc:10]检定。如果检定失败，藏物所就会被打破，里面的东西从甲虫体内洒出。舱门也可以被[[/act force-open dc=22]]{破拆}（@Check[athletics|dc:22]检定）。

Beetle Carapace.name: 甲虫外壳 Beetle Carapace
Beetle Carapace.publicNotes:
源自一个巨锹甲虫的外骨骼，这个无心智的巨怪能用它强大的颚将敌人切成两半。这种爬行的不死生物的腹部是空的，不止一位死灵师利用这个空间来隐藏宝贵的货物。

在亡者的行列中，没有哪种不死有着如骷髅一般无穷的数量与种类。虽然大多数骷髅几乎完全由骨头构成，但少部分还保留着一些肉屑来帮助它们运动，比如翼膜。

Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
Motion Sense.description: A giant amoeba can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

Envelop.name: Envelop
Envelop.description:
Requirements The giant amoeba begins its turn with a target its size or smaller @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The giant amoeba maintains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} and extends pseudopods to surround the creature and pull it inside the amoeba's body. This thereafter has the same effect as if the amoeba had @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]{Engulfed} the creature (DC 17, @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage, [[/act escape dc=17]], Rupture 3).

Weak Acid.name: Weak Acid
Weak Acid.description: A giant amoeba's acid damages only organic material-not metal, stone, or other inorganic substances.

Giant Amoeba.name: Giant Amoeba
Giant Amoeba.publicNotes: These blobs of nearly transparent protoplasm are identical in form and behavior to the microscopic creatures from which they have evolved, except their outlandish size makes them all the more dangerous. Unlike slimes, puddings, and other deadly oozes, giant amoebas have an outer membrane that contains their internal structures, making them more susceptible to slashing weapons than their amorphous kin. However, this membrane is also extremely flexible and permeable, allowing them to surround prey and absorb it, suffocating and slowly digesting it in the amoeba's acidic fluids.

Slice and Dice.name: Slice and Dice
Slice and Dice.description: Each enemy in the animated silverware swarm's space takes @Damage[1d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage or @Damage[1d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save)

Stick a Fork in It.name: Stick a Fork in It
Stick a Fork in It.description:
The animated silverware swarm attempts to pin a single creature.

The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|options:area-effect,inflicts:immobilized] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success Silverware pins portions of the target's clothing and gear. The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds as long as it remains in the swarm's space.

Failure As success, and the target also can't Step until it leaves the swarm's space.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.K3r1lfbtCTf3dFhV]{Effect: Stick a Fork in It}

Critical Failure The target is thoroughly pinned by the silverware, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it [[/act escape dc=17]]{Escapes} or uses 2 Interact actions to remove all of the silverware pinning them down.

Construct Armor (Hardness 3).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 3)
Construct Armor (Hardness 3).description: Like normal objects, an animated silverware swarm has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the swarm takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated silverware swarm is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 12.

Animated Silverware Swarm.name: Animated Silverware Swarm
Animated Silverware Swarm.publicNotes:
Nobles are known to pay great amounts to animate their silverware, both for ease in cleaning and to serve as novelties during dinner parties.

Many animated objects have useful functions but become dangers when uncontrolled.

Shade (Universe).name: Shade (Universe)

Planar Incarnation - Universe (The Remna.name: Planar Incarnation - Universe (The Remnants)
Planar Incarnation - Universe (The Remna.description:
All shades are formed from and personify the nature of the plane on which they manifest, and their statistics are adjusted as summarized below. They also gain any trait associated with creatures from their plane.

Universe (The Remnants) The remnants are among the rarest of shades; appearing as plain, bland versions of their mortal selves.

  • Language any one spoken in life (such as Common)
  • Additional Ability @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.N1kstYbHScxgUQtN]{Ferocity}
  • Melee fist +7, Damage 1d8+2 bludgeoning

Shade (Universe).publicNotes:
The remnants are among the rarest of shades; appearing as plain, bland versions of their mortal selves.

When a mortal dies, their soul travels to the Boneyard in the Outer Planes where they're judged by Pharasma, the goddess of the dead. Once judged, their soul is sent on to their final reward or punishment and, in the process, transformed into a creature known as a shade. This transformation grants the soul a new body, one whose shape is determined by the prevailing philosophical forces of the plane to which they're sent. A shade's memories from their former life usually fade, reduced to a few hazy fragments akin to half-remembered dreams. Regardless of the shade's size, power, or nature in life, they're a Medium creature in their afterlife.

Existence as a shade can last for eons but isn't necessarily eternal. Deities, powerful denizens of the Great Beyond, or even the Outer Planes can further alter a shade's nature by either reducing them into raw quintessence, spiritual essence that's then used to expand a plane's physical manifestation, or by transforming them into a new form of supernatural life such as a celestial, monitor, or fiend. Should a shade die, their body breaks down in a process akin to decay, their form reverting to the elements that make up their plane. This represents the true end of a soul's journey—their life essence reuniting with the heart of the Great Beyond to be recycled into Creation's Forge, fueling the creation of new souls.

Coral Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: 成年珊瑚龙施法者 Coral Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)

Biomineralize.name: 生物矿化 Biomineralize
Biomineralize.description:
触发 珊瑚龙被一个没有长触及特征的近战武器或无武装攻击重击，且该攻击造成挥砍或穿刺伤害

效果 珊瑚龙的伤口喷出一股血液，瞬间钙化为一根尖锐的珊瑚枝。珊瑚枝刺穿触发的生物，造成@Damage[7d6[piercing]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物还会额外受到@Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]]伤害。无论结果如何，珊瑚都会随后崩溃为尘土。

Kaleidoscopic Display.name: 万花华彩 Kaleidoscopic Display
Kaleidoscopic Display.description:
90尺。覆盖龙体的珊瑚构造闪烁着鲜艳的色彩，令感官超负荷，迫使任何进入或在灵光内开始回合的生物必须进行一次@Check[fortitude|dc:30]豁免。无论结果如何，该生物暂时免疫该珊瑚龙的万花华彩1分钟。

大成功 该生物不受影响

成功 该生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]1轮

失败 该生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]1轮

大失败 该生物目盲1轮并目眩1分钟。

Reef Meld.name: 珊瑚融合 Reef Meld
Reef Meld.description:
频率 每日一次

需求 珊瑚龙与它们的绑定珊瑚礁有物理接触

效果 珊瑚龙与珊瑚礁融合并消失，同时最多可带着四名自愿的生物进入一个异次元空间，在这个空间中既无法影响外界，也不会被外界影响。该效果无限期持续直到珊瑚龙解消为止。一旦融合，珊瑚龙可以花费1分钟移动并从其珊瑚礁上任意5英里内的点出现。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: 对抗原能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Reef Bond.name: 礁石契约 Reef Bond
Reef Bond.description:
每条珊瑚龙都与一个活珊瑚礁有神秘联系。如果珊瑚龙距离它们的珊瑚礁超过3英里，它们会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}且无法恢复，每6小时恶心值增加1，除非它们成功进行一次@Check[fortitude|dc:34]豁免。24小时后，珊瑚龙获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}；每24小时流失值增加1。

如果珊瑚礁遭受重大伤害，珊瑚龙会立即察觉到珊瑚礁受损的地点，但无法知道伤害的来源或性质。如果珊瑚礁被完全摧毁，珊瑚龙会立即死亡。

Hydraulic Breath.name: 液压吐息 Hydraulic Breath
Hydraulic Breath.description: 珊瑚龙喷出一股高压水流，在@Template[type:line|distance:100]范围内造成@Damage[13d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic|options:area-effect,forced-movement,inflicts:prone]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物被推离10尺并被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。珊瑚龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hydraulic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用液压吐息。

Coral Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 珊瑚龙是守护广袤海洋珊瑚礁的原始守护者，珊瑚礁遍布于格拉利昂的各大海洋中。即便在龙族中，珊瑚龙也因其傲慢与虚荣而尤为突出，它们为自己覆满珊瑚的鳞片和所保护的五彩斑斓的珊瑚礁而骄傲。珊瑚龙喜欢装饰它们的珊瑚礁，它们视这些珊瑚礁为巢穴，常常用美丽的物品装饰，偶尔也会加入一些贵重物品，如金币。那些寻求珊瑚龙宠爱的人常会发现，这些龙容易被奉承所打动，尤其是当奉承与闪亮或色彩鲜艳的礼物相结合时，这些礼物能与龙及其水下领域的璀璨美丽相得益彰。

Betobeto-San.name: Betobeto-San

Fearsense (Precise) 60 feet.name: Fearsense (Precise) 60 feet
Fearsense (Precise) 60 feet.description: The betobeto-san is aware of all @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures within the listed range.

Ominous Footsteps.name: Ominous Footsteps
Ominous Footsteps.description:
60 feet. The betobeto-san's footsteps seem to draw ever closer, yet the source remains difficult to pinpoint. Each creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the betobeto-san must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

Shadow Invisibility.name: Shadow Invisibility
Shadow Invisibility.description: The betobeto-san is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} unless within an area of bright light.

Stepping Decoy.name: Stepping Decoy
Stepping Decoy.description:
The betobeto-san Steps. They then create two illusory decoys of sound within @Template[emanation|distance:15]{15 feet} of them that mimic the sounds of their ominous footsteps.

These decoys act independently on the betobeto-san's initiative with 2 actions apiece. They can only Sneak or Stride, and they have a Speed of 35 feet. Use the betobeto-san's Stealth DC (typically 37) against attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or disbelieve a decoy.

Each decoy lasts for 1 minute. Any existing decoys vanish if the betobeto-san uses this ability again.

Shadow Step.name: Shadow Step
Shadow Step.description:
Trigger A bright light source reveals the betobeto-san.

Requirements The betobeto-san isn't already within an area of bright light.

Effect The betobeto-san Steps briefly into the Shadow Plane and then back again, appearing up to 30 feet away from where they began.

Betobeto-San.publicNotes:
A betobeto-san wanders the highways and byways of the Material Plane, searching for unwilling traveling companions to sustain the spirit's appetite for fear. Though this shadow spirit is invisible in darkness or shade, in light they appear as a formless, shadowy mass with two sandaled feet. These sandals are made of wood or bone that cause the creature's footsteps to make the distinct "beto beto" sound from which they receive their name. A wide, toothy mouth smiles in the middle of their otherwise featureless mass, and they can manifest long, clawed limbs.

Betobeto-san trail behind nighttime travelers, compelled to follow until the creatures verbally offer to let the betobeto-san pass. This compulsion isn't usually malicious by nature and occurs more from a betobeto-san's misguided desire for company and courtesy; unfortunately, they lack of understanding how this behavior can frighten others. Betobeto-san don't attack those they follow, but they often end up in combat because their unwelcome behavior causes those they follow to attack first.

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description:
1 week, [[/act disable-device dc=35]]{DC 35 Thievery}, standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.

Self-Destruct.name: Self-Destruct
Self-Destruct.description:
A clockwork dragon must use this reaction unless specifically programmed otherwise by its creator.

Trigger The clockwork dragon is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Effect The dragon screeches to a stop and emits a steady, loud ticking sound. At the beginning of what would have been its next turn, the dragon explodes, dealing @Damage[12d10[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[emanation|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect] save).

An adjacent creature can cancel the self-destruct sequence by succeeding at a @Check[thievery|dc:37|traits:action:disable-a-device] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device}.

Breathe Oil.name: Breathe Oil
Breathe Oil.description: The clockwork dragon breathes a spray of flaming oil that deals @Damage[16d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail their saves are covered in burning oil and take @Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]]. The clockwork dragon can't use Breathe Oil again for 2 rounds.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The clockwork dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Spearing Tail.name: Spearing Tail
Spearing Tail.description:
The clockwork dragon attacks with the sharp point of its tail.

It makes a tail Strike against each creature in a @Template[line|distance:20], rolling the attack roll once and applying the result to each target. Any creature hit takes @Damage[4d6[bleed]] (@Damage[(2*4d6)[bleed]] on a critical hit). This counts as two attacks for the dragon's multiple attack penalty.

Clockwork Dragon.name: Clockwork Dragon
Clockwork Dragon.publicNotes:
Clockwork dragons are a marvel of clockwork design. These powerful masterpieces have the ability to fly, making them versatile and dangerous killers. A clockwork dragon's winding mechanism is more efficient than those of other clockworks, allowing it to partially reuse energy generated by flapping its wings. Creating a clockwork dragon requires not only an advanced understanding of clockwork design, but also a greater cache of rare resources, as its body requires solid reinforcement. As a result, most clockwork dragons have adamantine fortification. Creating a clockwork dragon without adamantine is entirely possible, though such dragons are typically smaller and more fragile.

Intricate, complex machines, clockworks are built with care by highly skilled engineers. Though their creation involves some amount of magic, they're primarily mechanical, packed with precision-tuned gears and springs working in concert.

The sturdy mainspring within a clockwork must be wound to provide the energy needed to power the device. Some larger clockworks contain a series of springs for different limbs that each need to be wound. A clockwork's crafter creates a unique metal key while building the clockwork; winding the clockwork usually involves inserting the key into the machine's back and turning clockwise. Larger clockworks require greater strength to turn the key, and typically have larger keys to allow for more torque-some even accommodating a team of winders rather than an individual. Programming a clockwork requires both the key and the knowledge to set the program correctly, information usually reserved for the clockwork's creator or owner.

Jotund Troll.name: 约顿巨魔 Jotund Troll

Regeneration 40 (Deactivated by Electric.name: 再生40（电击或火焰使其无效） Regeneration 40 (Deactivated by Electricity or Fire)

Furious Roar.name: 狂暴咆哮 Furious Roar
Furious Roar.description:
触发 约顿巨魔受到电击或火焰伤害

效果 约顿巨魔使用其刺耳咆哮，且如果他能意识到伤害来源，能够朝其行走。如果约顿巨魔受到持续火焰伤害，他尝试一次@Check[flat|dc:15]检定来移除它。

Head Regrowth.name: 头部再生 Head Regrowth
Head Regrowth.description: 约顿巨魔的再生可以重新长出被切断的头。通过再生恢复生命值后，约顿巨魔尝试一次@Check[flat|dc:8]检定。成功时，一颗失去的头便会完全复原；大成功时，两颗失去的头完全复原。如果一只约顿巨魔失去了他最后的头，他就会立即死亡。

Reactive Heads.name: 敏锐头颅 Reactive Heads
Reactive Heads.description: 约顿巨魔在第一轮开始前每一轮都会为每颗头获得一个额外反应动作，这些反应动作只能用于使用颚进行反应打击或快速活吞。他不能对同一触发动作使用超过1个反应动作，即便该生物离开了其触及范围内的数个方格，且约顿巨人必须为每次反应打击使用不同的头。每当约顿巨魔一颗头被砍下，巨魔每轮便会失去1个额外反应动作。

Fast Swallow.name: 快速活吞 Fast Swallow
Fast Swallow.description:
触发 约顿巨魔用颚擒获一个生物

效果 巨魔使用活吞。

Ravenous Jaws.name: 贪食之颚 Ravenous Jaws
Ravenous Jaws.description: 约顿巨魔使用至多其头部数量的颚打击，每次对抗一个不同目标。这些攻击计入巨魔的多重攻击减值，但减值直到约顿巨魔完成所有这些攻击后才会增加。

Cacophonous Roar.name: 刺耳咆哮 Cacophonous Roar
Cacophonous Roar.description:
约顿巨魔用所有头发出一道刺耳的咆哮，带有可以扭曲听者意识的神秘力量。@Template[type:emanation|distance:100]内每个非巨魔生物必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:34|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied,inflicts:confused]豁免。约顿巨魔不能在1d4轮内再次使用刺耳咆哮。

大成功 生物不受影响，且临时免疫24小时。

成功 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，持续1轮。

失败 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}，持续1轮。

大失败 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]，持续1轮。

Jotund Troll.publicNotes:
约顿巨魔是巨大的九头骇物，徘徊在寒冷的沼泽，湿地和荒原，一向孤寂，永远暴怒。虽说约顿巨魔的九颗头的每一颗都有着各自的大脑和感官，但他们的争吵远少于双头巨魔那两颗头。尽管如此，这些头之间仍然还是会有争执，尤其是在让哪颗头吃东西这件事上。不过九张嘴都连通着同一个胃，这种进食上的争执其实没什么影响。许多学者都认同约顿巨魔形似最初巨魔的说法，即那些被放逐出极乐境，又因冒犯众神而被诅咒的泰坦们。然而约顿巨魔自身从未宣称拥有此等血统，而关注此类问题的学者则认为，所有巨魔之父诞生于外层裂隙。约顿巨魔个体要么以普通巨魔诞生，要么更为罕见地，由约顿巨魔父母所生。对约顿巨魔而言，他们的九颗头颅是统治的王冠，昭示着他们凌驾于自然秩序之上，不受其法则约束。

巨魔是张着流涎的巨口，有着剃刀般锋利爪子的高大蛮兽，贪婪的掠食者。他们与土地的联结不仅能重建躯体，更催生出无数变种，每种巨魔都映射着它们汲取能量的地形特征。迁徙至新领地的巨魔会随着身体各部位的再生而逐渐蜕变，新生的血肉与旧躯缠绕交织，最终导致畸形的生长。

Owb Prophet.name: Owb Prophet

Forsaken Patron.name: Forsaken Patron
Forsaken Patron.description:
Each owb prophet serves as a conduit to one of the shadowy demigods known as the Forsaken. Forsaken patrons are detailed below, and each grants the owb prophet additional abilities.

Each owb prophet gains its power through a connection with a Forsaken patron. The patron grants the owb additional spells and has its own religious symbol and favored weapons. Each entry notes any ability or occult innate spell the Forsaken grants to its prophets, plus its favored weapon.

Enkaar, the Malformed Prisoner This mutilated horror is the Forsaken patron of fetters, lethargy, and physical corruption.

  • Spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain} (4th, at will);
  • Favored Weapon spiked chain

Eyes That Watch This strange trio of feline eyes is the Forsaken patron of inferiority, cats, and strangers.

  • Ability @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]{Lifesense} 120 feet
  • Favored Weapon dagger

Grasping Iovett A beautiful form of indescribable variety, Iovett is the Forsaken patron of accidents, parasites, and reckless lust.

  • Spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} (4th, at will);
  • Favored Weapon shortsword

Husk This androgynous creature is the Forsaken patron of emptiness, loneliness, and narcissism.

  • Spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gIdDLrbswTV3OBJy]{Silence} (4th, at will);
  • Favored Weapon shortsword

Lady Razor This stern magistrate forbids showing kindness or mercy to family members. Lady Razor is the Forsaken patron of family strife, suspicion, and vengeance.

  • Spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8M03UxGXjYyDFAoy]{Weapon Storm} (4th, at will);
  • Favored Weapon dagger

Reshmit of the Heavy Voice Taking the form of a massive shadow, Reshmit is the Forsaken patron of broken things, forgetting, and unexpected violence.

  • Spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FhOaQDTSnsY7tiam]{Rewrite Memory} (4th, at will);
  • Favored Weapon morningstar

Thalaphyrr Martyr-Minder The Forsaken patron of failed heroics, imprisonment, and squandered time.

  • Spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow} (4th, at will);
  • Favored Weapon spear

Burning Cold Fusillade.name: Burning Cold Fusillade
Burning Cold Fusillade.description: The owb prophet makes three burning cold Strikes.

Clutching Cold.name: Clutching Cold
Clutching Cold.description: A creature hit by the prophet's burning cold Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} in a cluster of binding ice crystals ([[/act escape dc=31]]).

Curse of Darkness.name: Curse of Darkness
Curse of Darkness.description:
The owb inflicts a curse on one creature taking persistent cold damage from their burning cold Strike, stealing the victim's vibrancy. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save.

On a failure, the creature gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]{Light Blindness} and its coloration turns to washed out shades of gray, along with all equipment it carries, wields, or wears. These effects have an unlimited duration. Regardless of the result of its save, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

If the owb uses this ability on a caligni, the curse can't be removed short of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual or similar powerful magic.

Shadow's Swiftness.name: Shadow's Swiftness
Shadow's Swiftness.description: An owb prophet can Cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rxvS7EMJ7qmexAyA]{Umbral Journey} as a 3-action activity instead of 1 minute. If they do so, they target only themself.

Owb Prophet.publicNotes:
An owb who comes into contact and is chosen by one of the Forsaken gains a fragment of that demigod's power and forges a permanent connection with it. This act transforms the owb into a larger, more powerful creature and imbues it with the power of divine transference, allowing the owb to gain followers and grant spells to them. These are owb prophets.

Owb prophets may have some portion of the Forsaken's power, but they use their authority to gain more sway over calignis and other worshippers.

These ancient denizens of the Netherworld appear as grayish humanoid torsos covered in translucent funereal veils of shadow. Silent and mysterious, they float about, absent of legs to hold them aloft. Never speaking a word aloud, they instead reach into the minds of nearby creatures to whisper curses, threats, and strange bits of forlorn augury.

These haunting creatures are revered by calignis as proxies of the Forsaken—a strange array of ancestor-like demigods whom many calignis worship. Some even believe owbs are the Forsaken manifested, and that they are able to subtly manipulate creatures on the Netherworld without leaving behind any indication.

A multitude of owbs visit and even remain to advise caligni communities, as varied in personality as the Forsaken. All owbs share a hatred of light and color, except for the flickering glow of the burning cold magic they can hurl as a weapon. Owbs who live among calignis tend to prohibit the use of light and color, using their curse of darkness to quench violators if necessary. The only other similarity across all owbs is their entrenched desire to manipulate their charges through mind-reading and deception, though such manipulation can be either subtle or overt.

Dream Spider.name: Dream Spider

Web Sense.description: The dream spider has imprecise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
Web Sense.name: Web Sense

Dream Spider Venom.name: Dream Spider Venom
Dream Spider Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus stupefied 1 (1 round)

Web Trap.name: Web Trap
Web Trap.description: A creature hit by the dream spider's web attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it Escapes (DC 16).

Dream Spider.publicNotes:
A dream spider's webs have an iridescent hue and are infused with the same hallucinogenic compound as the creature's toxin. Originally denizens of tropical jungles, dream spiders have adapted well to temperate environments, particularly thriving among the rooftops of cities where shady alchemists use their venom to produce addictive drugs.

Spiders range dramatically in size, yet many are to some extent venomous.

Sordesdaemon.publicNotes: Sordesdaemons are hulks of sewage and daemonic flesh that embody death through pollution. They are among the newest types of daemons to appear on Golarion and are constantly surrounded by a cloud of foul mist that chokes living creatures. Sordesdaemons are fiendishly clever and often seek to inspire mortals with new ideas and inventions that despoil the environment. While these daemons are more than capable of ruining habitats on their own, they take great delight in encouraging mortals to do so themselves, as the act can eventually create new sordesdaemons. Once a given forest, river or other natural abode is completely polluted, a sordesdaemon often moves to claim it as their domain.
Sordesdaemon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Miasma of Pollution.name: Miasma of Pollution
Miasma of Pollution.description: 30 feet. A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn in it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure). Creatures in the aura can't reduce the value of the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute. Creatures made of water (such as water elementals) and plant creatures use an outcome one degree of success worse than the result of their save.

Pollution Infusion.name: Pollution Infusion
Pollution Infusion.description:
Non-fiend creatures adjacent to the afflicted creature take a -1 circumstance penalty to saving throws against disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 week)

Stage 5 dead.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.gORyINQLvplfthlm]{Effect: Pollution Infusion}

Retch of Foulness.name: Retch of Foulness
Retch of Foulness.description:
The sordesdaemon exhales a spray of sewage that deals @Damage[8d6[acid],8d6[poison]|options:area-damage]{8d6 acid damage and 8d6 poison damage} in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic|options:area-effect] save).

It can't use Retch of Foulness again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Retch of Foulness]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sordesdaemon.name: Sordesdaemon

Obcisidaemon.name: Obcisidaemon
Obcisidaemon.publicNotes: While war can have many facets, obcisidaemons care only for the brutality and violence that conflict brings. These devastating daemons seek only to destroy, leaving rubble and ash in their wake. Reflecting the mortal desire to fully eradicate one's enemy, obcisidaemons never intentionally leave a soul behind in their war paths. They claim the souls of those they slaughter, adding them to a profane cloak that seeps from their bodies as a clinging mist. Souls added to the cloak are unable to travel into the afterlife, and most obcisidaemons can hold only a handful of these souls at a time. Whenever an obcisidaemon's cloak is overburdened or during times when the fiend needs greater power, they consume a soul and receive rejuvenation or the might they need to cause further destruction.
Obcisidaemon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Cloak of Souls.name: Cloak of Souls
Cloak of Souls.description: An obcisidaemon is shrouded at all times in a cloak of captured souls. It can hold a number of souls equal to the daemon's Charisma modifier. Destroying the daemon frees the souls, though this doesn't return the deceased creatures to life. A creature whose soul is trapped within this cloak can't be resurrected except by a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similarly powerful magic.

Scorched Earth.name: Scorched Earth
Scorched Earth.description: 60 feet. Any creature who dies within the aura and isn't drawn into the obcisidaemon's Cloak of Souls via Inherit Soul must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save. On a failure, the creature's body (but not its gear) is immediately reduced to a fine smear of ashes.

Consume Soul.name: Consume Soul
Consume Soul.description:
The obcisidaemon consumes a soul from their cloak to gain one of the following effects. A soul consumed in this way can't be resurrected except by a wish ritual or a similarly powerful effect.

Empower Spell The obcisidaemon gains a +2 status bonus to their spell DCs and spell attack modifiers until the end of their next turn.

Empower Weapon The obcisidaemon's weapon gains the effects of a greater flaming, greater frost, greater shock, or wounding rune until the end of their next turn.

Healing (healing, vitality) The daemon regains @Damage[8d8+64[healing]] Hit Points.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.YOH7YsdlsLzlMu69]{Effect: Consume Soul}

Inherit Soul.name: Inherit Soul
Inherit Soul.description:
Trigger The obcisidaemon slays a creature

Effect The obcisidaemon attempts to draw the creature's soul into its cloak of souls. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save. On a failure, its soul is consumed and added to the cloak of souls. If the obcisidaemon's cloak can't hold any more souls, the daemon can release one of the souls as a free action; otherwise, the soul isn't absorbed.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Despair Dragon (Ancient).name: 古绝望龙 Despair Dragon (Ancient)

Fearsense.name: 恐惧感知 Fearsense
Fearsense.description: 绝望龙能够感知所有处于惊惧状态的生物，范围如上所述。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Consume Fear.name: 吞噬恐惧 Consume Fear
Consume Fear.description:
触发 绝望龙60尺内的一个生物失去惊惧状态

效果 绝望龙从失去惊惧状态的生物体内汲取恐惧，获得7d8临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Unbidden Thoughts.name: 无声思绪 Unbidden Thoughts
Unbidden Thoughts.description:
触发 绝望龙被武器或无武装攻击重击

效果 攻击者的心智被关于他们最深层恐惧的幻象所占据，导致感官超负荷。攻击者必须选择以下结果之一：该次攻击变为普通成功，或者该次攻击保持重击但攻击者陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

Draconic Frenzy.description: 绝望龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。
Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 绝望龙的打击重击时，恢复尖叫吐息的使用次数。

Look Behind You.name: 看你背后 Look Behind You
Look Behind You.description:
触发 绝望龙成功对一个90尺内的生物进行躲藏

效果 绝望龙传送至目标生物的正后方的空间。除非目标位置有掩蔽或其他可以保持@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]的方法，否则绝望龙会立即被侦测。

Shrieking Breath.name: 尖叫吐息 Shrieking Breath
Shrieking Breath.description: 绝望龙发出由它从恐惧敌人那里汲取的尖叫所组成的刺耳音波，在@Template[type:cone|distance:50]范围内造成@Damage[17d6[sonic]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。 豁免失败的生物必须在下一回合开始时将第一个动作用于尖叫。绝望龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Shrieking Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用尖叫吐息。

Tongue Decoy.name: 舌头诱饵 Tongue Decoy
Tongue Decoy.description:
绝望龙将其舌尖的数个囊泡充气，以制造出一个生物的基本形态。这个过程需要1分钟才能完成，在此期间绝望龙处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。如果绝望龙在此过程中停止或被打断，囊泡会泄气，绝望龙必须重新开始。一旦过程完成，绝望龙可以无限期保持充气状态，并且可以使用解消动作使囊泡泄气并收回舌头。

充气后的舌头呈现出动物或类人生物的基本形态，体型可以是小型或中型。该形态与生物的轮廓相似，但仔细检查并成功通过@Check[perception|dc:35]检定可以识别舌头的真面目。在充气时，绝望龙可以通过舌头发出声音，但保持舌头充气会让说话变得困难，导致绝望龙在任何与说话相关的检定上（如欺骗检定）受到-4环境减值。

绝望龙的舌头最多可以延伸90尺，并可以作为充气过程的一部分将舌头完全伸展。充气后的舌头部分可用一个动作（具有专注、操作和移动特征）将充气部分移动最多15尺。在延伸状态下，舌头的膨胀末端会占据一个相应体型生物的空间，但舌头的其余部分不会以任何方式阻碍或阻挡移动。绝望龙的灵敏嗅觉感觉可以通过舌尖的纤毛发挥作用，但除此之外，绝望龙没有其他途径感知舌头附近的事物。

攻击舌头视同攻击绝望龙本体，唯一不同的是舌头始终处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。如果舌头受到任何伤害，它会立即泄气并保持延伸状态。绝望龙会在舌头延伸时持续处于措手不及状态，但可以通过连续两个交互动作来收回舌头。如果舌头受到伤害，绝望龙在1天内无法使用舌头诱饵。

Despair Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes: 恐惧是最强烈的情感之一，而绝望龙是将恐惧和绝望之情引导为自己利益的高手。像其他异能龙一样，绝望龙也有一种与生俱来的冲动，那就是激起他人的恐惧。绝望龙通常会定居在城镇附近，以便从周围的恐惧中汲取力量。绝望龙的财宝中最常见的物品是卷轴、典籍和遗物，这些物品是它们研究的材料。通过这些，绝望龙能了解到当地的民间传说、都市传说等，从而更好地困扰它们的目标。

Planar Incarnation - Hell (The Damned).name: Planar Incarnation - Hell (The Damned)
Planar Incarnation - Hell (The Damned).description:
All shades are formed from and personify the nature of the plane on which they manifest, and their statistics are adjusted as summarized below. They also gain any trait associated with creatures from their plane.

Hell (The Damned) The damned look like terribly scarred or mutilated versions of their mortal selves.

  • Sanctification unholy
  • Language Diabolic
  • Additional Ability immune to fire
  • Melee jaws +7, Damage 1d8+2 piercing

Shade (Hell).name: Shade (Hell)
Shade (Hell).publicNotes:
The damned look like terribly scarred or mutilated versions of their mortal selves.

When a mortal dies, their soul travels to the Boneyard in the Outer Planes where they're judged by Pharasma, the goddess of the dead. Once judged, their soul is sent on to their final reward or punishment and, in the process, transformed into a creature known as a shade. This transformation grants the soul a new body, one whose shape is determined by the prevailing philosophical forces of the plane to which they're sent. A shade's memories from their former life usually fade, reduced to a few hazy fragments akin to half-remembered dreams. Regardless of the shade's size, power, or nature in life, they're a Medium creature in their afterlife.

Existence as a shade can last for eons but isn't necessarily eternal. Deities, powerful denizens of the Great Beyond, or even the Outer Planes can further alter a shade's nature by either reducing them into raw quintessence, spiritual essence that's then used to expand a plane's physical manifestation, or by transforming them into a new form of supernatural life such as a celestial, monitor, or fiend. Should a shade die, their body breaks down in a process akin to decay, their form reverting to the elements that make up their plane. This represents the true end of a soul's journey—their life essence reuniting with the heart of the Great Beyond to be recycled into Creation's Forge, fueling the creation of new souls.

Ayngavhaul.name: Ayngavhaul

Personal Library.name: Personal Library
Personal Library.description: Any tomes an ayngavhaul is reading or referencing for their current work can be stored in the devil's personal library, a floating collecting of tomes revolving around the devil that can be used offensively or defensively. Retrieving or returning a tome requires an Interact action.

Spellblock Tome.name: Spellblock Tome
Spellblock Tome.description:
Trigger The ayngavhaul is targeted by a spell

Effect The ayngavhaul flings a tome from its personal library at the spell. The devil must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:5]. On a success, the tome fully absorbs the effects of the spell and burns up into a harmless pile of ash. Regardless of the result, the devil can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge this ability]]{1d4 rounds}.

Herald Heresy.name: Herald Heresy
Herald Heresy.description:
The ayngavhaul imparts blasphemous thoughts into the minds of all non-devil creatures within a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] up to 60 feet away. An affected creature takes @Damage[2d10[mental]|options:area-damage] damage plus @Damage[2d10[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:slowed] save. Affected creatures gain a cumulative +1 circumstance bonus (up to a total of +4) to saves against all future attempts to Herald Heresy for 1 minute, as they become inured to the blasphemies.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}.

Poison Minds.name: Poison Minds
Poison Minds.description: Creatures hit by the ayngavhaul's searing words must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:33|options:inflicts:stupefied] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure). If the target is trained in Religion, they take a –2 circumstance penalty to their save.

Ayngavhaul.publicNotes:
Where a bright mind seeking knowledge becomes corrupted by eloquent lies and twisted truths, an ayngavhaul is sure to lurk. Often donned in the holy vestments of other faiths in a twisted mockery of their principles, these wily, well-read devils delight in using their knowledge to twist religious texts and teachings into the dangerous principles those same texts warn against. While many ayngavhauls develop advanced knowledge of unique specializations, there are many whose depth of knowledge of a single religion rivals that of even the most wizened priests.

Any information an ayngavhaul has read or learned is added to a massive living tome unique to the ayngavhaul. The information contained sorts itself based on the topic and point its owner is making.

While these devils spend most of their time in the libraries of Hell, they are most often summoned in desperate bids by students seeking lost or forbidden knowledge, and such knowledge comes with a cost. These devils use truths and loose interpretations of texts to lend credence to their heretical viewpoints. When these once-bright intellectuals are corrupted into blasphemous priests, tyrants, and despots spreading the twisted words of an ayngavhaul, that devil gains influence and renown within the scholarly circles of Hell.

Shade (Nirvana).name: Shade (Nirvana)

Planar Incarnation - Nirvana (The Cleans.name: Planar Incarnation - Nirvana (The Cleansed)
Planar Incarnation - Nirvana (The Cleans.description:
All shades are formed from and personify the nature of the plane on which they manifest, and their statistics are adjusted as summarized below. They also gain any trait associated with creatures from their plane.

Nirvana (The Cleansed) The cleansed take on animal forms that match their personalities in life.

  • Sanctification holy
  • Language Empyrean
  • Additional Ability speed 35 feet
  • Melee claw +7, Damage 1d8+2 slashing

Shade (Nirvana).publicNotes:
The cleansed take on animal forms that match their personalities in life.

When a mortal dies, their soul travels to the Boneyard in the Outer Planes where they're judged by Pharasma, the goddess of the dead. Once judged, their soul is sent on to their final reward or punishment and, in the process, transformed into a creature known as a shade. This transformation grants the soul a new body, one whose shape is determined by the prevailing philosophical forces of the plane to which they're sent. A shade's memories from their former life usually fade, reduced to a few hazy fragments akin to half-remembered dreams. Regardless of the shade's size, power, or nature in life, they're a Medium creature in their afterlife.

Existence as a shade can last for eons but isn't necessarily eternal. Deities, powerful denizens of the Great Beyond, or even the Outer Planes can further alter a shade's nature by either reducing them into raw quintessence, spiritual essence that's then used to expand a plane's physical manifestation, or by transforming them into a new form of supernatural life such as a celestial, monitor, or fiend. Should a shade die, their body breaks down in a process akin to decay, their form reverting to the elements that make up their plane. This represents the true end of a soul's journey—their life essence reuniting with the heart of the Great Beyond to be recycled into Creation's Forge, fueling the creation of new souls.

Garadasura.publicNotes: Garadasuras are massive ophidian spirits who hold to duties of guardianship and butchery. Many are former naga who have given up on their role of stewards of reality and instead turned their efforts to reversing the act of creation. Garadasuras often continue the duties they had as naga but can also turn destructive, rampaging with the force of an entire poisonous legion.

Encircling Aura.description: 50 feet. A garadasura exudes a 50-foot aura whenever it remains motionless for at least 1 round. If the garadasura has the holy trait, all allied creatures within the area gain a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws. If the garadasura has the unholy trait, all unallied creatures that enter this area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30] save or spend their next action to move toward the garadasura's location. If the garadasura moves, the efect ends for all currently afected creatures.
Encircling Aura.name: Encircling Aura

Butchering Venom.name: Butchering Venom
Butchering Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 hour

Glorious Visage.name: Glorious Visage
Glorious Visage.description: The asura sanctifes themselves as either holy or unholy, gaining the trait corresponding to their choice and losing the opposing trait; their strikes, spells, and abilities also gain the trait corresponding to their choice. The asura also gains weakness 10 to the opposing sanctifcation and loses any weakness to its chosen sanctifcation. The choice is permanent until the asura uses this ability to change their sanctifcation.

Slither.name: Slither
Slither.description: The garadasura Strides or Swims up to half its Speed, pulling any creatures it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with it.

Garadasura.name: Garadasura

Top-Heavy.name: Top-Heavy
Top-Heavy.description: A spiral centurion's top-like design makes it susceptible to effects that would cause it to fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The DC of any attempt to knock the spiral centurion prone is reduced by 5. If the spiral centurion attempts a check or saving throw to resist being knocked prone, it takes a –5 status penalty. A spiral centurion that has been knocked prone can't use any actions other than to attempt to Stand, but it must succeed at a @Check[acrobatics|dc:30] check to do so.

Hurl Blade.name: Hurl Blade
Hurl Blade.description:
The spiral centurion hurls one of its blades with an angled spin to ensure a swooping flight path. The blade deals @Damage[6d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in a @Template[type:line|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save).

At the start of the spiral centurion's next turn, the blade swoops around and returns along the same flight path, again dealing @Damage[6d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save) to each creature along the same line.

Rev Up.name: Rev Up
Rev Up.description:
Requirements The spiral centurion hasn't acted yet this turn

Effect The spiral centurion Strides up to its Speed. It then gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls until the end of its turn.

Whirling Death.name: Whirling Death
Whirling Death.description: The spiral centurion spins furiously in place, its blades extended to slice through nearby creatures. It makes up to five melee blade Strikes. No single creature can be targeted by more than one blade Strike during one use of this ability. These attacks count toward the spiral centurion's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks are made.

Spiral Centurion.name: Spiral Centurion
Spiral Centurion.publicNotes:
These mechanical constructs were created to serve as guardians in an ancient and bygone era, although exactly who made them and the secrets of their construction have long since been lost to history.
