Any creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the slithering pit falls in and is no longer grabbed, even if it was outside the pit squares.

While a Dimensional Pit is open, the slithering pit is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, can't be forced to move, and can make pseudopod Strikes originating from the walls of the pit. A creature that starts its turn at the bottom of the pit takes @Damage[2d6[acid]] damage. Climbing the walls of the pit requires a @Check[athletics|dc:22] check.

When the slithering pit dies, the Dimensional Pit closes and creatures inside are ejected, with the effects of Out You Go.

Flurry of Pods.name: Flurry of Pods
Flurry of Pods.description: The slithering pit makes a single pseudopod Strike against each target within range it doesn't already have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. These attacks count toward the slithering pit's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all of these attacks.

Out You Go.name: Out You Go
Out You Go.description: The slithering pit closes all pit spaces it created using Dimensional Pit, ejecting all its occupants onto the ground into random free spaces where the pit opened. Each occupant takes @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

Slithering Pit.name: Slithering Pit
Slithering Pit.publicNotes:
A slithering pit is a strange, nearly invisible ooze with an extradimensional space for its digestive system, which mimics the appearance of an acid-filled stone pit. It slowly dissolves its captives in stomach acid until they can be digested. A slithering pit can go weeks without feeding, affording it patience.

Thriving in dilapidated areas, the slithering pit takes up position among the plentiful potholes where it can easily pass for just another blemish. It crawls across ramshackle cobblestone streets and damp underground complexes, waiting for unwary prey to stumble by and fall in.

Devastating Blast.name: 毁灭爆震 Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description:
死墓骑士上尉释放出@Template[cone|distance:30]能量。区域内的生物受到@Damage[4d12[acid]|options:area-damage]伤害，@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect]豁免。

死墓骑士上尉在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4轮}内无法使用此能力。

Weapon Master.description: 死墓骑士无论持用何种武器，均可以使用该武器的重击专精效果。
Weapon Master.name: 武器大师 Weapon Master

Graveknight's Shield.name: 死墓骑士盾牌 Graveknight's Shield
Graveknight's Shield.description: 死墓骑士的诅咒延伸至它们的盾牌上，或者死墓骑士护甲用自己的一部分来制造一面盾牌。死墓骑士有一面盾牌，其使用等级不高于死墓骑士等级-1的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.f9ygr5Cjrmop8LWV]的数据。盾牌准独立于死墓骑士，并会自动保护死墓骑士不受伤害。当这面盾牌被举起时，它会自动使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.m4HQ2o5aPxjXf2kY]来减少每轮第一次对死墓骑士的攻击造成的伤害，死墓骑士无需为这次格挡花费反应动作。盾牌会自动和死墓骑士的剩余部分一起复生，想要摧毁它必须用和摧毁死墓骑士护甲同样的方式。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: 当死墓骑士被摧毁时，其护甲会在[[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10天}内重塑身体——若护甲被活着的宿主穿戴则会更加迅速（见上面帖子中的死墓骑士护甲）。若身体在此之前被破坏，重塑过程将重新开始。只有摧毁护甲（比如使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]）、把死墓骑士传送至创世熔炉、或者丢进火山之中才能够永久摧毁死墓骑士。

Graveknight's Curse.name: 死墓骑士诅咒 Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
诅咒会影响任何穿戴死墓骑士护甲超过1小时以上的生物。

豁免骰 @Check[will|dc:24]

潜伏期 1小时

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}且无法脱下盔甲（1天）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，速度承受-10尺状态减值，且无法脱下盔甲（1天）

阶段3 死亡并转化为盔甲的死墓骑士

Ruinous Weapons.name: 破灭武器 Ruinous Weapons
Ruinous Weapons.description: 死墓骑士所持用的任意武器或无武装攻击均获得+1强击和侵蚀武器符文的效果。

Graveknight Captain.name: 死墓骑士上尉 Graveknight Captain
Graveknight Captain.publicNotes:
死墓骑士上尉们曾经骄傲地带领着一队队的军队参加战斗。

死墓骑士是由被诅咒的铠甲赋予不死身的亡灵战士。

Resurrection Dragon (Ancient).name: 古复生龙 Resurrection Dragon (Ancient)

Reawaken!.name: 醒来！ Reawaken!
Reawaken!.description:
触发 复生龙能看到的一个活物死亡

效果 复生龙利用神术与生命能量将灵魂重新连接到已死躯壳。该自愿生物将以其最大生命值的一半的状态复活。每个生物只能被此能力复生一次。

Risen Commander.name: 复生指挥官 Risen Commander
Risen Commander.description: 复生龙与它的仆从有着强烈的联系，复生龙每回合可以用一个自由动作维持@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hghGRzOSzEl4UXdS]。

Siphon Life.name: 生命吸取 Siphon Life
Siphon Life.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物使用了一个恢复生命值的治疗效果

效果 复生龙将命能从该效果中引导开，从而将其影响降到最低。触发恢复生命值效果的所有掷骰取最小值，并且任何恢复生命值的固定值（如两动作治疗法术的附加生命值）都会被减半。然后，复生龙获得3d8临时生命值，持续1轮。

Arise!.name: 重生！ Arise!
Arise!.description:
复生龙利用其对命能的精通将其灵魂投射到骨园，并将一个自愿生物的灵魂拉回到其躯体，整个过程需要1小时。这具有死者复活的效果，但目标的最大等级为13级，且灵魂与复生龙的灵魂连接。一次只能有一个生物与复生龙的灵魂连接。如果目标与复生龙不在同一位面或复生龙死亡，则复生生物会死亡，且无法再用重生！能力复生。复生龙可以随时解消该连接。如此做并不会阻止复生龙再次对该生物使用重生！能力。

当以这种方式复生后，该生物仍然可以被死者复活、复生及类似效果选为目标。这会使其完全恢复生命，解除与复生龙的连接，并允许复生龙与另一个生物建立连接。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 复生龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 复生龙的打击重击时会恢复其汲魂吐息的充能。

Necro Puppeteer.name: 死灵傀儡 Necro Puppeteer
Necro Puppeteer.description: 复生龙将能量注入一个60尺内它能看到的不死生物、濒死生物或尸体中。复生龙将目标生物移动30尺，并使其在@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]范围内释放一股虚能波动，造成@Damage[6d8[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。

Soul Siphoning Breath.name: 汲魂吐息 Soul Siphoning Breath
Soul Siphoning Breath.description: 复生龙释放一股神圣能量，在@Template[type:cone|distance:50]范围内造成@Damage[15d6[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect]豁免），并从范围内的生物身上汲取生命之力。复生龙获得快速治疗15，直到其汲魂吐息重新充能。复生龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Soul Siphoning Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用汲魂吐息。

Resurrection Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes: 复生龙徘徊于生与死之间。它们精通命能，使得它们能够将死者复生，同时也精通虚能，能够赋予他人死亡。它们利用这些能力戏弄凡人的生命，召唤灵魂来帮助自己，或复生它们认为重要或有趣的生物。复生龙的巢穴通常是一个荒凉之地。虽然它们像其他龙一样囤积财富，但它们几乎不装饰自己的巢穴，财宝通常被存放在黑暗的角落里，仿佛它们对自己的财物毫不在乎。然而，复生龙倾向于保留从复生的生物或计划复生的生物那里得到的纪念物，而这些物品会特别安全地保管。

Soul Journey.name: 灵魂之旅 Soul Journey
Soul Journey.description: 安魂龙花费1小时穿越位面通道进入灵魂之河，然后可以到达灵魂之河的任意位置。这具备@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]效果，但安魂龙能够精确到达任何主要位面上的地点。

Status Sight.name: 状态视觉 Status Sight
Status Sight.description: 安魂龙会自动知晓它能看到的所有生物的生命值。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: 对抗神术全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Soul Anchor.name: 灵魂锚定 Soul Anchor
Soul Anchor.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物的生命值将降至0

效果 安魂龙将触发生物的灵魂锚定于其躯体，该生物的生命值保持在1点，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，并获得与安魂龙等级相等的快速治疗，持续1分钟。该生物在24小时内暂时免疫灵魂锚定效果。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.k8bmDh3nWi2FUyz5]

Withhold Death.name: 阻止死亡 Withhold Death
Withhold Death.description:
触发 安魂龙被一次攻击重击

效果 安魂龙抵抗灵魂的松动，减少部分伤害。安魂针对触发攻击获得20点所有伤害类型的抗力。

Dooming Breath.name: 毁灭吐息 Dooming Breath
Dooming Breath.description: 安魂龙从口中喷出来自创生熔炉的能量，在@Template[type:line|distance:120]范围内造成@Damage[16d8[spirit]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免失败的不死生物还必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:42|options:area-effect,inflicts:doomed]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。如果目标已陷入毁灭，则毁灭值增加1（最多为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 4}）。安魂龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dooming Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用毁灭吐息。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 安魂龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 安魂龙的打击重击时会恢复毁灭吐息的充能。

Redirect River.name: 河流改道 Redirect River
Redirect River.description: 安魂龙利用自己的身体作为连接引导灵魂之河的一部分。河流在安魂龙周围涌动，形成@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]区域的灵性激流，持续1轮，该区域对其他所有生物视为困难地形。此外，在区域内开始回合或每轮首次进入区域的生物必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:drained,inflicts:doomed]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{力竭 Drained 1}与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。如果目标已处于流失或毁灭状态，则其状态值增加1（最多为4）。安魂龙可以维持此效果。

Soul Shield.name: 灵魂护盾 Soul Shield
Soul Shield.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 安魂龙利用其生命精华在60尺内的一个生物周围创造出一个精魂能量护盾。此护盾与生物建立了一个连接，效果与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d7Lwx6KAs47MtF0q]相似，区别在于该效果不会因距离而中断，并持续1小时。此外，该生物获得对物理和精魂伤害的10点抗力，适用于其所承受伤害的一半。安魂龙可以解消该效果。

Requiem Dragon (Ancient).name: 古安魂龙 Requiem Dragon (Ancient)
Requiem Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes: 安魂龙是灵魂之河（River of Souls）的守护者，负责引导灵魂抵达其在来世的最终归宿。灵魂的安全旅程对安魂龙至关重要，一些安魂龙会从灵魂首次进入灵魂之河开始，直到它们在骨园的审判，最终引导灵魂到达它们最终的安息之地。大多数安魂龙将自己与特定的位面绑定，负责守护所有进入该位面的灵魂，导致这些龙与天堂或地狱等地方相关联，尽管这些龙从不对这些位面宣誓效忠。安魂龙将它们的巢穴建在灵魂之河沿岸——这些巢穴是从其他位面拯救出来的沉重建筑拼接而成——并充满了无价的记录和伟大成就的纪念物。

Entropy's Shadow.name: Entropy's Shadow
Entropy's Shadow.description: 40 feet. Sykevers leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the sykever.

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A sykever caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Change Posture.name: Change Posture
Change Posture.description: The sykever changes between their bipedal and quadrupedal stance. In their bipedal stance, the sykever can use all the abilities in their stat block except Horned Rush. In their quadrupedal stance, the sykever has a Speed of 80 feet but can't make arm spike Strikes, Disarm, cast spells, or use Crush Item.

Crush Item.name: Crush Item
Crush Item.description:
Trigger The sykever gets a critical success to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}

Requirements The sykever is in their bipedal stance

Effect The sykever snatches the item and pierces it with their arm spikes. The item becomes broken and falls to the ground in the sykever's space. Items that are already broken aren't further damaged, and an item with 14 or higher Hardness is unaffected.

Draining Gaze.name: Draining Gaze
Draining Gaze.description:
The sykever fixes their nightmarish gaze on one creature they can see, who must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save. Regardless of the result, the target is temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round if the sykever is in bipedal stance, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 round if the sykever is in quadrupedal stance.

Failure As success, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3}, and the effect lasts 10 minutes.

Horned Rush.name: Horned Rush
Horned Rush.description:
Requirements The sykever is in their quadrupedal stance

Effect The sykever Strides and then makes a horn Strike.

Sykever.name: Sykever
Sykever.publicNotes:
The most common darvakkas are sykevers, walkers in the night. Bloodthirsty but calculating, they lead legions of dead into battle on the Material Plane, working toward the simple goal of ending all life.

Darvakkas, also called nightshades, are a ravenous evil made up of equal parts darkness and malice. Originally creatures of the Outer Planes who travel to the convergence of the Shadow Plane and the Void—where the power of nothingness obliterates them—these undead abominations are the physical embodiment of entropy. They burn with an intense hatred for all life, working to bring a final, dark night to the Material Plane where nothing but ash and ice remain.

As creatures twisted by darkness and shadow, darvakkas have a great aversion to sunlight and all sources of vitality energy. On the Material Plane, they spend the hours of daylight hidden below ground, amid ruins, or submerged deep in the ocean's darkest chasms beyond the reach of the sun's rays, emerging when darkness shelters them overhead.

Darvakkas have an aura of entropy that attracts undead thralls to serve as warriors and heralds. They rarely seek alliances with each other or other creatures, existing in solitude as the heads of individual armies of the dead.

Magic Sense.name: 魔法感知 Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: 符文龙能感知到列出范围内所有激活的魔法能力与效果。当符文龙进行搜寻时，它在列出范围内获得4环级侦测魔法法术的效果（此外还获得搜寻的正常好处）。

equipment-Common runes of 9th level or l.name: 刻在鳞片上的常见符文（9级或更低） Common runes of 9th level or lower etched upon their scales

Runic Scales.name: 符文鳞片 Runic Scales
Runic Scales.description: 符文龙的鳞片作为符文石存在。符文龙不能使用蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文的效果或能力，但它们可以将其转移到适当的物品上。以这种方式向物品转移或从物品上转移一个符文需要1分钟，在此期间符文龙处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。该过程自动完成无需检定，但如果符文龙在此过程中停止或受到打扰，符文将被摧毁。符文龙可以在其鳞片上蚀刻任意数量的符文，但它们通常一次只在鳞片上蚀刻少数符文。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Canceling Rune.name: 抵消符文 Canceling Rune
Canceling Rune.description:
触发 符文龙成为一个需要豁免的法术的目标

效果 符文龙尝试瓦解法术的基础符文。它尝试反制该法术（反制环级7环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+26 #Counteract]]{+26}）。若成功，符文龙不受该法术影响；其他目标正常受到该法术影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Canceling Rune]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用抵消符文。

Retributive Rune.name: 惩戒符文 Retributive Rune
Retributive Rune.description:
触发 一个15尺内的生物对符文龙造成伤害

效果 伴随着符文魔法的爆发，符文龙对触发生物使用爆裂符文能力，若符文未自动引爆则立即将其引爆。

Detonating Rune.name: 爆裂符文 Detonating Rune
Detonating Rune.description: 符文龙的打击与能力可以在目标身上留下一个爆裂符文。如果一个生物在已经拥有一个爆裂符文的情况下将要获得另一个爆裂符文，则不会新增一个符文，而是会激活其当前的爆裂符文，消耗该符文并对目标造成@Damage[5d6[untyped]]伤害。爆裂符文的伤害类型与符文龙当前变幻符文的类型一致。生物可以使用一个交互动作移除该符文。如果爆裂符文没有引爆，则在1分钟后消散。

Entangling Rune.name: 束缚符文 Entangling Rune
Entangling Rune.description: 符文龙在60尺内创造一个@Template[type:burst|distance:10]范围的大型陷阱符文。除符文龙外的任何生物进入该区域或在其中结束回合时，会激活符文并受到束缚。该生物必须通过@Check[reflex|dc:34]豁免，否则将被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]1分钟或直到其成功逃脱。该符文每次只能束缚一个生物。符文在生物豁免成功、逃脱成功或1分钟后消散。与符文相邻的生物可以使用一个交互动作来移除符文。

Runic Breath.name: 符文吐息 Runic Breath
Runic Breath.description: 符文龙释放数百枚一触即爆的符文，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[12d6[untyped]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。此能力的伤害类型由变幻符文决定。豁免失败的生物还会受到爆裂符文的影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Runic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用符文吐息。

Shifting Runes.name: 变幻符文 Shifting Runes
Shifting Runes.description: 符文龙选择酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰或音波伤害类型。蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文随之变幻，形成该能量类型的符文。符文龙获得对该伤害类型的免疫，且其爆裂符文与符文吐息均造成该类型伤害。任何在奥法上受训的生物无需检定即可立即识别蚀刻符文的能量类型。

Improved Push 10 feet.name: 精通推离10尺 Improved Push 10 feet

Rune Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: 成年符文龙施法者 Rune Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Rune Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 符文龙天生对符文的力量有着深刻的洞察。大多数符文龙的鳞片上刻有各种符文，它们的身体可以魔法般地增强这些符文的力量。符文龙通常不自己施法，而是依靠它们即兴创造符文的能力来产生所需的效果。符文龙常常把自己的财宝称为图书馆，因为它们的财宝中充满了由不同文化的人们使用多种语言写成的重要历史文献、戏剧、演讲、教科书和法术书。尽管它们通常可以借助魔法说某种语言，但它们更喜欢在讲者的语境中学习语言，以便理解其中隐藏的细微差别和符号中的魔力。

Scimitar Blitz.name: Scimitar Blitz
Scimitar Blitz.description: The desert giant Strides up to their Speed, Striking once with each of their scimitars at any point during the movement.

Sand Spin.name: Sand Spin
Sand Spin.description:
Requirements The desert giant is standing in sandy terrain

Effect The desert giant spins around and stirs up loose sand in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10]. Until the beginning of the giant's next turn, creatures in the area are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and other creatures are concealed to them.

Sandwalking.name: Sandwalking
Sandwalking.description: Desert giants have adapted to the loose sands of the desert and can move across them with ease. Desert giants ignore non-magical difficult terrain and uneven ground caused by sand.

Desert Giant.name: Desert Giant
Desert Giant.publicNotes:
Desert giants are nomadic humanoids who have dwelled in the world's most arid regions since time immemorial. Smaller peoples know that desert giants are the undisputed masters of desert living. Desert giants' strong cultural traditions play a large part in their ability to prosper in such harsh environs. Desert giant elders encourage their descendants to maintain abstemious lifestyles, particularly with regard to the consumption of food and drink. Most desert giants follow a simple vegetarian diet and maintain an incredible internal map of their home region's seasonal waterways and oases. Desert giants stand 15 feet tall, tending toward lean physiques that are ideal for traveling across vast expanses of sand for long sojourns.

Spread across the world, giants are as diverse as the isolated places they inhabit. A giant makes a big impression on the local environment, especially on smaller and weaker creatures.

Whip Drain.name: Whip Drain
Whip Drain.description:
Requirements The sumbreiva has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with their shadow whip

Effect The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} on a critical failure). If the creature is already drained, this increases its drained value instead, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

Hunter's Triumph.name: Hunter's Triumph
Hunter's Triumph.description:
Trigger The sumbreiva kills a creature

Effect The sumbreiva lets out a triumphant, bone-chilling howl. Every enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} (and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} as long as it's frightened on a critical failure).

Claim Trophy.name: Claim Trophy
Claim Trophy.description: The sumbreiva claims the soul of a creature they killed within the last minute. This works like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul}, except that no black sapphire is required, and the soul is turned into a glowing blue light called a soul trophy. Anyone who kills the sumbreiva can then free the soul from any soul trophy by touching it and speaking the word for "freedom" in any language.

Huntblade Brutality.name: Huntblade Brutality
Huntblade Brutality.description: The sumbreiva's huntblade deals an additional 2d8 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Sumbreiva.name: Sumbreiva
Sumbreiva.publicNotes:
Sumbreivas are the Void's unstoppable hunters, tracking down and destroying other creatures on their plane for sport and practice. Occasionally, they pass through a rift or are brought to the Universe via a binding circle, where they collect living souls to display as trophies.

Sumbreivas gather at Night Lodges, where they train and display their soul trophies, which appear as floating wisps of blue energy. The more formidable the soul, the more intense the blue glow that emanates from it. Sumbreivas in lodges periodically raid the Universe on a Night Hunt and compete to see who can bring back the most brilliant soul trophies. The winner of the Night Hunt leads the lodge until the next hunt. Night Lodges are ranked against each other by the accomplishments of the hunters within. All sumbreivas desire to capture a soul powerful enough to earn them placement in the Twilight Lodge, reserved for the truly elite souls and hunters.

Kimenhul.name: Kimenhul

Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.name: Spell Effect: Hidden Mind
Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]{Hidden Mind}

You gain a +4 status bonus to saves against mental effects.

Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
Easy to Call.description: A kimenhul's level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle} ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM's discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

Feed on Fear.name: Feed on Fear
Feed on Fear.description: The kimenhul regains @Damage[30[healing]] Hit Points at the start of its turn as long as any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature is within @Template[emanation|distance:100]{100 feet} of it.

Reactive Strike (Special).name: Reactive Strike (Special)
Reactive Strike (Special).description:
If the triggering creature is frightened, the kimenhul can make two claw Strikes against the creature instead of one Strike.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Eternal Fear.name: Eternal Fear
Eternal Fear.description:
The kimenhul contorts its faces and presents itself to its enemies in a terrifying and traumatic display that causes lingering fear. Each creature within 100 feet that can observe the kimenhul must make a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

They are then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} as long as it's frightened. Even after recovering from the initial experience, the trauma is lodged in the target's mind for 1 year. Once per day, the kimenhul can communicate telepathically with the target for 1 minute as long as both creatures are on the same plane. Any time a creature under the effect of Eternal Fear is in a stressful situation (such as combat or intense social pressure), they must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] check or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. While Eternal Fear lasts, the target always becomes fleeing as long as it's frightened, regardless of the source of the fear. The target can attempt a new saving throw each week to remove these effects, but they can otherwise be removed only by powerful magic such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effects are permanent and the target doesn't get to attempt a weekly save to end the effect.

Frightening Flurry.name: Frightening Flurry
Frightening Flurry.description: The kimenhul makes one jaws Strike and two claw Strikes against a single target, in any order. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} with a condition value equal to the number of Strikes that hit it, to a maximum of frightened 3 if all three Strikes hit.

Skip Between.name: Skip Between
Skip Between.description: The sahkil moves from the Universe to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa. While in the Ethereal Plane, they're unable to affect anything in the Universe, and they cannot be seen by beings or abilities in the Universe, unless these have an ability that can gaze into the Ethereal Plane. While on the Material Plane the inverse is true for anything on the Ethereal Plane. A summoned sahkil can't use Skip Between.

Snatch Between.name: Snatch Between
Snatch Between.description: When using Skip Between, the kimenhul can bring along any creatures it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Unsettled Mind.name: Unsettled Mind
Unsettled Mind.description: Any creature affected by any of a kimenhul's mental spells or abilities becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for the duration of that effect and for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Stupefied]]{1d4 rounds} thereafter.

Kimenhul.publicNotes:
Among the strongest of their kind aside from the sahkil tormentors, kimenhuls work their craft to foment despair in those who fear failure, forming cycles of self-loathing. These powerful sahkils focus their attention on mortals who are seemingly at the peak of their ability yet harbor secret fears of inadequacy. A kimenhul's predations can leave an indelible mark on its victims. The kimenhul whispers threats and sends fears of crushing failure to its prey, seemingly originating from their own minds, a trauma that can be difficult to bear without help. These sahkils torment their prey as long as the hapless victims live, using their Eternal Fear ability every day to psychically remind their previous victims of their failings.

Some unique kimenhuls find themselves in a position of leadership in Xibalba, where they carve out their own small kingdoms and direct groups of sahkils to help them find mortals to torment. They rule these nightmare kingdoms through terror, often delighting in tormenting new petitioners or scheming ways to work against their immortal foes.

Ages ago, when this cycle of the multiverse was still adolescent, a cabal of psychopomps who already felt bored and restrained in their role of ushering souls to their ultimate resting place rebelled against their station. It was this corruption of the cycle of souls that spawned the first sahkils.

Ambivalent to the prescribed order of the multiverse and spiteful of mortals, sahkils delight in spreading fear and unease to all beings, clogging up the metaphysical cycle with anxiety-ridden mortals too scared to achieve their potential. These fiends have drastically changed from their dedicated psychopomp predecessors. They are creatures of spite and torment, fear and disgust. They exploit the most common and rare fears for their own perverse satisfaction, and they want nothing more than to frighten mortals and make them question their reason for existence.

Most sahkils lurk on the Ethereal Plane, but they frequently invade the Material Plane to torment mortals and spread terror. They use their innate ability to slip between the veils of the Ethereal and Material effortlessly, often stalking their targets for days or weeks before enacting their devious plots.

Brutal Sweep.description:
需求 冰巨魔正持用一把短柄斧

效果 巨魔挥扫短兵斧划出巨大弧线，对@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]范围内所有生物造成@Damage[3d6[slashing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。
Brutal Sweep.name: 蛮力横扫 Brutal Sweep

Ice Passage.name: 冰面穿行 Ice Passage
Ice Passage.description: 霜巨魔不会被因冰雪造成的困难地形阻碍，也不需要尝试特技检定来避免因冰滑而跌倒。

Easily Misled.name: 易受误导 Easily Misled
Easily Misled.description: 冰巨魔在对抗欺骗检定时察觉DC承受-4环境减值。

Regeneration 15 (Deactivated by Fire or.name: 再生15（火焰或音波使其无效） Regeneration 15 (Deactivated by Fire or Sonic)

Furious Carve.name: 狂暴凿刻 Furious Carve
Furious Carve.description:
触发 冰巨魔受到火焰或音波伤害

效果 冰巨魔对触及范围内一个随机生物进行一次短柄斧或爪打击。如果冰巨魔受到持续火焰伤害，他尝试一次@Check[flat|dc:15]检定来移除它。

Ice Troll.name: 冰巨魔 Ice Troll
Ice Troll.publicNotes:
冰巨魔是噩梦般的冰冻怪物，他们的利爪沾满雾凇，獠牙覆满霜霜，出没于冰川、山脉和冻原。永无止境的饥饿驱使他们追逐麋鹿群、海豹群和人类村落。那些被封存在浮冰或永久冻土中的冰巨魔，在经历数月、数年甚至数十年的饥渴折磨后，终能在冰层融化之际破冰而出。

巨魔是张着流涎的巨口，有着剃刀般锋利爪子的高大蛮兽，贪婪的掠食者。他们与土地的联结不仅能重建躯体，更催生出无数变种，每种巨魔都映射着它们汲取能量的地形特征。迁徙至新领地的巨魔会随着身体各部位的再生而逐渐蜕变，新生的血肉与旧躯缠绕交织，最终导致畸形的生长。

Ash Giant.name: Ash Giant
Ash Giant.publicNotes:
Rugged and covered in pustules and sores from wandering harsh wastelands, ash giants dwell in the unwelcoming wilderness. Their lives are difficult, hardening them into utterly vicious, capricious, and cruel creatures. Their sadistic sense of humor and love for pranks makes them hated by almost all humanoids they encounter. Despite being crass and rough, ash giants are survivors above all, and they use their ingenuity to craft weapons, traps, harnesses for mounts, and tools. If the aim is cruelty, brutality, or a prank, an ash giant will find a way to craft the tools they need. Piggy clods are a favorite construction—contraptions of scrap iron and other metals rigged into a ball that explodes on impact.

Spread across the world, giants are as diverse as the isolated places they inhabit. A giant makes a big impression on the local environment, especially on smaller and weaker creatures.
Ash Giant.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. disease

Vermin Empathy.name: Vermin Empathy
Vermin Empathy.description: The ash giant can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with insects, arachnids, and similar creatures.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease

Tumor Pop.name: Tumor Pop
Tumor Pop.description: When the ash giant takes piercing damage while they have a swollen tumor, the tumor explodes automatically, with the effect of Blastboil.

Blastboil.name: Blastboil
Blastboil.description: The ash giant pops one of the massive, swollen pustules on their body. Each creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] takes @Damage[5d8[poison]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:sickened] save. A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). This ability and tumor pop can't be used again until another tumor swells to a suitable size in [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Gore Grinder.name: Gore Grinder
Gore Grinder.description:
Requirements The ash giant's last action was a successful war flail Strike

Effect The ash giant wraps the chain of the flail around the target and grinds its flesh. The creature takes @Damage[2d10[slashing],2d8[persistent,bleed]]{2d8 slashing damage and 2d8 persistent bleed damage} with a @Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save.

Tangle-Topple.name: Tangle-Topple
Tangle-Topple.description: The ash giant makes a piggy clod Strike. If it hits, the target is tangled in ragged scrap. It's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, can't leave the ground, and falls to the ground if it's flying. This ends if the creature [[/act escape]]{Escapes} or the metal is [[/act force-open dc=28]]{Forced Open}.

Burning Swarm.name: Burning Swarm
Burning Swarm.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save) and is exposed to fire jelly venom.

Fire Jelly Venom.name: Fire Jelly Venom
Fire Jelly Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} (1 round)

Fire Jellyfish Swarm.name: Fire Jellyfish Swarm
Fire Jellyfish Swarm.publicNotes:
While individually one of these fist-sized jellyfish is merely a nuisance, in great numbers, fire jellyfish can form into dangerous swarms. Bobbing in the water, they create a cloud of stinging tentacles. They were named in part for their bright coloration, but those who are stung by fire jellyfish learn the larger reason for their name—the pain of their stings is comparable to being burned alive.

Many varieties of jellyfish drift through the world's oceans, feeding on fish and other tiny marine creatures. However, deadly species of monstrous jellyfish pose a threat to unwary swimmers and sailors alike. Note that while jellyfish are animals, they also have the mindless trait because they lack a centralized nervous system.

Ozthoom.name: Ozthoom
Ozthoom.publicNotes:
Ozthooms are shadowy killers who serve powerful fey creatures or even the Eldest—the demigods of the First World. Amid the courts of the Eldest or other powerful fey rulers, these sinister assassins lurk overhead as they await the call to action—implied threats akin to deadly weapons hung as decor in a royal hall. Ozthooms never speak aloud; when they feel the need to communicate at all, they do so in a telepathic whisper directly into their victim's mind. While an ozthoom's body is a strange, fleshy material, their deadly claws and cruel hooked wings are made from razor-sharp cold iron, a quality that makes them highly feared among other fey. A typical ozthoom is 10 feet tall and has an 8-foot wingspan, but it weighs less than 80 pounds.

While most ozthooms serve powerful masters, a few of these murderous fey have been left to their own devices and serve none but their own capricious whims. In some cases, their master has been slain, while in others, the ozthoom has been released from service for any number of reasons. An ozthoom left to indulge their cruel desires unrestrained is often the most dangerous ozthoom of them all.

Shadow Doubles.name: Shadow Doubles
Shadow Doubles.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per day

Effect For each action spent to use this ability, the ozthoom creates one shadowy duplicate anywhere within 60 feet of themself. Shadow doubles have the same statistics as an ozthoom, but they have the summoned trait, 85 Hit Points, can't use Shadow Doubles or innate spells, and have an attack bonus of +25 for their Strikes. A shadow double that attempts a saving throw against a light effect can't get a result better than failure. Each double remains for 1 round, until it's reduced to 0 Hit Points, or until it moves further than 120 feet from the ozthoom, whichever comes first. Each round thereafter, the ozthoom can Sustain the effect to extend the duration of surviving duplicates by 1 round, to a maximum duration of 1 minute. The ozthoom can see through the eyes of all the shadow doubles at once. A character who Seeks can identify an ozthoom as real or a shadow double with a successful @Check[perception|dc:39] check.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A ozthoom's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Bolts.name: 弩矢 Bolts
Bolts.description: 比传统箭短，但结构相似，矢是弩使用的弹药。

Hungry Armor.name: 饥饿护甲 Hungry Armor
Hungry Armor.description: 用近战武器对死墓骑士进行打击的生物必须成功通过@Check[reflex|dc:31]豁免，否则用于打击的武器将被卸武。若该生物豁免大失败，则这把武器会掉落至死墓骑士占据的空间；用无武装攻击命中死墓骑士的生物必须成功通过@Check[reflex|dc:31]豁免，否则会被死墓骑士@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]，直至该生物的下个回合结束、该生物逃脱、或死墓骑士移动，以先发生的为准。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
当死墓骑士被摧毁时，其护甲会在[[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10天}内重塑身体——若护甲被活着的宿主穿戴则会更加迅速。若身体在此之前被破坏，重塑过程将重新开始。

只有摧毁护甲（比如使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]）、把死墓骑士传送至创世熔炉、或者丢进火山之中才能够永久摧毁死墓骑士。

Sacrilegious Aura.name: 亵渎灵光 Sacrilegious Aura
Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30尺。当有生物在灵光射程内使用命能法术或能力时，死墓骑士会自动尝试反制它，[[/r 1d20+23 #Counteract]]{反制调整值+23}。

Devastating Blast.name: 毁灭爆震 Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description:
死墓骑士释放出@Template[cone|distance:30]闪电。区域内的生物受到@Damage[8d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。

死墓骑士在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4轮}无法再次使用此能力。

Exemplar of Violence.name: 暴力典范 Exemplar of Violence
Exemplar of Violence.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 死墓骑士进行一次打击，同时它的铠甲闪烁着邪恶的光芒，刺激盟友实施暴力。在打击结束后，所有能看到死墓骑士的盟友都可以使用一个反应动作进行一次快步或行走，但它们必须要在一个邻接敌人的空间内结束移动。死墓骑士所选的一位盟友可以使用该动作打击而非移动。

Graveknight's Curse.name: 死墓骑士诅咒 Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
诅咒会影响任何穿戴死墓骑士护甲超过1小时以上的生物。

豁免骰 @Check[will|dc:39]

潜伏期 1小时

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}且无法脱下盔甲（1天）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，速度承受-10尺状态减值，且无法脱下盔甲（1天）

阶段3 死亡并转化为盔甲的死墓骑士

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]

Phantom Mount.name: 魅影坐骑 Phantom Mount
Phantom Mount.description:
7环级；这匹战马数据为：AC34，强韧+23，反射+20，意志+20，HP85。

死墓骑士召唤出1匹超自然坐骑，就如同升阶至7环级的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]一般。

与魅影驹不同是的，该坐骑的AC和豁免骰加值比死墓骑士低4，且HP为死墓骑士的三分之一（向下取整）。

若坐骑被摧毁，死墓骑士必须等待1小时才能再次使用该能力。

Ruinous Weapons.name: 破灭武器 Ruinous Weapons
Ruinous Weapons.description: 死墓骑士所持用的任意武器或无武装攻击均获得+1高等强击和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TEa1oKZbwsOvC6TZ]武器符文的效果。

Weapon Master.name: 武器大师 Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: 死墓骑士无论持用何种武器，均可以使用该武器的重击专精效果。

Graveknight Warmaster.name: 死墓骑士战帅 Graveknight Warmaster
Graveknight Warmaster.publicNotes:
作为不朽暴力的典范，死墓骑士战帅在战场上是一股毁灭性的力量，它能刺激盟友，让他们的暴力程度更上一层楼。

当一位可畏的斗士战死沙场，其一心复仇的魂魄有时会和他的护甲融合，创造出一名死墓骑士。

Garuda.name: Garuda
Garuda.publicNotes:
Garudas are winged humanoids created to serve holy gods and other powerful celestial beings. Originally born among the celestial planes, garudas eventually spread beyond, with many making their way to the mortal Universe. As divine servants, garudas' primary roles are as protectors, defending holy sites and important divine figures like high priests.

The most important role a garuda serves is as a means of transportation. The first garudas served as mounts for the gods, carrying them across the heavens and into combat. This tradition continues today, with garudas willingly serving as mounts for champions, clerics, and other divine chosen. On occasion, a god will request a garuda track down one of the god's followers. The garuda declares their servitude to the follower, acting as a guardian and transport for as long as the god decrees.

Speaker of the Skies.name: Speaker of the Skies
Speaker of the Skies.description: A garuda can speak with any type of bird.

Vehicle of the Gods.name: Vehicle of the Gods
Vehicle of the Gods.description: Garudas were created to serve as transport for other beings. A holy creature can ride the garuda by using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Mount} action to move onto them. Unlike the normal rules for riding other creatures, both the garuda and the rider continue to receive all 3 of their actions each turn, and the garuda's rider can be Medium or smaller. A garuda can have only a single rider at a time. The garuda can choose to allow a non-holy (but not an unholy) creature to ride them, but generally only does so in specific circumstances.

Celestial Meteor.name: Celestial Meteor
Celestial Meteor.description:
Requirements The garuda doesn't have a rider

Effect The garuda Flies straight up and then comes crashing down toward the ground, landing in an unoccupied space within 30 feet. As the garuda lands, a burst of solar flames erupts from them, dealing @Damage[5d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save). If the garuda lands adjacent to a creature, they can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} that creature. On a success or critical success, the garuda can then Fly up to 30 feet with the creature.

Divine Grasp.name: Divine Grasp
Divine Grasp.description: When a garuda moves, they can bring grabbed creatures along with them.

Raise by the Sun.name: Raise by the Sun
Raise by the Sun.description:
2 to 3

Requirements The garuda doesn't have a rider

Effect The garuda Flies and picks up a willing creature at any point during the flight, who then begins riding the garuda, and then the garuda continues their Fly action. If the garuda uses three actions, they can instead Fly twice. At any point during the garuda's movement, the rider can use a reaction to attempt a Strike with a ranged weapon.

Vanyver.name: Vanyver
Vanyver.publicNotes:
Vanyvers are large, humanoid bats shaped from void and shadowstuff, their red eyes glowing like tiny stars in an otherwise lightless night. Though powerful, they're the least of the darvakkas, and the most likely to submit to a master, either another of their kind or a mortal with a reputation for being especially murderous and destructive. Vanyvers agree to follow their masters as a temporary means of maximizing the death and destruction they can enact but will quickly turn on any master they feel falters in this goal.

Darvakkas, also called nightshades, are a ravenous evil made up of equal parts darkness and malice. Originally creatures of the Outer Planes who travel to the convergence of the Shadow Plane and the Void—where the power of nothingness obliterates them—these undead abominations are the physical embodiment of entropy. They burn with an intense hatred for all life, working to bring a final, dark night to the Material Plane where nothing but ash and ice remain.

As creatures twisted by darkness and shadow, darvakkas have a great aversion to sunlight and all sources of vitality energy. On the Material Plane, they spend the hours of daylight hidden below ground, amid ruins, or submerged deep in the ocean's darkest chasms beyond the reach of the sun's rays, emerging when darkness shelters them overhead.

Darvakkas have an aura of entropy that attracts undead thralls to serve as warriors and heralds. They rarely seek alliances with each other or other creatures, existing in solitude as the heads of individual armies of the dead.

Catching Bite.name: Catching Bite
Catching Bite.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the vanyver's jaws makes a melee Strike against the vanyver with a weapon

Effect The vanyver chooses to be hit. If the attack would've missed, it hits. The vanyver catches the weapon in their jaws and uses Drain Magic on it without fulfilling Drain Magic's requirements.

Drain Magic.name: Drain Magic
Drain Magic.description:
Requirements The vanyver's last action was a successful jaws Strike against a creature, object, or spell effect

Effect The vanyver casts an innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} on the same target; if the target was a creature, the vanyver can target a spell affecting the creature instead. If a spell effect or item is successfully counteracted, the vanyver gains temporary Hit Points equal to double the counteract rank of the effect that was counteracted.

Entropy's Shadow.name: Entropy's Shadow
Entropy's Shadow.description: 40 feet. Vanyvers leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes @Damage[3d6[void]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the vanyver.

Snatch.name: Snatch
Snatch.description: The vanyver can Fly at half Speed while they have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in either or both of their talons, carrying that creature along with them.

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A vanyver caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Withering Opportunity.name: Withering Opportunity
Withering Opportunity.description:
Trigger The meladaemon is attacked by an adjacent creature and the attack misses

Effect The meladaemon swipes at the triggering creature, which must immediately attempt a save against the meladaemon's withering touch.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Consumptive Aura.name: Consumptive Aura
Consumptive Aura.description: 20 feet. A meladaemon emanates an aura of intense hunger. Each round a creature begins its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:27|traits:damaging-effect] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (@Damage[2d6[void]] damage on a critical failure) and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. This fatigue ends as soon as the creature eats any food.

Daemonic Famine.name: Daemonic Famine
Daemonic Famine.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 as stage 3

Stage 5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 week)

Stage 6 dead

Withering Touch.name: Withering Touch
Withering Touch.description: When the meladaemon hits with a claw Strike or a creature begins its turn grabbed by the meladaemon, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30|traits:damaging-effect] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[1d6[void]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. This fatigue ends when the creature drinks.

Meladaemon.name: Meladaemon
Meladaemon.publicNotes: Meladaemons personify death by starvation and thirst, and revel in spreading the same despair that brought about their mortal demise. When they aren't blighting fields, massacring livestock, or tainting water supplies, they experiment on prisoners to study how long creatures can go without sustenance and the deleterious effects that result from such deprivation. Fiercely loyal to Trelmarixian, Horseman of Famine, they serve no other beings. They work alongside other daemons if Trelmarixian wills it, but are notoriously traitorous.
Meladaemon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Distracting Whisper.name: 干扰低语 Distracting Whisper
Distracting Whisper.description:
触发 低语龙成为攻击的目标

效果 一个神秘的声音在触发生物耳边低语，使触发攻击受到-2环境减值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qsvSWxRqVQofjDdH]

Cogitation Breath.name: 凝思吐息 Cogitation Breath
Cogitation Breath.description: 低语龙释放出一股迷惑性毒雾，在@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围内造成@Damage[6d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied]豁免）。豁免失败的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（大失败则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}），持续1分钟。低语龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cogitation Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用凝思吐息。

Steal Knowledge.name: 窃取知识 Steal Knowledge
Steal Knowledge.description:
低语龙从60尺内一个生物的意识中摘取知识片段，选择一个技能作为影响目标。该生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:23]豁免。

成功 该生物不受影响。

失败 在接下来的1分钟内，该生物使用该技能的检定时承受-1状态减值，而低语龙在使用该技能的检定中获得+1状态加值。

大失败 同失败，但减值为-2，加值为+2。

+2 to Sense Motive.name: 察言观色时+2 +2 to Sense Motive

Information Network.name: 信息网络 Information Network
Information Network.description: 低语龙可以尝试一个社群检定来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]以代替搜集信息检定，从先前的线人处回忆情报。

+2 Status To All Saves Vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status To All Saves Vs. Occult

Diplomatic Solution.name: 外交解决 Diplomatic Solution
Diplomatic Solution.description:
触发 低语龙进行先攻检定

效果 低语龙将其视线内60尺范围内的所有敌人作为目标，施放环级等于低语龙等级一半（向上取整）的安定心神（@Check[will|dc:23]豁免）。低语龙无需维持此效果，但如果低语龙对受到影响的生物采取任何敌对行动，则对所有生物终止该效果。

Whisper Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年低语龙施法者 Whisper Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Whisper Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 低语龙是敏锐的谣言和秘密收藏家，花费几个世纪来磨练他们的信息网络和人际关系。它们这样做通常并非出于想要控制他人或利用这些信息来进行阴谋，而仅仅是因为学习和收集信息的过程本身就是一种满足。与其他龙的财宝相比，它们的巢穴较为简陋，因为它们真正的财富——秘密——都藏在它们的脑海中。

Sensory Fever.name: Sensory Fever
Sensory Fever.description:
A ximtal's withering attacks cause a debilitating disease targeting the senses

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Stage1 creature loses one sense determined randomly: taste, smell, hearing, or sight (1 day)

Stage 2 creature loses an additional sense from the stage 1 list (1 day)

Stage 3 creature loses an additional sense from the stage 1 list (1 day)

Stage 4 creature loses the last sense from the stage 1 list and any special senses, such as tremorsense or lifesense (1 day)

Stage 5 all lost senses are permanent unless restored via @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Et8RSCLx8w7uOLvo]{Sound Body} or a similar effect.

Skip Between.name: Skip Between
Skip Between.description: The sahkil moves from the Universe to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa. While in the Ethereal Plane, they're unable to affect anything in the Universe, and they cannot be seen by beings or abilities in the Universe, unless these have an ability that can gaze into the Ethereal Plane. While on the Material Plane the inverse is true for anything on the Ethereal Plane. A summoned sahkil can't use Skip Between.

Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
Easy to Call.description: A ximtal's level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle} ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM's discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

Despoiler.name: Despoiler
Despoiler.description:
1000 feet. Creatures within the aura take a –2 circumstance penalty to all saving throws against poisons, diseases, and drugs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.itdoXvcDo8wwmTME]{Effect: Despoiler}

Isolate Foes.name: Isolate Foes
Isolate Foes.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The ximtal attempts to isolate its enemy's companions, forcing an impression that each creature's friends and allies have vanished and they are all alone against an insurmountable threat. The ximtal chooses up to four creatures, each of whom must be adjacent to one other target. Each target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save. On a failure, a target becomes out of phase with all allies. The affected creatures can't perceive their allies or interact with them in any way, and they can move into allies' spaces as if their allies simply weren't there. Allies similarly can't perceive or interact with the affected creatures with one exception: an ally can target an affected creature with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} to remove the effects. Every 24 hours, an affected creature can attempt a new saving throw to end this effect.

Ximtal.name: Ximtal
Ximtal.publicNotes:
The struggles of loneliness and the anxiety that accompanies that feeling plague many creatures, and ximtals delight in exploiting this fear for their own perverse gain. Appearing as hybrids of rats and crabs with grasping tentacles, these scheming fiends manipulate their victims over long spans of time, like pakalchis, to savor the most fear they can. Ximtals use subtlety to entrap their prey and often don't directly engage their targets. They use insecurities as a tool and force poor behavior in mortals they set their sights on. They prefer to focus their machinations on strong-willed and well-intentioned mortals, hoping to erode their pride and self-worth and ultimately lead them eschew altruistic efforts.

Rather than focusing on a single victim, a ximtal might instead seek out a particular cause of interest to the sahkil's appetites. These creatures often wander the multiverse seeking to sabotage societal crusades or suppress divergent ideologies.

While most ximtals work alone, they sometimes enlist the assistance of pakalchis, who share similar tastes in mortal fear. Together and focused, these two types of fiends can dissolve individual self-worth, relationships, and even entire organizations.

Ages ago, when this cycle of the multiverse was still adolescent, a cabal of psychopomps who already felt bored and restrained in their role of ushering souls to their ultimate resting place rebelled against their station. It was this corruption of the cycle of souls that spawned the first sahkils.

Ambivalent to the prescribed order of the multiverse and spiteful of mortals, sahkils delight in spreading fear and unease to all beings, clogging up the metaphysical cycle with anxiety-ridden mortals too scared to achieve their potential. These fiends have drastically changed from their dedicated psychopomp predecessors. They are creatures of spite and torment, fear and disgust. They exploit the most common and rare fears for their own perverse satisfaction, and they want nothing more than to frighten mortals and make them question their reason for existence.

Most sahkils lurk on the Ethereal Plane, but they frequently invade the Material Plane to torment mortals and spread terror. They use their innate ability to slip between the veils of the Ethereal and Material effortlessly, often stalking their targets for days or weeks before enacting their devious plots.

Coil.name: Coil
Coil.description: The gobmob snake uses an action to coil itself, increasing its reach with its fangs from 5 to 10 feet. After the gobmob snake Strikes with its fangs, it becomes uncoiled.

Snake Empathy.name: Snake Empathy
Snake Empathy.description: A gobmob snake can communicate with snakes.

Coiled Strike.name: Coiled Strike
Coiled Strike.description: As @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.W7SbTykXrNwxDzJc]{Reactive Strike}, but the gobmob snake can use this reaction only if it's Coiled.

Incessant Yammering.name: Incessant Yammering
Incessant Yammering.description:
15 feet.

A gobmob snake's heads constantly bicker and snipe at one another, annoying and distracting anyone nearby. Each non-goblin creature that begins its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. On a failure, it takes a –1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 round. On a success, it is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Infighting.name: Infighting
Infighting.description: Whenever a gobmob snake critically fails at an attack roll or skill check, it must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as its heads argue over which of them is to blame. An enemy can provoke an argument by attempting a @Check[deception|dc:20] check as a single action with the auditory, concentrate, linguistic, and mental traits.

Goblin Breath.name: Goblin Breath
Goblin Breath.description: The gobmob snake belches a cloud of nauseating vapor in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]. Non-goblin creatures within the cloud must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. On a critical failure, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it is sickened. Creatures that successfully save are immune for 24 hours. The gobmob snake can't use Goblin Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Goblin Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Gobmob Snake.name: Gobmob Snake
Gobmob Snake.publicNotes:
These bizarre mutant goblin snakes possess no fewer than three heads.

A goblin snake is a foul-smelling serpentine creature covered in greasy black scales and sporting a fanged, lipless head resembling that of a goblin.

Echolocation 20 feet.description: A sabosan can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.
Echolocation 20 feet.name: Echolocation 20 feet

Drain Blood.name: Drain Blood
Drain Blood.description:
Requirements The sabosan has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The sabosan drains blood from the creature. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. The sabosan gains a number of temporary Hit Points equal to the number of Hit Points lost by the creature due to its drained condition.

Fell Shriek.name: Fell Shriek
Fell Shriek.description: The sabosan emits a deafening cry in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Non-sabosan creatures in this area must each succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

Powerful Charge.name: Powerful Charge
Powerful Charge.description: The sabosan Strides or Flies up to double their Speed and then makes a claw Strike. If the sabosan moved at least 20 feet, they deal an additional 1d6 slashing damage on a hit.

Sabosan.name: Sabosan
Sabosan.publicNotes:
Sabosans are intelligent, bat-like humanoids who live in warm forests and drink the blood of other creatures, particularly people. They have thin, emaciated torsos and broad, leathery wings that can reach a span of almost 20 feet. Sabosans' heads, necks, shoulders, and upper chests are covered with red or dark-brown fur that obscures their stretched-thin flesh. Though their ears are large and pointed like a bat's and they can echolocate as bats do, their vision is also quite strong, enough so that they can use it to easily track quarry in low light.

Some naturalist scholars believe that sabosans are distant descendants of humans who were afflicted with vampirism but managed to avoid succumbing to undeath. Others posit they were once a cult of demon worshippers whose dark rites transformed them into their current forms. No matter their true origins, sabosans have infamous reputations among towns and cities south of Golarion's equator. Even mere rumors of sabosans in an area are enough to set off city-wide hunts, and the truly superstitious aren't above setting fires near every grotto, nook, and foxhole they come across in order to smoke out the nocturnal creatures.

Sabosans hunt during the twilight hours or just after dark, when their echolocation gives them an edge over sleeping prey. They are capable hunters but indiscriminating when it comes to food sources; their rapid metabolisms means sabosans must eat nearly 20 pounds of meat and fruit per day, supplemented, of course, with copious amounts of blood.

Sabosans' obscure faith reveres two deities: the slain Demon Lord Vyriavaxus, Lord of Shadows, and the nearly forgotten sun god Easivra. Vyriavaxus has an obvious link with the creatures, with his appearance as a giant bat, but their connection to the sun god hints at a complex depth in sabosan beliefs.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Hellstrider.name: Hellstrider
Hellstrider.description:
A levaloch ignores the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. They take no damage from caltrops or from damaging terrain that deals physical, acid, or cold damage.

A levaloch can move through liquids up to 5 feet deep at their full Speed.

Phalanx Fighter.name: Phalanx Fighter
Phalanx Fighter.description:
All devils of equal or lower level adjacent to a levaloch gain a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC as the levaloch shields them from harm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.KjWPSJonzrZ8jv7X]{Effect: Phalanx Fighter}

Stable Stance.name: Stable Stance
Stable Stance.description: A levaloch gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Fortitude DC against being Shoved and to other saving throws to resist being moved against their will.

Barbed Net.name: Barbed Net
Barbed Net.description:
When a levaloch hits a creature with their barbed net, the net wraps around the target, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. If the Strike was a critical success, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}.

When a creature [[/act escape dc=22]]{Escapes}, or if the Strike misses, the net crumbles into rust.

Each time a creature attempts to Escape, it takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage from the net's barbs, regardless of whether the attempt succeeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HafP5vrdGdoqoFMo]{Effect: Barbed Net}

Forge Weapon.name: Forge Weapon
Forge Weapon.description:
A levaloch reforges part of their barbed iron substance into a new +1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} trident or barbed net. Their previous trident crumbles to rust.

When the levaloch is destroyed, any tridents or barbed nets they created crumble to rust.

Merciless Thrust.name: Merciless Thrust
Merciless Thrust.description: When a levaloch hits a creature that has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} conditions with a melee trident Strike, the Strike deals an additional [[/r 2d6]] damage.

Levaloch.name: Levaloch
Levaloch.publicNotes:
Fearsome giants of jagged iron, levalochs serve in the armies of Hell as potent warriors and tenacious hunters-creatures of absolute discipline endlessly obedient to diabolical tyrants.

There are countless legions of lawful fiends in the nine layers of Hell, warring against the celestial planes and scouring the Material Plane for souls to corrupt.
Levaloch.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Tickle.name: Tickle
Tickle.description:
The nightgaunt can use its tail to tickle a foe with horrible efficiency. A creature hit by its tail Strike must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save; if the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the nightgaunt, it uses the outcome one degree of success worse than the result it rolled.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is overcome with laughter and can't perform reactions for 1 round.

Failure As success, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure As success, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't speak for 1 round.

Faceless.name: Faceless
Faceless.description: The nightgaunt has no face, but it can still see in all directions as if its entire body were an eye. It has no need to breathe, and it is immune to all inhaled toxins and other olfactory effects.

Clutches.name: Clutches
Clutches.description: A nightgaunt can Fly at full Speed while it has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its claws, carrying that creature along with it.

Nightgaunt.name: Nightgaunt
Nightgaunt.publicNotes:
Nightgaunts lurk in dreams, lying in wait to spirit away the unwary dreamer. Once connected to such a being, the nightgaunt feeds upon the mortal's emotions before abandoning them—often in a place they might never wake from.

A nightgaunt appears as a bony humanoid with inky black skin, batlike wings, a long sinuous tail, and demonic horns atop a head that lacks any face or features. Most nightgaunts have little interest in anything other than sating their hunger for emotions. They find the art of inducing nightmares to be a surefire way to feast, but they're even more adept at tormenting their victims through tickling while carrying them at precarious heights.

Nightgaunts often gather in vast colonies in the Dreamlands, where they entertain each other by sharing emotion memories of their meals through strange caresses. These colonies pose great danger to any adventurer foolish enough to approach.

When conjured forth into other worlds, they serve only grudgingly, often working equally as hard to find a way to escape servitude and feed on their conjurer's emotions as they do on the task they've been compelled to perform.

Instinctive Alloy.name: Instinctive Alloy
Instinctive Alloy.description:
Trigger The assault alloy is hit by an attack with a metal weapon or metal spell or effect

Effect The physical damage from the triggering weapon, spell, or effect instead restores the assault alloy's Hit Points as they seamlessly incorporate some of the metal used into their body. If already at full Hit Points, the assault alloy gains temporary Hit Points that last for 1 round instead. If a metal weapon triggers this, the weapon's die size decreases by one step to a minimum die size of d4 for 1 minute, and that weapon can't trigger Instinctive Alloy again during this time.

Metal Manipulation.name: Metal Manipulation
Metal Manipulation.description: 30 feet. An assault alloy has control over all unattended metal within the emanation and can use any of this metal as the origin point for their metal needle ranged Strikes.

Idle Transmutation.name: Idle Transmutation
Idle Transmutation.description: An assault alloy has full alchemical control over the properties of their metal. Each time they make a metal needle Strike or Cast a Spell with the metal trait, they choose whether the metal they use is adamantine, cold iron, dawnsilver, or any other solid precious metal.

Metal Blink.name: Metal Blink
Metal Blink.description:
Requirements The assault alloy is adjacent to metal of at least 1 bulk

Effect An assault alloy can liquefy the metals of their body and travel up to their Speed through spaces with contiguous metal, even if it's not uniformly connected (as in a scrap heap or a pile of treasure). This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Verdurous Ooze.name: Verdurous Ooze

Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
Motion Sense.description: A verdurous ooze can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

Corrosive Surface.name: Corrosive Surface
Corrosive Surface.description: A creature that hits a verdurous ooze with a metal weapon or unarmed attack must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect] save. On a failure, the weapon or creature takes @Damage[2d4[acid]] damage (after dealing damage to the ooze as normal). Thrown weapons take this damage automatically with no save.

Enliven Foliage.name: Enliven Foliage
Enliven Foliage.description:
20 feet. The verdurous ooze constantly emits supernatural vapors that cause nearby plants to grow rapidly and writhe and grasp at anything and everything within the emanation. This area becomes difficult terrain for non-verdurous ooze creatures. When a creature starts its turn in this aura, it must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save or take a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the emanation.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4fmRhCljZ9l0Tr3J]{Effect: Enliven Foliage}

Split.name: Split
Split.description: When a verdurous ooze that has 10 or more HP is hit by an attack that would deal piercing or slashing damage, it splits into two identical oozes, each with half the original's HP. One ooze is in the same space as the original, and the other is in an adjacent, unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, it automatically pushes creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space (the GM decides if an object or creature is too big or heavy to push).

Sleep Gas.name: Sleep Gas
Sleep Gas.description:
The verdurous ooze adjusts its aura of supernatural vapors to affect living creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:20], forcing them to attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to Sleep Gas for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If it's still unconscious after 1 minute, it wakes up automatically.

Critical Failure The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If it's still unconscious after 1 hour, it wakes up automatically.

Verdurous Ooze Acid.name: Verdurous Ooze Acid
Verdurous Ooze Acid.description: A verdurous ooze's acid damages only metal and flesh-not bone, stone, or other materials.

Verdurous Ooze.publicNotes: Verdurous oozes are found in temperate forests, warm jungles, or other places where plant life grows in abundance. Unlike many types of oozes, verdurous oozes are not particularly good climbers and have been known to get trapped in natural or artificial chasms. Warlords and wizards sometimes make use of that fact and keep verdurous oozes as guardians in pits around the walls of their fortresses or towers.

Vicious Blow.name: Vicious Blow
Vicious Blow.description: Effect The oread guard makes a melee Strike. This counts as two attacks when calculating the guard's multiple attack penalty. If this Strike hits, the oread guard deals an extra die of weapon damage.

Oread Guard.name: Oread Guard
Oread Guard.publicNotes:
Elemental earth laces through the bones of oreads, who appear similar to stone statues of their mortal ancestry, with delicate crystals in place of hair, fur, or scales. Most oreads are stoic and slow to plan but steadfast in their resolve and unwavering in their convictions.

The typical oread cherishes quiet seclusion. Yet as they age, many oreads find themselves inexplicably drawn to some far-flung location with a pull like that exerted on the needle of a compass—intangible, constant, and ultimately irresistible. The destination of this mysterious pilgrimage is unique to each oread, though it usually ends in some place of great mystical power, natural splendor, or esoteric learning. Most oreads are drawn to a place that's somewhat familiar, but a rare few feel drawn to travel in a seemingly random direction, departing with only the hope that they'll discover whatever mystery lies at the end of their invisible path.

Many oreads find that the role of a guard suits their personality well, for in such a role they can feel as if they're helping promote order but also find time to stand vigil as lone sentinels over a specific portion of a fortification or a remote location on a wilderness trail.

Lovelorn.name: Lovelorn
Lovelorn.publicNotes:
A particularly macabre form of undead, these spiderlike creatures resemble still-beating hearts with rib bones for legs and tendrils of gore dangling beneath. Their twisted forms hint at their ghastly origin, as these undead form from those who die tragic deaths in service to toxic love: star-crossed lovers who die rather than accept a life apart from one another, rejected suitors whose unrequited affections warp into malice, and other victims of tragic relationships both romantic and otherwise. Any of these might spawn a lovelorn in death, their anguish and fixation on their broken heart causing the organ to animate.

A freshly spawned lovelorn often seeks out those it knew in life, stalking and tormenting them or, in some cases, those around them. In undeath, they gain an understanding of emotions and how to manipulate them, cultivating the misery, anger, and cruelty they thrive upon. Typically, these undead long to enact vengeance upon those they feel drove them to their tragic fates, although in rare cases they may instead act as dark guardians, fixating on a particular loved one and "protecting" them by visiting misery upon anyone who slights them.

Gloom Aura.name: Gloom Aura
Gloom Aura.description:
60 feet. A lovelorn's presence instills unease and turns the air cold, dark, and stale. Creatures within the aura take a -1 circumstance penalty to saving throws made to resist emotion effects.

If the lovelorn makes a place home for a week or more, that location can become suffused with this magic even outside the lovelorn's aura, lasting until the lovelorn leaves or is destroyed.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Me16QQGxpivWE2WW]{Effect: Gloom Aura}

Skitter Away.name: Skitter Away
Skitter Away.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement in a space adjacent to the lovelorn

Effect The lovelorn Strides or Climbs 10 feet away from the triggering creature. This movement does not trigger reactions.

Cynic's Curse.name: Cynic's Curse
Cynic's Curse.description:
A creature hit by a lovelorn's fangs Strike must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19] save as it grows morose and listless. If the creature would be affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} spell, that spell attempts to counteract this curse instead of having its normal effect.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success For 1 minute, the target can't benefit from helpful emotion effects, but can still be affected by harmful emotion effects.

Failure As success, plus the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for the same duration.

Critical Failure As failure, but the curse's effects are permanent.

Augur.name: Augur
Augur.publicNotes:
These spherical knots of sinewy muscle, serrated blades, and bloody metal are the most common velstracs on the Netherworld. Each augur has only a single eye, from which they can witness the horrors inflicted by other velstracs, who train the augur to expect and appreciate pain. Augurs are 1 foot in diameter and weigh 30 pounds.

The shadow-dwelling fiends known as velstracs all share a horrifying preoccupation with the search for ultimate sensation through self-mutilation. Velstracs transcend their stoic detachment only when inflicting pain and terror upon their victims, practicing new forms of torture, or turning their agonizing practices back on themselves. They consider themselves enlightened beings, transcending such limitations as morality or mortal taboos, but their victims know them as emotionless tormentors who inflict sadistic suffering. These fiends claim to seek perfection in thought, form, and action, although they don't recognize any refinement that doesn't require the painful excision of the flesh or spirit. Velstracs manifest from the souls of the most extreme masochistic or sadistic mortals who are judged and sent on to the Netherworld. They take on forms that suit their vile predilections, ranging from the low-ranking augurs to the maestros of suffering and mutilation, the eremites. The process of transformation warps the soul step by step, with other velstracs conveying their new members through untold chambers of pain among the dark reaches of the Netherworld.

Painsight.name: Painsight
Painsight.description: A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} conditions as well as the value of those conditions.

Feel the Blades.name: Feel the Blades
Feel the Blades.description: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it feels the sharp barbs of the augur's blades on its skin. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:17|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Focus Gaze.name: Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: The augur stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Will save against feel the blades. After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune to Focus Gaze until the start of the augur's next turn.

Whilring Slice.name: Whilring Slice
Whilring Slice.description: The augur Flies or Strides, whirling as they move. The augur deals the damage of their blade Strike to each creature whose space they enter (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save). Each creature is affected only once, even if the augur moves through its space multiple times.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description: The larabay can take on the appearance of a specific Medium or Small humanoid. This removes their fly Speed but doesn't change the attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes.

Mischief.name: Mischief
Mischief.description:
Requirements The larabay's last action was a successful rapier Strike

Effect The larabay attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the creature they hit. They gain a +4 status bonus to the Athletics check. This attempt neither applies nor counts toward the larabay's multiple attack penalty.

Rainbow Flight.name: Rainbow Flight
Rainbow Flight.description:
The larabay Flies up to its fly Speed, creating a stunning rainbow in its wake. This movement doesn't provoke reactions. Any creature adjacent to the larabay at any point during this movement must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] saving throw to resist staring at the magnificent rainbow. The larabay cannot use Rainbow Flight again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The target is dazzled for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Critical Failure The target is dazzled for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}.

Befuddling Visions.name: Befuddling Visions
Befuddling Visions.description:
The larabay's gaze creates disorientation and confusion. A creature hit by befuddling gaze must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune to befuddling visions for 1 minute.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target becomes clumsy and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round, and clumsy and dazzled for 1 round afterward.

Larabay.name: Larabay
Larabay.publicNotes: Larabays are bright-eyed, humanoid-looking fey with colorful wings and needlelike teeth who generally reside along warm coastal regions and islands. Like other fey, they enjoy lavish pranks and fantastical illusions that create chicanery and confusion. A larabay's desire for a joke can sometimes reach dire extremes, such as employing illusions to lure ships into rocks and travelers off cliffs. While some have fortuitously become heroes by playing pranks on tyrants or cruel people, this is almost entirely coincidental, as larabays do not often consider the morals or goals of their targets; they simply enjoy the fruits of their chaos.

Stunning Pulse.name: Stunning Pulse
Stunning Pulse.description:
The nymolus emits a powerful mental pulse that overwhelms nearby creatures. Creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:27|options:area-effect,inflicts:stunned] save to avoid being stunned. The nymolus can't use Stunning Pulse again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Stunning Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unafected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

Inhabit Ugothol.name: Inhabit Ugothol
Inhabit Ugothol.description: The nymolus spends 10 minutes with a willing ugothol to become enmeshed with the creature. The nymolus then fully inhabits the ugothol's body. While inhabited, the ugothol retains its mental abilities, but its body is completely controlled by the nymolus. The nymolus and ugothol each have an initiative count as if they were separate creatures. The nymolus can't use any ability that relies on their physical form while inhabiting the ugothol, but the nymolus can still perceive and cast spells normally. The two remain enmeshed until the nymolus uses the ugothol's Assume Form ability to separate them, or until the ugothol is slain. If the ugothol dies, the nymolus becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} due to the force of the separation.

Replace Recollection.name: Replace Recollection
Replace Recollection.description: The nymolus can spend 10 minutes to replace any memory with another memory they have access to via a memory crystal.

Extract Memory.name: Extract Memory
Extract Memory.description:
