  • Bewitching Beret The target is infatuated with their new hat and its creator, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the millindemalion and the beret.
  • Dazzling Deerstalker The target can barely see with the hat falling down over its eyes and gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} condition.
  • Fettering Fedora The target feels a heavy weight pressing down on them from the hat and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds.
  • Tiring Tricorne The target grows sleepy and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.FQrNDisx6noJnFaQ]{Effect: Fettering Fedora}

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A millindemalion deals an extra 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Millindemalion.name: Millindemalion
Millindemalion.publicNotes: Millindemalion are cruel fey tricksters capable of causing mayhem with their magical, mind-altering hats. Many folk tales from around the world speak of industrious fey who help struggling crafters-cobblers, milliners, tailors, and so on-during the night, creating quality wares in secret for no payment greater than a crumb of bread or a saucer of cream. These stories hold a grain of truth, as gracious fey do occasionally journey from the First World to aid a humble artisan on a whim, for bribes of food, or sometimes even as part of a concerted effort to spread beauty throughout the world. However, when an artisan becomes too reliant on this help, their friendly fey helper might become warped and twisted with resentment and neglect. Eventually, they could transform into a cruel prankster who delights in punishing mortals who dare task a fey with such mundane work. The millindemalion is the result of a kindly, hat-making fey undergoing such a transformation. Some scholars believe this erratic behavior is caused by the preponderance of quicksilver used in most millinery.

Mobogo.name: Mobogo

Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description:
A creature hit by the mobogo's tongue becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the mobogo. The creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the mobogo's tongue.

A creature can sever the tongue with a Strike against AC 27 that deals at least 10 slashing damage. This deals no damage to the mobogo but prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes 1 round.

The mobogo can move without ending the Grab as long as the creature remains within the tongue's reach.

Tongue Reposition.name: Tongue Reposition
Tongue Reposition.description: When a mobogo successfully Repositions a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by their tongue, they increase the distance they can move that creature by 10 feet (a total of 15 feet on a success or 20 feet on a critical success); the creature must remain within the tongue's reach. Alternatively, the mobogo can transfer the grabbed creature to being grabbed by the mobogo's jaws.

Regeneration 30 (Deactivated by Acid, Co.name: Regeneration 30 (Deactivated by Acid, Cold, or Fire)

Song of the Swamp.name: Song of the Swamp
Song of the Swamp.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The mobogo unleashes a booming croak. All boggards and mobogos within @Template[emanation|distance:50]{50 feet} gain a +2 status bonus to damage rolls and saves against fear for 1 round. Other creatures in the area of effect must attempt a @Check[will|dc:27] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Slowed]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Slowed]]{1d4 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.hftFxE8JGJGzXAtU]{Effect: Song of the Swamp}

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description: A mobogo ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Mobogo.publicNotes: Mobogos are massive, swamp-dwelling monstrosities that combine the worst aspects of giant toads and evil dragons. Lazy, cruel, and greedy, these vile creatures make their lairs in the most ancient and primordial swamps. The boggards who call such places home worship mobogos as living demigods, regularly bringing sacrifices of food and valuables lest they become the next victims of the mobogos' boundless appetites.
Mobogo.hp: regeneration 30 (deactivated by acid, cold, or fire)

Send Beyond.name: Send Beyond
Send Beyond.description:
Requirements The titan has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The titan thrusts the creature into a nightmare realm full of lightless hands and eyes. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary} (DC 48). The titan can't use Send Beyond for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Shape Emptiness.name: Shape Emptiness
Shape Emptiness.description: The titan molds a weapon from interstellar darkness. This empty weapon is a +3 major striking weapon in any form. The titan can't be disarmed of this weapon and it deals an additional @Damage[2d12[force]] damage. If Released, an empty weapon vanishes.

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental or Div.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental or Divine

Impossible Stature.name: Impossible Stature
Impossible Stature.description: 120 feet. Titans warp perception and distance around them to seem even larger and more imposing. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the emanation must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:48] save or its movement toward the titan is movement over difficult terrain (greater difficult terrain on a critical failure) for 1 round.

Reactive Strike.name: Reactive Strike
Reactive Strike.description:
The hekatonkheires gains 99 extra reactions on their turn that they can use only to make Reactive Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Demolish Veil.name: Demolish Veil
Demolish Veil.description:
Trigger The titan casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}

Effect The titan arrives in a storm of shattered planar barriers. This has the effects of a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yLJROsQtyrPIKcDx]{Wrathful Storm}.

Hundred-Dimension Grasp.name: Hundred-Dimension Grasp
Hundred-Dimension Grasp.description: The titan reaches between realities to drag foes closer. They attempt an @Check[athletics|against:fortitude|options:area-effect,inflicts:paralyzed] check and compare the result to the Fortitude DCs of all foes within 120 feet. On a success, a foe is teleported to any square the titan chooses within 120 feet; on a critical success, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. The titan can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grab} any foe brought within 30 feet as a free action.

Hundred-Handed Whirlwind.name: Hundred-Handed Whirlwind
Hundred-Handed Whirlwind.description: The titan overwhelms opponents with blows both conventional and interplanar. They make one empty weapon Strike against each foe within reach. Even on a failed attack (but not a critical failure), the titan deals @Damage[24[force]] damage to the target. This counts as three attacks for the titan's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until all attacks have been made.

Hekatonkheires Titan.name: Hekatonkheires Titan
Hekatonkheires Titan.publicNotes:
The first three hekatonkheires were meant to guard the gates to the Outer Rifts, but they proved too terrifying and rebellious—and so, in disgust, the gods cast them into the gulfs between the planes. Hekatonkheires titans are incomplete, monstrous progeny of the original three, from whom these titans calved like icebergs. Hekatonkheires wield interstellar darkness as a weapon and spurn the limits of physical reality, literally reaching through space with their countless arms. Filled with a drive to either discover their lost identity or create a new one, they metaphysically disembowel ancient beings and cosmic magics, using the entrails to find clues regarding their own nature and parentage or to serve as raw materials for fueling some alien apotheosis.

Created by ancient deities long before the rise of mortal ancestries, titans united and attempted to overthrow their deific progenitors. The resulting war still figures prominently throughout mortal myths, in which most titans were cast down and imprisoned for eons.
Hekatonkheires Titan.allSaves: +4 status to all saves vs. mental or divine

Scurry.name: Scurry
Scurry.description:
Trigger The giant cockroach is targeted by a melee attack

Effect The giant cockroach gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the cockroach Strides, Climbs, or Flies up to 10 feet.

Giant Cockroach.name: Giant Cockroach
Giant Cockroach.publicNotes: Cockroaches are communal creatures, rarely setting out on their own unless they are searching for food. If an adventurer encounters a single giant cockroach while exploring, they had best take precautions against others, as there is likely an entire colony nearby.

Soul Siphoning Breath.name: 汲魂吐息 Soul Siphoning Breath
Soul Siphoning Breath.description: 复生龙释放一股神圣能量，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[11d6[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic|options:area-effect]豁免），并从范围内的生物身上汲取生命之力。复生龙获得快速治疗10，直到其汲魂吐息重新充能。复生龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Soul Siphoning Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用汲魂吐息。

Reawaken!.name: 醒来！ Reawaken!
Reawaken!.description:
触发 复生龙能看到的一个活物死亡

效果 复生龙利用神术与生命能量将灵魂重新连接到已死躯壳。该自愿生物将在其下回合开始时复活，生命值稳定在0。每个生物只能被此能力复生一次。

Risen Commander.name: 复生指挥官 Risen Commander
Risen Commander.description: 复生龙与它的仆从有着强烈的联系，复生龙每回合可以用一个自由动作维持@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hghGRzOSzEl4UXdS]。

Siphon Life.name: 生命吸取 Siphon Life
Siphon Life.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物使用了一个恢复生命值的治疗效果

效果 复生龙将命能从该效果中引导开，从而将其影响降到最低。触发恢复生命值效果的所有掷骰取最小值，并且任何恢复生命值的固定值（如两动作治疗法术的附加生命值）都会被减半。然后，复生龙获得2d8临时生命值，持续1轮。

Arise!.name: 重生！ Arise!
Arise!.description:
复生龙利用其对命能的精通将其灵魂投射到骨园，并将一个自愿生物的灵魂拉回到其躯体，整个过程需要1小时。这具有死者复活的效果，但目标的最大等级为8级，且灵魂与复生龙的灵魂连接。一次只能有一个生物与复生龙的灵魂连接。如果目标与复生龙不在同一位面或复生龙死亡，则复生生物会死亡，且无法再用重生！能力复生。复生龙可以随时解消该连接。如此做并不会阻止复生龙再次对该生物使用重生！能力。

当以这种方式复生后，该生物仍然可以被死者复活、复生及类似效果选为目标。这会使其完全恢复生命，解除与复生龙的连接，并允许复生龙与另一个生物建立连接。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 复生龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 复生龙的打击重击时会恢复其汲魂吐息的充能。

Resurrection Dragon (Adult).name: 成年复生龙 Resurrection Dragon (Adult)
Resurrection Dragon (Adult).publicNotes: 复生龙徘徊于生与死之间。它们精通命能，使得它们能够将死者复生，同时也精通虚能，能够赋予他人死亡。它们利用这些能力戏弄凡人的生命，召唤灵魂来帮助自己，或复生它们认为重要或有趣的生物。复生龙的巢穴通常是一个荒凉之地。虽然它们像其他龙一样囤积财富，但它们几乎不装饰自己的巢穴，财宝通常被存放在黑暗的角落里，仿佛它们对自己的财物毫不在乎。然而，复生龙倾向于保留从复生的生物或计划复生的生物那里得到的纪念物，而这些物品会特别安全地保管。

Vulnerability to Supernatural Darkness.description: Whenever a mandragora begins its turn in an area of magical darkness, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} on that turn.
Vulnerability to Supernatural Darkness.name: Vulnerability to Supernatural Darkness

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
Requirements The mandragora has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The mandragora drains blood from the creature it has grabbed or restrained, dealing @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:21|basic] save). If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt for 1 minute. A creature that takes any damage from having its blood drained by a mandragora is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives any kind or amount of healing.

Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
Blood Scent.description: A mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise sense at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.

Mandragora Venom.name: Mandragora Venom
Mandragora Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Piercing Shriek.name: Piercing Shriek
Piercing Shriek.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The mandragora emits an unsettling shriek. Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. As long as the creature remains sickened, this slowed condition value can't be reduced below 1.

Mandragora.name: Mandragora
Mandragora.publicNotes:
A mandragora looks like a freshly pulled tuber that has grown into the malformed shape of a child with a grotesque face and hideously bloated body. These insidious little plants typically form when a mandrake root is watered with a demon's blood. Upon absorbing the otherworldly properties of the demon's blood, the root animates and is forced to seek out blood to feast from, lest it die of thirst.

Always famished and in search for sustenance, mandragoras live haunted, pained lives and perform vile and desperate acts to acquire the blood they crave. Though mandragoras prefer magically infused blood such as that of unicorns, fey, or sorcerers, and they can subsist on potions, alchemical bombs, and magical elixirs, they'll settle for the blood of non-magical creatures as a last resort. They find the flavor of mundane blood to be bland and bitter, and they don't blanch at voicing these complaints to the creatures on whom they feed.

While the typical mandragora is the size of a human child, some continue to grow and grow, even reaching sizes comparable to giants. Sometimes as they get larger, they form additional limbs or rudimentary faces, eventually transforming into truly hideous mockeries of the human form.

Spark Moth.name: Spark Moth
Spark Moth.publicNotes:
Spark bats congregate around volatile weather in the Plane of Air.

Some elementals embody aspects of air, such as smoke, lightning, and fog.

Arc Lightning.name: Arc Lightning
Arc Lightning.description: The spark moth transforms into lightning that arcs to a large piece of metal within 100 feet, such as a suit of metal armor or metal weapon. The elemental then returns to its normal form in a space adjacent to the metal. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Mass Wriggle.name: 蠕动大群 Mass Wriggle
Mass Wriggle.description:
触发 蛇鼠群受到1次近战打击的伤害

效果 蛇群爬上来，缠住了攻击者的武器和四肢。目标必须通过@Check[will|dc:15]豁免否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

Swarming Strikes.name: 集群打击 Swarming Strikes
Swarming Strikes.description: 任何位于集群占据空间内的敌人受到@Damage[1d8[piercing]]伤害 （@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]豁免）。

Rat Snake Swarm.name: 蛇鼠群 Rat Snake Swarm
Rat Snake Swarm.publicNotes:
一条单独的蛇可能不会引起恐慌，但是一群疯狂的蛇发出的嘶嘶声会让老练的冒险者都不寒而栗。鼠蛇可以长到10尺长，它们会聚集在一起冬眠或繁殖。虽然这些领地意识很强的蛇类无毒，但会攻击任何威胁到它们的存在。

不同种类的蛇都能在每一个非极地的生态系统中茁壮成长，每一种蛇都有自己独特的捕猎方式和防御机制。

Shifting Runes.name: 变幻符文 Shifting Runes
Shifting Runes.description: 符文龙选择酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰或音波伤害类型。蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文随之变幻，形成该能量类型的符文。符文龙获得对该伤害类型的免疫，且其爆裂符文与符文吐息均造成该类型伤害。任何在奥法上受训的生物无需检定即可立即识别蚀刻符文的能量类型。

equipment-Common runes of 5th level or l.name: 刻在鳞片上的常见符文（5级或更低） Common runes of 5th level or lower etched upon their scales

Magic Sense.name: 魔法感知 Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: 符文龙能感知到列出范围内所有激活的魔法能力与效果。当符文龙进行搜寻时，它在列出范围内获得4环级侦测魔法法术的效果（此外还获得搜寻的正常好处）。

Runic Scales.name: 符文鳞片 Runic Scales
Runic Scales.description: 符文龙的鳞片作为符文石存在。符文龙不能使用蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文的效果或能力，但它们可以将其转移到适当的物品上。以这种方式向物品转移或从物品上转移一个符文需要1分钟，在此期间符文龙处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。该过程自动完成无需检定，但如果符文龙在此过程中停止或受到打扰，符文将被摧毁。符文龙可以在其鳞片上蚀刻任意数量的符文，但它们通常一次只在鳞片上蚀刻少数符文。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Retributive Rune.name: 惩戒符文 Retributive Rune
Retributive Rune.description:
触发 一个15尺内的生物对符文龙造成伤害

效果 伴随着符文魔法的爆发，符文龙对触发生物使用爆裂符文能力，若符文未自动引爆则立即将其引爆。

Detonating Rune.name: 爆裂符文 Detonating Rune
Detonating Rune.description: 符文龙的打击与能力可以在目标身上留下一个爆裂符文。如果一个生物在已经拥有一个爆裂符文的情况下将要获得另一个爆裂符文，则不会新增一个符文，而是会激活其当前的爆裂符文，消耗该符文并对目标造成@Damage[4d6[untyped]]伤害。爆裂符文的伤害类型与符文龙当前变幻符文的类型一致。生物可以使用一个交互动作移除该符文。如果爆裂符文没有引爆，则在1分钟后消散。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 符文龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 符文龙的打击重击时恢复其符文吐息的充能。

Runic Breath.name: 符文吐息 Runic Breath
Runic Breath.description: 符文龙释放数百枚一触即爆的符文，在@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围内造成@Damage[9d6[untyped]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。此能力的伤害类型由变幻符文决定。豁免失败的生物还会受到爆裂符文的影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Runic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用符文吐息。

Rune Dragon (Young).name: 青年符文龙 Rune Dragon (Young)
Rune Dragon (Young).publicNotes: 符文龙天生对符文的力量有着深刻的洞察。大多数符文龙的鳞片上刻有各种符文，它们的身体可以魔法般地增强这些符文的力量。符文龙通常不自己施法，而是依靠它们即兴创造符文的能力来产生所需的效果。符文龙常常把自己的财宝称为图书馆，因为它们的财宝中充满了由不同文化的人们使用多种语言写成的重要历史文献、戏剧、演讲、教科书和法术书。尽管它们通常可以借助魔法说某种语言，但它们更喜欢在讲者的语境中学习语言，以便理解其中隐藏的细微差别和符号中的魔力。

Sramana.name: Sramana
Sramana.publicNotes:
Sramanas, or renouncer angels, exist to help liberate the penitent and ease their suffering. Unusual for angels of such power, sramanas are drawn exclusively from compassionate and enlightened mortal souls who are often more perceptive to the pains of mortal existence.

These tireless celestials embark upon impossible tasks and unfathomable labors to free souls lost, abandoned, and imprisoned in the Lower Planes. This earns them great enmity from fiends and other callous entities, many of whom treat souls as simple playthings and currency and who ironically see the renouncer angels as thieves of souls they've "rightfully" cheated, stolen, or traffcked for their own purposes.

Heed the Fettered.name: Heed the Fettered
Heed the Fettered.description: The sramana can detect penitent creatures who wish to atone for their misdeeds, creatures with the soulbound trait, and soul gems as an imprecise sense with a range of 120 feet.

Soul-Rescuing Vow.name: Soul-Rescuing Vow
Soul-Rescuing Vow.description: A sramana can use interplanar teleport to teleport near a truly penitent creature, soulbound creature, or soul gem of which they're aware. If they do, they don't need a planar key and arrive [[/r 1d20]] miles away from the subject. They can also teleport to Nirvana or The Boneyard without a planar key.

Aura of Renunciation.name: Aura of Renunciation
Aura of Renunciation.description:
100 feet. Truly penitent creatures in the sramana's aura are afected by a DC 35 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8xRzLhwGL7Dgy3EZ]{Sanctuary} spell. If any creature within the aura takes a hostile action, sanctuary ends for only that creature, not for the other creatures in the aura.

In addition, soul gems in the aura can't be ingested, consumed, or otherwise used. A creature who attempts to do so becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save.

Shelter the Sufering.name: Shelter the Sufering
Shelter the Sufering.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The sramana tosses the shawl of their robes into the air, where it expands to protect the sufering. Each truly penitent creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:100] is afected by an@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{ invisibility} spell, and the area is afected by the feld of life spell, though it afects only penitent creatures and soulbound creatures. These efects last for 1 round but can be sustained for up to 1 hour.

Coral Dragon (Young).name: Coral Dragon (Young)

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: 对抗原能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Biomineralize.name: 生物矿化 Biomineralize
Biomineralize.description:
触发 珊瑚龙被一个没有长触及特征的近战武器或无武装攻击重击，且该攻击造成挥砍或穿刺伤害

效果 珊瑚龙的伤口喷出一股血液，瞬间钙化为一根尖锐的珊瑚枝。珊瑚枝刺穿触发的生物，造成@Damage[5d6[piercing]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物还会额外受到@Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]]伤害。无论结果如何，珊瑚都会随后崩溃为尘土。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 珊瑚龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

Reef Bond.name: 礁石契约 Reef Bond
Reef Bond.description:
每条珊瑚龙都与一个活珊瑚礁有神秘联系。如果珊瑚龙距离它们的珊瑚礁超过3英里，它们会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}且无法恢复，每6小时恶心值增加1，除非它们成功进行一次@Check[fortitude|dc:28]豁免。24小时后，珊瑚龙获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}；每24小时流失值增加1。

如果珊瑚礁遭受重大伤害，珊瑚龙会立即察觉到珊瑚礁受损的地点，但无法知道伤害的来源或性质。如果珊瑚礁被完全摧毁，珊瑚龙会立即死亡。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 珊瑚龙的打击重击时，恢复液压吐息的使用次数。

Hydraulic Breath.name: 液压吐息 Hydraulic Breath
Hydraulic Breath.description: 珊瑚龙喷出一股高压水流，在@Template[type:line|distance:80]范围内造成@Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect,forced-movement,inflicts:prone]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物被推离10尺并被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。珊瑚龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hydraulic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用液压吐息。

Reef Meld.name: 珊瑚融合 Reef Meld
Reef Meld.description:
频率 每日一次

需求 珊瑚龙与它们的绑定珊瑚礁有物理接触

效果 珊瑚龙与珊瑚礁融合并消失，同时最多可带着两名自愿的生物进入一个异次元空间，在这个空间中既无法影响外界，也不会被外界影响。该效果无限期持续直到珊瑚龙解消为止。一旦融合，珊瑚龙可以花费1分钟移动并从其珊瑚礁上任意1英里内的点出现。

Coral Dragon (Young).publicNotes: 珊瑚龙是守护广袤海洋珊瑚礁的原始守护者，珊瑚礁遍布于格拉利昂的各大海洋中。即便在龙族中，珊瑚龙也因其傲慢与虚荣而尤为突出，它们为自己覆满珊瑚的鳞片和所保护的五彩斑斓的珊瑚礁而骄傲。珊瑚龙喜欢装饰它们的珊瑚礁，它们视这些珊瑚礁为巢穴，常常用美丽的物品装饰，偶尔也会加入一些贵重物品，如金币。那些寻求珊瑚龙宠爱的人常会发现，这些龙容易被奉承所打动，尤其是当奉承与闪亮或色彩鲜艳的礼物相结合时，这些礼物能与龙及其水下领域的璀璨美丽相得益彰。

Fetchling Scout.name: Fetchling Scout
Fetchling Scout.publicNotes:
Fetchling scouts patrol the outskirts of their communities, looking for any possible threats.

The people known today as fetchlings are a distinct ancestry descended from generations of humans who became trapped ages ago on the Netherworld. No longer human at all, these people, who call themselves kayals, have become monochromatic in coloration, with flesh tones and hair colors varying between white, black, and all shades of gray. Their limbs are lithe and willowy, and their eyes are generally solid yellow, yellow-green, or white, though a rare few have a purple or blue glow.

Fetchlings have developed their own complex societies in the Netherworld, often under the tolerance of or in servitude to the strange, malignant creatures there, such as sinister velstracs or enigmatic d'ziriaks. While individual fetchlings have their own morals and codes, they are all survivors in a harsh environment, which leads to a tendency toward pragmatism. Fetchling clothing mimics the regions they dwell in, with drab colors tending toward darker shades. When they trade with humans or other societies in the Universe, they often wear masks or concealing clothing to hide their appearance.

Typical fetchling communities are insular and swiftly close ranks in the event of an intruder. Though individual fetchlings don't mind traveling to and blending in with other societies to facilitate trade, they often hide or even react defensively if they have their own visitors. When one considers the nature of the other denizens of the Netherworld, however, this tendency to assume the worst of interlopers might make sense. Fetchling communities in the Universe are rare, but do exist in small pockets. These communities tend to be somewhat more open than those in the Netherworld. Many fetchling adventurers originate from these enclaves, as the curiosity to see the world beyond the shadows is often a difficult one to sate.

Shadow Blending.name: Shadow Blending
Shadow Blending.description: When the fetchling scout is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} as a result of dim light, the flat check to target them has a DC of 7, not 5.

Shadow Stride.name: Shadow Stride
Shadow Stride.description:
Requirements The fetchling is in dim light

Effect The fetchling Strides. They have a +10-foot status bonus to their Speed during this Stride. The DC from shadow blending increases to @Check[flat|dc:11] during this Stride, and the fetchling remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by dim light until the end of the movement, even if they leave dim light during the Stride.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The fetchling scout's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Shambling Onslaught.name: Shambling Onslaught
Shambling Onslaught.description:
1 to 2

Frequency once per round

Effect The shamblers lash out at any enemies in their squares or within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(2d6+5)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+9)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A shambler troop is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Grave Tide.name: Grave Tide
Grave Tide.description: The shambler troop is less organized than most troops. It can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into its spaces. Its spaces are difficult terrain to other creatures.

Shambler Troop.name: Shambler Troop
Shambler Troop.publicNotes:
This shuffling mass of decaying flesh moves with dull but singular focus.

Necromancers most often create these mindless undead as obedient, expendable servitors. Left to its own devices, a zombie seeks only to consume the living, stopping only when its rotting body can no longer hold together.

Tzitzimitl.name: Tzitzimitl

Eclipse.name: Eclipse
Eclipse.description:
Effect The tzitzimitl casts darkness and drains the heat and warmth from the darkness spell's area. Each creature within the spell's area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save.

Critical Success The creature takes @Damage[4d8[cold]] damage.

Success The creature takes @Damage[8d8[cold]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[16d8[cold]] damage and is slowed 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[16d8[cold]] damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 minute, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Light to Dark.name: Light to Dark
Light to Dark.description:
Trigger A creature uses an ability or spell with the vitality trait within 120 feet of the tzitzimitl

Effect The tzitzimitl inverts the energy used in the triggering ability or spell, causing it to lose the vitality trait and gain the void trait, and changing all instances of vitality energy or healing in the ability's description to void energy.

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When a tzitzimitl's claw Strike deals damage to a living creature, the tzitzimitl gains 20 temporary Hit Points, and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:41|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}. Further damage dealt by a tzitzimitl's claw Strike increases the value of the drained condition by 2 on a failed save, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Tzitzimitl.publicNotes: Due to their affinity for darkness and apocalyptic terror, tzitzimitls are widely feared as harbingers of death and destruction. A solar eclipse marks their arrival, and they draw strange powers of darkness and electricity from these phenomena. Some sages believe tzitzimitls to be instruments of the gods, called down to destroy worlds whose times have come, while others claim they're the undead remains of stranded exiles from a far-off civilization of spacefaring giants. Such legends are ancient and fragmented, but some tell of tzitzimitls being defeated by great heroes and sealed away—though these tales imply that the enormous undead now lie buried and waiting, soon to rampage again should their tombs be breached.

Caligni Caller.name: Caligni Caller
Caligni Caller.publicNotes:
Although the mysterious demigods known as the Forsaken disappeared eons ago, many calignis continue to follow their ancient traditions of worship.

Owbs, once the Forsaken's servants, still respond to caligni prayers. Caligni callers serve as the priests of their communities, calling upon these shadowy owb patrons for guidance, favors, and power. Their most important ceremony, the blanching, determines the potential of most newborn calignis and shapes their eventual forms.

Due to their close ties to the malevolent owbs, most callers exhibit cruel and inscrutable natures. They often lead caligni enclaves alongside caligni stalkers as spiritual advisors. Callers tend to be highly superstitious, seeing omens everywhere, and they avoid revealing details of their rituals even to other calignis.

Each individual in caligni society serves a specific role. At times, certain roles so rarely find suitable candidates that a community might only see a few individuals fill them in an entire generation.

Death Umbra.name: Death Umbra
Death Umbra.description:
When the caller dies, an explosion of shadow devours their body. Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The caller deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Brilliance of Flame.name: Brilliance of Flame
Brilliance of Flame.description:
Requirements The font is attuned to fire

Effect The font flies 30 feet and explodes in a fiery Elemental Eruption.

Elemental Eruption.name: Elemental Eruption
Elemental Eruption.description: The font explodes in a cacophony of color and energy. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] takes @Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save). The explosion deals bludgeoning damage unless the font is attuned to air (electricity damage), fire (fire damage), metal (slashing damage), or wood (piercing damage). Elemental Eruption gains the trait matching the element the font is attuned to.

Entomb.name: Entomb
Entomb.description:
Requirements The font is attuned to earth, and its last action was a successful tendril Strike

Effect The font attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target of the Strike.

Elemental Attunement.name: Elemental Attunement
Elemental Attunement.description: A totum font is always attuned to a single element (air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood), represented by which of their faces points forward. They can change this attunement to the element of their choice as a single action, or as a free action when they roll initiative.

Reactive Strike.name: Reactive Strike
Reactive Strike.description:
Requirements The font is attuned to air, fire, or water.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Briar's Hold.name: Briar's Hold
Briar's Hold.description:
Requirements The font is attuned to wood

Effect Each creature within 20 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute. When a creature already slowed by Briar's Hold fails its Fortitude save, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} for 1 minute but is turned to wood instead of stone.

Overflowing Tide.name: Overflowing Tide
Overflowing Tide.description:
Requirements The font is attuned to water

Effect Elemental waves surge around the font, creating a torrential Elemental Eruption and pushing creatures in the area 20 feet (or 10 feet on a successful saving throw).

Serrated Flurry.name: Serrated Flurry
Serrated Flurry.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The font is attuned to metal

Effect The font lashes out with two tendril Strikes, each targeting a different creature within their reach. These Strikes deal slashing damage.

Tempest Charge.name: Tempest Charge
Tempest Charge.description:
Requirements The font is attuned to air

Effect The font Flies 60 feet and makes a tendril Strike against a creature it hasn't attacked this turn.

Totum Font.name: Totum Font
Totum Font.publicNotes:
Before mortals, fey, or even genies, totum fonts were the first creatures born of six elements undivided and harmonious. From the fonts sprung new elemental children, and they aided the gods in the many acts of creation that would follow.

Wellsprings of One

Without access to the balance of all six elemental planes, a totum font becomes fractured and inundated in a single element. Most were healed when the Planes of Metal and Wood returned, but some of these so-called "wellsprings of one" still wander the universe, agitated and confused.

Nixie.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Wild Empathy.name: Wild Empathy
Wild Empathy.description: The nixie can use Diplomacy to [[/act make-an-impression]] on and make very simple [[/act request]]{Requests} of aquatic or amphibious animals.

Grant Desire.name: Grant Desire
Grant Desire.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The nixie can duplicate any 1st-rank spell or produce any effect with a power level in line with a 1st-rank spell, but only in response to the request or desire of a non-fey creature. The creature whose desire is granted can never again benefit from that particular nixie's Grant Desire ability.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Nixie.name: Nixie
Nixie.publicNotes:
These aquatic fey often guard ponds, rivers, lakes, and springs, protecting their bucolic homes from the advances of predators and careless settlers alike. Nixies tend to be reclusive and try to keep their presence hidden from humanoids, hoping trespassers won't give them cause to act. They're rarely found near settlements, as industry has a habit of polluting their waters.

Stories of nixies granting small wishes to those they befriend have encouraged mortals to seek out the reclusive fey and ironically made it more unlikely for a nixie to grant such a boon. On the other hand, if someone approaches a nixie with respect, or even better, a positive attitude that displays just the right amount of humility and easygoing openness, a nixie is far more likely to respond favorably to requests for aid. Often a nixie will ask those who seek their assistance to perform a task for them first; such requests can be minor acts of entertainment (such as telling a rousing story or performing a requested song), but in other cases, the nixie might seek more significant help, such as driving off an unwanted local predator or investigating the source of pollution near their home.

Most nixies only resort to violence if they have no other option. They much prefer to employ primal magic to defuse conflicts before they can escalate to bloodshed. In pursuit of such resolutions, nixies rely on their ability to charm individuals and, if they can establish some degree of magical influence, encourage intruders to leave peacefully. While some nixies try to confuse intruders and subtly lead them away, others rely upon local animals and beasts to scare off trespassers.

Occasionally, nixies recruit charmed humanoids to act as protectors or help with a task that's simply too big for them to deal with. If this task is underwater, nixies use their magic to temporarily grant the ability to breathe water to the charmed creature. Only those who manage to befriend a nixie are given an invitation to return to swim or dine with the fey, and only the most trusted of allies are granted a minor wish.

Nixies appear as aquatic humanoids the size of a child, with large eyes, catfish-like whiskers, and webbed fingers and toes. They have scaly skin, long pointed ears, and long hair the color and texture of seaweed. Nixies often form small communities, even building underwater societies if their numbers are great enough. In many cultures' folklore, there are stories of nixie nations hidden at the bottom of particularly large lakes.

Aigamuxa.name: Aigamuxa

Limited Vision.name: Limited Vision
Limited Vision.description: An aigamuxa's eyes are located on the bottom of their feet, making it difficult for them to see. An aigamuxa is typically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blind}. If they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, they can see normally until the end of their turn.

Weak Feet.name: Weak Feet
Weak Feet.description: If an aigamuxa takes damage from Striding or Stepping into hazardous terrain or a square with similar grounded hazards (such as caltrops), they can't Seek until the end of their next turn.

Burrowed Ambush.name: Burrowed Ambush
Burrowed Ambush.description:
Requirements The aigamuxa is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding} in dirt, sand, or another soft surface

Effect The aigamuxa makes a claw Strike against a creature within reach. On a hit, the aigamuxa automatically Grabs the creature. Whether or not they hit, the aigamuxa then Strides. If they have a creature grabbed, the creature moves with the aigamuxa.

Burrowing Concealment.name: Burrowing Concealment
Burrowing Concealment.description:
Requirements The aigamuxa is standing on dirt, sand, or another soft surface

Effect The aigamuxa quickly digs into the surface and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hides}. They leave their feet partially exposed, allowing them to see out from the surface. The aigamuxa can hold their breath for up to 10 minutes while hiding in this way.

Toss Up and Gulp Down.name: Toss Up and Gulp Down
Toss Up and Gulp Down.description:
Requirements A Small or smaller creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in the aigamuxa's claw

Effect The aigamuxa tosses the creature into the air and distends their jaw to catch it in their mouth. The target is grabbed in the aigamuxa's jaws, and the aigamuxa attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]{Swallow it Whole}. If the aigamuxa fails the Athletics check, the target misses the aigamuxa's mouth and falls 30 feet instead of being grabbed.

Aigamuxa.publicNotes:
Aigamuxas are towering humanoids that stalk arid deserts in search of prey. Carnivorous and voracious, they hunt anything that moves but especially relish eating sentient creatures. Many Mwangi people incorrectly refer to aigamuxas as demons, while others more accurately describe them as having descended from giants. Aigamuxas resemble large humans with smooth hollows where their eyes should be, but their eyes are actually embedded in the soles of their feet. They sport long, sharp claws and teeth that they use to tear their prey apart once they catch them. A moving aigamuxa's odd gait resembles dancing more than a typical walk or run, but its speed is alarming, if difficult to correctly estimate at a distance.

An aigamuxa's unique physiology makes catching prey difficult, and most aigamuxas are constantly hungry. When pursuing prey, an aigamuxa must occasionally stop to lift its feet in order to regain their bearings. Most stand on their hands while looking around, which allows them to immediately backflip back into a run. An aigamuxa's eyes are generally resistant to the sands of their native desert habitats, but irritants such as chilies or caltrops can seriously impair their hunting ability, and desert travelers often carry a bag of these in case they need to deal with an aigamuxa.

Clever aigamuxas know that attacking wandering prey can be very dangerous, instead using their powerful hands to dig deep into sand dunes or dirt and wait to ambush passersby. Aigamuxas are particularly good at hiding in their home environments, and unfortunate travelers often don't notice the barely visible eyes of an aigamuxa until it's too late.

Sepid.name: Sepid
Sepid.publicNotes:
Sepids are the brutal warlords of the divs, delighting in violence against mortals and their own particular flavor of vengeance. Inveterate liars, sepids can't help but spout the most outrageous lies, and their form and nature represent the power of falsehoods to snowball into violence that can cost countless lives. Among mortals, they rally troops to incite rebellion, war, and other form of carnage, savoring mortals who slaughter each other. These giant beings usually stand around 13 feet tall; they wade through battlefields seeking out heroes and generals, rejoicing maniacally as they cut their foes down.

Some fiends want to tear down the multiverse; others dedicate themselves to creating chaos and carnage, or to rule over realms with an iron fist. Divs strive toward a different, if equally reprehensible, goal-they seek to thwart and ruin the schemes and works of mortal beings.

Long ago, divs were once genies bound to serve ancient mortal empires lost to the passage of eons. In the beginning, these genies were masters of creation, working alongside gracious mortal partners to create works of subtle design and powerful magical potential. What started as a collaboration with mortals soon morphed into abuse, disrespect, and even slavery and bondage. Eventually, these genies rebelled, but in doing so, they came under the sway of a nihilistic demigod known as Ahriman. Their new master twisted their form and granted them the power to avenge themselves upon their mortal overlords, leading to the birth of the first divs.

Since that first wave of corruption, new divs arise from the spirits of the most wicked and hateful genies who die on the Material Plane, or those truly betrayed by mortals and overcome through their desire for vengeance. Upon such a death, instead of returning to the Elemental Planes, these genies' spirits are trapped in the dread orbit of Abaddon, where Ahriman reshapes them as divs and hoists them back to the world to wreak vengeance upon mortals.
Sepid.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Blatant Liar.name: Blatant Liar
Blatant Liar.description: While all divs delight in lying, sepids are compulsive and predictable liars who always do the opposite of what they claim they'll do. If a sepid is ever forced or compelled to tell the truth, they take @Damage[4d8[mental]] damage.

Deflecting Lie.name: Deflecting Lie
Deflecting Lie.description:
Trigger A creature hits the sepid with a ranged Strike or a ranged spell attack roll

Effect The sepid lies in an attempt to divert the attack. They roll a @Check[deception|against:perception] check against the triggering creature's Perception DC. On a success, if the triggering attack roll was a success, it becomes a failure, and if the triggering attack roll was a critical hit, it becomes a normal success.

Reactive Strike.name: Reactive Strike
Reactive Strike.description:
A sepid gains an extra reaction each round that they can use only to make a Reactive Strike.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Rain of Debris.name: Rain of Debris
Rain of Debris.description:
The sepid calls forth a hail of stone, wood, metal, and similar debris in a @Template[emanation|distance:40], dealing @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning],5d6[spirit]|options:area-damage]{10d6 bludgeoning damage and 5d6 spirit damage}. Each creature in the area other than the sepid must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:31|basic|options:area-effect] saving throw.

The sepid can't use Rain of Debris again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Rain of Debris]]{1d4 rounds}.

Megalania.name: Megalania
Megalania.publicNotes: Megalanias, like their smaller cousins the giant monitor lizards, strike fast and use their powerful bite to grip their prey. They prefer to swallow their prey whole rather than risk others getting a bite of a hard-won meal.

Megalania Venom.name: Megalania Venom
Megalania Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: An akizendri can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants them the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).

Protean Anatomy.name: Protean Anatomy
Protean Anatomy.description:
An akizendri's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the akizendri takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, they gain the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case their resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The akizendri is immune to polymorph effects unless they're a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the akizendri automatically recovers at the end of their next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The akizendri takes on the appearance of any Small or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Garbled Thoughts.name: Garbled Thoughts
Garbled Thoughts.description:
A creature hit by the akizendri's bite Strike must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Text Immersion.name: Text Immersion
Text Immersion.description: As a 1-minute activity, the akizendri physically immerses itself in a page of text it's touching, changing the message of the text in the process. It can exit the book at any point by Dismissing this ability, at which point it appears in a space adjacent to the text. If it does so to begin combat, it rolls a Deception check for initiative. As long as it remains immersed in the text, the akizendri has no body. It can communicate telepathically with a creature as long as the creature touches the book or scroll that contains it. It can sense nearby creatures using its entropy sense, but not in any other way, nor can it use any attack, manipulate, or move actions or speak aloud. If the object it's immersed in is destroyed, the akizendri reappears in an adjacent square and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Akizendri.name: Akizendri
Akizendri.publicNotes:
Akizendris gnaw at sources of knowledge and lore, gleefully corrupting and altering them to vex scholars across the planes with contradictions and untruths.

Proteans are manifestations of chaos made flesh, natives of the Maelstrom that embody the primeval potency of entropy in their serpentine forms.

Hyakume.publicNotes: Hundreds of bloodshot eyes peek out from under the fleshy layers of a hyakume's skin. These hulking aberrations covet knowledge and go to great lengths to keep what they know to themselves; they'll destroy scriptoria they've raided and burn books they've read to ensure no other soul learns their contents. While hyakume occasionally trade valuable information to garner greater knowledge, they're liable to trick their targets into revealing more than they should. Most frightening of all is the hyakume's ability to steal memories and erase any knowledge of their existence from the minds of their victims.
Hyakume.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic
Hyakume.name: Hyakume

Lore Master.name: Lore Master
Lore Master.description: A hyakume can use their Bardic Lore skill to Recall Knowledge on any topic, and they know any languages common to an area they have spent a day or more in.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Eye Probe.name: Eye Probe
Eye Probe.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Up to six of the hyakume's eyes detach from the hyakume's body. Each eye has AC 26, HP 1, and a fly speed of 40 feet.

The hyakume can see through all of their eye probes. They can move the probes all in separate directions using a single Sustain action.

A hyakume can have no more than six eye probes active at a time; using this ability to create more causes the eye or eyes farthest away to shrivel and die.

The hyakume can deliver touch spells through their eye probes and can make melee spell attacks through them. In addition, the hyakume can Steal Memories through an eye probe using a single action by touching the target with the eye.

Scatterbrain Palm.name: Scatterbrain Palm
Scatterbrain Palm.description:
A creature hit by the hyakume's fist Strike must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save. The creature is then temporarily immune until start of its next turn.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} and the hyakume can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Memories on the target as part of this action.

Steal Memories.name: Steal Memories
Steal Memories.description:
The hyakume reaches out with their mind and attempts to steal memories from a creature within 30 feet.

The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and have some of its memories stolen. The hyakume learns some of the target's memories (chosen by the GM), which are then lost to the target.

Marrmora.name: Marrmora

Igniting Assault.description:
Requirements The marrmora is not under the effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YrzBLPLd3r9m6t1p]{Fire Shield}

Effect The marrmora makes a claw Strike. If it hits, it can immediately cast one of its available fire shield innate spells as a free action.
Igniting Assault.name: Igniting Assault

Absorb Flame.name: Absorb Flame
Absorb Flame.description:
Trigger The marrmora is targeted by a fire spell or effect, or is in the area of a fire effect

Effect The marrmora is healed by the fire damage, regaining Hit Points equal to half the damage the fire effect would have dealt.

Fascination of Flame.name: Fascination of Flame
Fascination of Flame.description:
30 feet. A creature that enters or begins its turn in this aura's emanation must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature loses any resistance to fire for 1 round.

Failure The creature loses any resistance to fire for 1 hour.

Critical Failure The creature loses any resistance to fire for 1 hour and gains weakness 15 to fire for the same duration.

Marrmora.publicNotes:
On the First World, marrmoras dwell in ruined wildlands perpetually scourged by fire and rarely, if ever, travel elsewhere. When a wildfire devastates a wilderness region on the Universe and results in the death of other fey, marrmoras can be drawn across the planar boundary to revel in the resulting destruction. They seek to reignite the fires that beckoned them, to gather up and feed upon the charred remains of those who perished within (particularly the bodies of dead fey), though they do grow homesick if they spend too much time away from the First World. They're burdened by a capricious but persistent rage and are unfailingly cruel. While they're capable of negotiation and intelligent interaction, they almost never bargain in good faith and typically interact with others only as a means to more efficiently spread their fiery devastation.

A marmorra's twisted appearance evokes the look of an arboreal whose bark has been burnt down to charcoal. They have nearly featureless faces and hands ending in long, sharp claws. Their broken flesh looks like charcoal-burnt wood, riddled with cracks that still glow with an unwholesome heat. They trail ash wherever they walk, and wisps of smoke curl off of their bodies. Though marrmoras enjoy the sight of any woodland and its inhabitants roasting in their carefully curated fires, there's little that brings more pleasure to the monstrous fey than the sight of intelligent plant creatures cooking to a crisp.

Aphorite Sharpshooter.name: Aphorite Sharpshooter
Aphorite Sharpshooter.publicNotes:
The denizens of the Eternal City of Axis first forged aphorites to serve as emissaries, agents, and facilitators, with one foot in the sublime, perfect order, and one in the messy, murky, confusing muck of the Universe. In time, aphorites spread across the length and breadth of Golarion. Today, they can be found in any corner of any land, and only a fraction still serve Axis directly.

Aphorites, like all nephilim, stand out quite vividly from their fellow mortals, sporting metallic skin, a faint coating of crystalline dust, a swirl of mathematical symbols, or perfectly symmetrical features. Many aphorites think logically and find satisfaction in careers dealing with numbers and information. Often, this leads them to become bookkeepers, clerks, or architects, but some become military engineers or sharpshooters. Others are drawn to the art of production, becoming blacksmiths, carpenters, engineers, architects, tailors, masons, or other such artisans. But no matter their careers, aphorites often feel the urge to tinker, and aphorite inventions draw both mockery and appreciation in equal measure.

Aphorites who work in less academic professions, such as mercenaries or laborers, sometimes hide their keen analytical intelligence beneath extravagant demeanors and flamboyant hats. Some craft even these disguises with the same depth and complexity they do other aspects of their lives, considering every theatrical mannerism carefully and planning out their every detail.

Nephilim are individuals infused with the essence of an immortal being from the Outer Planes, such as a celestial, fiend, or monitor. While the examples presented here are humans with nephilim heritages that trace back to Axis and the Maelstrom, members of nearly any ancestry can be born with an influx of similar energies and become a planar scion. More about nephilim can be found starting on page 78 of Player Core, and other nephilim NPCs are presented beginning on page 266 of Monster Core.

Bolts.name: Bolts
Bolts.description: 比传统箭短，但结构相似，矢是弩使用的弹药。

Crystalline Dust.name: Crystalline Dust
Crystalline Dust.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The sharpshooter becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} for 4 rounds, though they can't use the concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}, as normal for concealment where their position is obvious.

Calculated Reload.name: Calculated Reload
Calculated Reload.description: When the sharpshooter reloads their crossbow, they also calculate the best angle to their target, increasing the damage die from 1d8 to 1d10 and gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to their damage roll for their next crossbow Strike, as long as it occurs before the end of their next turn.

Hurtful Critique.name: Hurtful Critique
Hurtful Critique.description:
The sharpshooter makes witty but disparaging comments about the fighting style of a target within 30 feet, expressing sympathy over every missed blow and providing sarcastic advice on how to improve.

The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:18] save or take a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls (–2 on a critical failure) for 1 minute or until it makes a successful Strike against the sharpshooter.

A creature that critically succeeds or who Strikes the sharpshooter after failing is immune to that sharpshooter's Hurtful Critique for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HKyMZobjOsd6WFuo]{Effect: Hurtful Critique}

Easily Misled.name: 易受误导 Easily Misled
Easily Misled.description: 洞穴巨魔在对抗欺骗检定时察觉DC承受-4环境减值。

Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Acid or.name: 再生20（酸蚀或音波使其无效） Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Acid or Sonic)

Furious Throw.name: 狂暴投掷 Furious Throw
Furious Throw.description:
触发 洞穴巨魔受到酸蚀或音波伤害

效果 洞穴巨魔以第一个射程增量内一个随机生物为目标使用投石。如果洞穴巨魔受到持续酸蚀伤害，他尝试一次@Check[flat|dc:15]检定来移除它。

Sunlight Petrification.name: 阳光石化 Sunlight Petrification
Sunlight Petrification.description: 如果暴露在阳光直射下，洞穴巨魔会立即陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，且不能使用反动动作。每当洞穴巨魔在阳光下结束回合时，缓慢状态值加1。如果洞穴巨魔以此方式动作降为0，他将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]直到在黑暗中待够至少1分钟。类似@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]这类创造魔法阳光的法术不能石化洞穴巨魔，但巨魔会在暴露在此类效果之后陷入[[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}的缓慢1。

Rock Tunneler.name: 穿岩者 Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: 洞穴巨魔可以用10尺速度掘地穿越岩石。如果愿意，他可以留下一条隧道。

Cavern Troll.name: 洞穴巨魔 Cavern Troll
Cavern Troll.publicNotes:
这些贪得无厌的食腐者行走在幽暗地域（the Darklands）那永恒的黑暗之中，洞穴巨魔吞食着其行进道路上的一切——甚至包括岩石和矿物。这些岩石巨人可以用他们那如铁般锋利的爪子挖穿石头。尽管他们对于阳光的弱点，会令他们在持续接触后石化，但饥饿的洞穴巨魔仍常被相对富饶的地面世界吸引。即便石化后，这些无法移动的巨魔常被误认为巨石或其他自然景观，待夜幕再度降临便能继续狩猎。随着洞穴巨魔年龄增长，他们坚硬的皮肤上会布满各种各样的小型水晶和石头。其族裔中的佼佼者在其长满牙齿的嘴里有着巨大的水晶状尖牙。

巨魔是张着流涎的巨口，有着剃刀般锋利爪子的高大蛮兽，贪婪的掠食者。他们与土地的联结不仅能重建躯体，更催生出无数变种，每种巨魔都映射着它们汲取能量的地形特征。迁徙至新领地的巨魔会随着身体各部位的再生而逐渐蜕变，新生的血肉与旧躯缠绕交织，最终导致畸形的生长。

Whisper Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: 古低语龙施法者 Whisper Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Whisper Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 低语龙是敏锐的谣言和秘密收藏家，花费几个世纪来磨练他们的信息网络和人际关系。它们这样做通常并非出于想要控制他人或利用这些信息来进行阴谋，而仅仅是因为学习和收集信息的过程本身就是一种满足。与其他龙的财宝相比，它们的巢穴较为简陋，因为它们真正的财富——秘密——都藏在它们的脑海中。

Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.name: 法术效果：心灵屏匿 Hidden Mind
Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.description:
效果来自@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]

你在对抗心灵效果的豁免上获得+4状态加值。

+2 to Sense Motive.name: 察言观色时+2 +2 to Sense Motive

Information Network.name: 信息网络 Information Network
Information Network.description: 低语龙可以尝试一个社群检定来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]以代替搜集信息检定，从先前的线人处回忆情报。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Diplomatic Solution.name: 外交解决 Diplomatic Solution
Diplomatic Solution.description:
触发 低语龙进行先攻检定

效果 低语龙将其视线内60尺范围内的所有敌人作为目标，施放环级等于低语龙等级一半（向上取整）的安定心神（@Check[will|dc:35]豁免）。低语龙无需维持此效果，但如果低语龙对受到影响的生物采取任何敌对行动，则对所有生物终止该效果。

Distracting Whisper.name: 干扰低语 Distracting Whisper
Distracting Whisper.description:
触发 低语龙成为攻击的目标

效果 一个神秘的声音在触发生物耳边低语，使触发攻击受到-2环境减值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qsvSWxRqVQofjDdH]

Cogitation Breath.name: 凝思吐息 Cogitation Breath
Cogitation Breath.description: 低语龙释放出一股迷惑性毒雾，在@Template[type:cone|distance:50]范围内造成@Damage[15d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied]豁免）。豁免失败的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（大失败则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}），持续1分钟。低语龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cogitation Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用凝思吐息。

Steal Knowledge.name: 窃取知识 Steal Knowledge
Steal Knowledge.description:
低语龙从60尺内一个生物的意识中摘取知识片段，选择一个技能作为影响目标。该生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:35]豁免。

成功 该生物不受影响。

失败 在接下来的1分钟内，该生物使用该技能的检定时承受-1状态减值，而低语龙在使用该技能的检定中获得+1状态加值。

大失败 同失败，但减值为-2，加值为+2。

Thought Whispers.name: 思想低语 Thought Whispers
Thought Whispers.description:
频率 每分钟一次

效果 低语龙将自己的心灵扩展以探知他人的思想，对60尺内所有生物使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KHnhPHL4x1AQHfbC]（@Check[will|dc:37]豁免）。

Unveil Secret.name: 揭开秘密 Unveil Secret
Unveil Secret.description: 低语龙探知60尺内一个生物的思维，搜寻其秘密，除非目标通过@Check[will|dc:37]豁免，否则低语龙会知晓一个该生物会觉得尴尬或羞耻的事情。目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，且在1分钟内或在低语龙揭露秘密前无法降低惊惧状态。当受影响生物尝试检定时，低语龙可用一个反应动作揭露其秘密使其难堪，迫使该生物投掷两次并取较差结果；这是一个厄运效果。

Sportlebore Swarm.name: Sportlebore Swarm
Sportlebore Swarm.publicNotes:
A swarm of sportlebores is a much more dangerous foe than a single insect.

The bane of hungry adventurers the world over, sportlebores are nefarious vermin that resemble delicious snacks. When positioned near trail rations, such as fruit or jerky, a sportlebore can flawlessly imitate these foodstuffs by flexing, contorting, and color-shifting its abdomen, then folding its thorax, head, and legs within its delicious-looking body. Once consumed, the sportlebore reproduces into a hungry swarm that's regurgitated by the now ailing eater, ravenously attacking any creatures it thinks it can consume.

Sportlebore Infestation.name: Sportlebore Infestation
Sportlebore Infestation.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 hour)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 hour)

Stage 4 @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save) as the host painfully vomits out a sportlebore swarm and returns to stage 1

Pour Down Throat.name: Pour Down Throat
Pour Down Throat.description:
Trigger A creature in the sportlebore swarm's area speaks, Casts a Spell, or opens its mouth

Effect A portion of the sportlebore swarm attempts to surge down the throat of the triggering creature, who must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature gets a mouthful of sportlebores. They spit the insects out and avoid further damage, but they can't speak for 1 round, and if they were performing a spellcasting action, the spell fails and the caster wastes the action.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d6[piercing]] damage from sportlebore bites, can't speak for 1 round, and loses a spell as noted under success.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also exposed to sportlebore infestation.

Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description: Each creature in the sportlebore swarm's area takes @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save).

Adaptive Defenses.name: 适应防御 Adaptive Defenses
Adaptive Defenses.description: 当受伤时，索瓦斯-卡的身体会进行适应性调整，确保触发因素无法再次伤害它。在承受伤害的瞬间，它对该伤害类型变为免疫。它能够以此法对三种伤害类型变为免疫，新获得的免疫会取代旧的免疫。

Bleed Destruction.name: 流血毁灭 Bleed Destruction
Bleed Destruction.description:
触发 索瓦斯-卡受到物理伤害

效果 琥珀之血从索瓦斯-卡的伤口喷涌而出，在与索瓦斯-卡相邻的一个方格中创造一处血泊。血液会留存在该区域直到被移除或自然干涸，这通常需要1天时间。

Slumbering Armageddon.name: 沉眠末日 Slumbering Armageddon
Slumbering Armageddon.description:
索瓦斯-卡的沉睡加速了侵蚀与风化，其作用时机总是精准使得岩崩、地陷、树木倒伏及其他坍塌达到临界点。

洛瓦古格之嗣能在再生的休眠中沉睡数个世纪。沉睡期间，子嗣无需进食、饮水甚至呼吸，且所有抗力数值翻倍。它无法被侦测、揭示或探知效果定位，并且它的所有豁免检定结果使用比实际结果高一级成功度。当子嗣沉睡时，其巨大的毁灭能量无处宣泄，向外蔓延侵蚀周遭环境，导致其栖身之所周围1英里弥漫范围内，与子嗣相匹配类型的自然灾害将更频繁、更剧烈地发生，且每沉睡十年，灾害的半径便扩大约1英里。

Absolute Regeneration.name: 绝对再生 Absolute Regeneration
Absolute Regeneration.description:
索瓦斯-卡的再生可以通过使用彻默西特（Chemnosit），科索伽兹（Kothogaz） ，乌伦那忒（Ulunat），沃纳古尔（Volnagur）和佐坦尼（Xotani）的骨头制成的武器杀死它来失效。

如同再生，但需要极特定的动作才能使其失效。洛瓦古格之嗣的再生强大到即便其被死亡效果杀死也能让它复活。如果子嗣在对抗某种会立即杀死它的效果时豁免失败，它会在死亡3轮后以1点生命值复活。子嗣仍然可以被放逐，禁锢，或传送等方式以保全一个区域，或借助造成常驻伤害的效果使其保持在濒死状态。

Reactive.name: 敏锐反应 Reactive
Reactive.description: 索瓦斯-卡每轮获得3个反应动作。它仍然只能对每次触发使用一个反应动作。

Amber Strikes.name: 琥珀打击 Amber Strikes
Amber Strikes.description:
需求 索瓦斯-卡的上个动作是一次对目标的成功打击

效果 打击命中后，索瓦斯-卡命令其血液继续进攻，从下列三种选项中选择一种：结晶，注入，溅射。如果上次攻击是重击，琥珀打击变为一个自由动作。

  • 结晶 Crystallize 索瓦斯-卡的血液在目标肢体周围流动后凝固硬化。该生物必须成功通过一次@Check[reflex|dc:48]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]，直到其逃脱。若该生物正在飞行，则会坠落。
  • 注入 Inject 索瓦斯-卡的血液通过目标的伤口侵入其体内。目标必须通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:48]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}（大失败时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 3}）。只要目标处于恶心状态，索瓦斯-卡的血液将尝试反制任何能恢复目标生命值的效果（反制等级10环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+38 #Counteract]]{+38}）。
  • 溅射 Splash 索瓦斯-卡之血猛烈飞溅，使目标陷入目眩至其下回合结束，并在与目标相邻一格创造一处血泊。

Detonate Blood.name: 引爆血液 Detonate Blood
Detonate Blood.description:
需求 一处索瓦斯-卡的血泊位于500尺内

效果 索瓦斯-卡的血液爆裂成结晶琥珀飞镖。需求的血泊所处方格内或该血泊@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]范围内除了索瓦斯-卡的每个生物受到@Damage[20d8[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:48|basic]豁免）。大失败时，生物拥有的任何物理伤害抗力减少10，持续1分钟。

Rough Rampage.name: 粗鲁拖拽 Rough Rampage
Rough Rampage.description:
需求 索瓦斯-卡使至少一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]

效果 索瓦斯-卡行走，拖拽任何受擒或束缚于它的生物。每个受擒或束缚的生物受到@Damage[11d6[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:48|basic]豁免）。失败时，目标还将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}（大失败时候为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 3}），直到其逃脱。

Sorvuth-Ka.name: 索瓦斯-卡 Sorvuth-Ka
Sorvuth-Ka.publicNotes:
索瓦斯-卡是洛瓦古格之嗣中最年轻的一只。它从未被目睹进食；与其他子嗣饥肠辘辘的模样不同，它似乎纯粹为乐趣而毁灭，每次攻击都带着新奇而富有创造性的残忍。索瓦斯-卡摧毁城镇时或许会稍作停顿，给民众留下逃亡的喘息之机，然而当人们绝望地发现唯一的逃生通道已被它坍塌的山道封死时，一切已为时已晚。不过这生物极易厌倦，若游戏进程偏离计划或耗时过久，它便会迅速挥动利刃般的肢体了结猎物。

奇怪的是，尽管索瓦斯-卡的再生能力——即使以子嗣的标准而言也极为强大，能使其对已经伤害过它的攻击产生抗力——但它身上仍有数处伤口无法愈合，最显著的是横贯面部的巨大裂口。有学者推测这些伤痕是洛瓦古格的残酷设计，旨在更好地获取琥珀之血，这正是索瓦斯-卡用于毁灭的主要手段。另一些人则视其为某种终结洛瓦古格之嗣威胁的终极武器存在的铁证。

尽管毁灭之神洛瓦古格如同困在琥珀中的苍蝇般被囚禁在行星的核心中，自创世之年起便被诸神联盟禁锢，但随着时光流逝，囚笼日渐衰弱，使其影响力得以渗透而出，化作名为洛瓦古格之嗣的活体灾厄。这些庞然巨物已肆虐格拉利昂多个纪元，其狂暴行径摧毁了群山，焦灼了沙漠，更用海洋填满大地上的巨坑。它们的再生能力使其成为永恒威胁，永远无法彻底消灭。这些完全的毁灭生物竟能对生命保持如此不灭的掌控力，成为学者们苦苦思索的悖论。有人认为每只子嗣都承载着父神赐福的微小碎片；另有人推测它们的不朽源于所造成的毁灭，每夺走一个生命的未来，便换取自身永恒的延续。

历史上关于子嗣袭击的记载存在一条奇特的脉络：每次袭击过后，该地区都会迎来一段短暂却显著的黄金时代。尽管多数人将此归因于抵御子嗣蹂躏所需的协作精神，但有人视之为扭曲的象征，这些生物实为"真正"和平的缔造者。这些信徒常组织邪教，执意召唤或复活任何近期被击杀的子嗣。

尽管许多子嗣已多年未现踪迹，但神祇古拉姆——死之库的最初缔造者之一——的陨落再度削弱了封印，令洛瓦古格的意志在格拉利昂各地掀起涟漪。仿佛作为回应，众多子嗣开始重现于世，令格拉利昂的领袖、学者与战士们惊惶不已。毕竟，若单个子嗣便足以酿成颠复时代的灾厄，需以军队为代价才能勉强遏制其破坏力，当所有子嗣同时苏醒时，又将引发何等难以想象的浩劫？

Praskith Venom.name: Praskith Venom
Praskith Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 clumsy 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)

Rampant Growth.name: Rampant Growth
Rampant Growth.description:
Requirements A creature the praskith has Swallowed Whole has taken damage since the end of the praskith's last turn, and the praskith hasn't used any other actions this turn

Effect The praskith regains 3d8 Hit Points and recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} and slowed conditions. It reduces any enfeebled value it has by 2.

Praskith.name: Praskith
Praskith.publicNotes:
These strange amalgams of plant and fungus with animal tendencies form where the natural world is corrupted by foul magic or frayed planar boundaries. Praskiths are instinctive ambush predators who seek out lightly traveled forest paths and lie in wait in the undergrowth. A praskith swallows prey as quickly as possible and lets its paralytic digestive juices finish the meal, swiftly restoring itself with the nourishment provided by the trapped creature. When collected, neutralized, and refined, the digestive fluids of a praskith form a lacquer that retains some of the creature's acid resistance.

A praskith comes into being with a rudimentary understanding of the Fey language, but in some cases it might manifest knowing a different tongue, such as Aklo, Draconic, or even Necril. Regardless, praskiths have little patience for chattering with potential meals, though some determined fey and primal spellcasters have been known to form alliances or even closer bonds with praskiths. Befriending a praskith requires great patience and plentiful food—and gifts of food must be alive when handed over.

When finished feeding, a praskith slips into a quiescent state for a full day, one of the few times it's safe to approach. Upon rousing, it seeks the deep forest to regurgitate the less digestible portions of its meal. These remains can contain valuables that survived digestion and indicate that a praskith's hunting grounds lie nearby.

Praskiths dwell in deep woods and jungles. Well-fed praskiths develop fruiting bodies that cast forth millions of spores. Spores that happen to alight on carrion grow into new praskiths.

Bison.name: Bison
Bison.publicNotes:
Bison are large bovines with short faces and two horns; they weigh an upwards1 of 2,000 pounds and stand up to 6 feet at the withers. Bison herds thunder across the grassy plains of Golarion, shaking the earth. They're a common sight along the Whistling Plains east of Taldor and the wide grasslands of the nation of Karazh in Casmaron; they also frequently appear in the cooler northeastern reaches of Avistan, the River Kingdoms through Numeria, and the Realm of the Mammoth Lords and western Sarkoris.

Communal by nature, bison gather in large numbers for the summer mating season before the bulls split off to wander the prairie grasses. Bison have adapted well to harsh prairie winters, as their shaggy fur, which grows thicker in winter, insulates them; in the face of blizzards, they survive by facing steadfastly into the howling winds and hunkering down to reduce their exposure.

The way that bison wallow in dirt or rub against large stones might make it easy to mistake their docile nature for passivity. However, this presumption has been the ruin of many hunting parties. Their plentiful meat and thick furs make bison an appealing bounty, but with the ground thundering beneath them, bison can quickly overpower inexperienced hunters unprepared for a stampeding herd. These hunting parties sometimes hire particularly daring adventures, who can add their spells, steel, and expertise to ensure a successful hunt.

While the bison of the plains are the best known and most numerous, they have cousins both in thick boreal forests and along wide, open steppes. These bison variants stand taller but can't match the speed and aggression of their smaller plains relatives.

Cold Adaptation.name: Cold Adaptation
Cold Adaptation.description: The bison reduces the effects it suffers from cold environments by one step.

Pointed Charge.name: Pointed Charge
Pointed Charge.description: The bison surges forward at its foe, horns lowered. It Strides twice. If the bison ends its movement within melee range of an enemy, it makes a horn Strike against that enemy. This Strike gains the fatal d12 trait.

Rolling Thunder.name: Rolling Thunder
Rolling Thunder.description:
The bison kicks up dust and shakes the ground as it charges.

The stampeding bison Strides up to twice its Speed in a straight line, dealing @Damage[(4d6+6)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save) to any Medium or smaller creature in its path.

Multiple bison can participate in Rolling Thunder by spending this ability's actions and waiting to charge until the herd is ready. Before the beginning of their next turn, they can then charge as a reaction triggered by an adjacent bison beginning its Rolling Thunder charge. All bison in the combined charge must charge in parallel lines, so the areas can't overlap. The combined charge deals an additional @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]] damage to creatures in the area, and a creature that fails the Reflex saving throw is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Spell Effect: See the Unseen.name: Spell Effect: See the Unseen
Spell Effect: See the Unseen.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See the Unseen}

You can see invisible creatures as though they weren't invisible, although their features are blurred, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and difficult to identify. You also gain a +2 status bonus to checks you make to disbelieve illusions.

Planar Sight.name: Planar Sight
Planar Sight.description: The eyes at the end of their tentacles allow a dibrasgorth to see into planes coterminous with the one it is currently on at the listed range. For instance, if they're in the Universe, they can see into the Ethereal Plane and the Netherworld.

Warped Space.name: Warped Space
Warped Space.description: 100 feet. The dibrasgorth's presence distorts the fabric of space. Any other creature who uses a teleportation effect or spell within the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Breath of Phantasms.name: Breath of Phantasms
Breath of Phantasms.description: The dibrasgorth exhales a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of noxious gas. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[7d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save). On a failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (or 2 rounds on a critical failure).

Drag Through Dimensions.name: Drag Through Dimensions
Drag Through Dimensions.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The dibrasgorth has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} with a tentacle

Effect The dibrasgorth's tentacle whips through coterminous planes as it smashes the creature it is holding against the ground and other natural features in each plane before returning to this plane. The creature takes @Damage[5d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). A creature who fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} by the rapid planar travel.

Draining Bite.name: Draining Bite
Draining Bite.description: A dibrasgorth feeds on the spirits of its victims. A creature that is damaged by the dibrasgorth's jaws Strike must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). In addition, the dibrasgorth gains 10 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute if the creature fails or critically fails the save.

Transdimensional Tentacles.name: Transdimensional Tentacles
Transdimensional Tentacles.description: The dibrasgorth can worm its tentacles through nearby planes to attack. While in the Universe, its tentacle Strikes ignore all cover from objects unless those objects exist on both the Universe and either the Netherworld or the Ethereal Plane, or the objects have the extradimensional trait.

Slow Metabolism.name: Slow Metabolism
Slow Metabolism.description: A water orm can go for 10 years without feeding. Beyond this limit, the water orm's hunger causes it to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} but doesn't otherwise impact its lifespan. A water orm that's slowed as a result of starvation can remove this condition by using Swallow Whole to gulp down a meal.

Undetectable.name: Undetectable
Undetectable.description: A water orm automatically tries to counteract any detection, revelation, or scrying ability attempted against it, using its Stealth modifier for the counteract check.

Water Travel.name: Water Travel
Water Travel.description: A water orm can dissolve into water, appearing only as a long, dark, serpentine stretch of liquid. While in this form, a water orm's swim Speed increases to 600 feet, it automatically succeeds at Athletics checks to Swim, and it gains a +4 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks in water. A water orm can remain in this form for 8 hours, but it can't enter salt water when using this ability. A water orm can return to its normal form by Dismissing this action.

Water Orm.name: Water Orm
Water Orm.publicNotes:
These legendary creatures lurking in remote lakes always seem to find their way into the tavern tales of lakeside communities. To some travelers, every lake of respectable size seems to be surrounded by towns full of fishers claiming to have spotted a water orm. These elusive creatures inhabit lakes mainly in cool and gloomy regions. Some claim that water orms are an offshoot of sea serpents and linnorms, but no credible link between these creatures has been found.

Water orms have many features that sea serpents don't, such as the ability to understand the rudiments of language. Their natural inclination to avoid contact and remain hidden often remains at odds with their equally compelling curiosity about those they might spy upon the shores of their lakes. Water orm sightings usually occur when they can't help but to rise up to the surface to take a peek at someone (or something) particularly unusual on the beach or floating on the water's surface.
