Creatures of the katpaskir's choice who start their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:37] save or treat the area as greater difficult terrain and uneven ground ([[/act balance dc=20]]{DC 20}). A creature who succeeds still treats the area as difficult terrain. For such creatures, the distance through the aura is doubled for determining range penalty.

Mirrored Summons.name: Mirrored Summons
Mirrored Summons.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet that the katpaskir is aware of casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lTDixrrNKaCvLKwX]{Summon Celestial} or otherwise summons a holy creature

Effect The katpaskir casts summon fiend, regaining the daily ability to do so if needed. This effect is automatically sustained as long as the triggering summoning is sustained, for up to 1 minute.

Warp Sense.name: Warp Sense
Warp Sense.description: The katpaskir senses changes in the planar fabric within 1 mile, including any teleportation effect, sensing the direction and distance to the disturbance. If it senses such a disturbance within 500 feet, the katpaskir can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ek5XI0aEdZhBgm21]{Scouting Eye} to observe the area without needing line of sight to the location.

Dimensional Ambush.name: Dimensional Ambush
Dimensional Ambush.description: The katpaskir casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}, then makes a melee Strike that deals three extra dice of damage. This Strike counts as two attacks when calculating the katpaskir's multiple attack penalty.

Magma Scorpion.name: Magma Scorpion
Magma Scorpion.publicNotes:
Whether skittering through Chthonian wastelands or basking in the searing sand of the deepest deserts, magma scorpions have charred carapaces, constantly emitting vision-warping waves of heat.

Destructive manifestations of the Plane of Fire, fire elementals sometimes incorporate burning materials into their being or superheated matter, such as molten rock or searing smoke. In combat, they tend to be aggressive and somewhat reckless. Their attacks can sometimes cause major destruction to the surrounding environment, and many fire elementals seem to enjoy seeing their flames spread far and wide.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The magma scorpion ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Magma Scorpion Venom.name: Magma Scorpion Venom
Magma Scorpion Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:26]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (1 round) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Eseneth.name: Eseneth
Eseneth.publicNotes:
Eseneths, commonly known as soul-stitchers, are dispassionate surgeons who repair damaged souls. They operate with professional efficiency, manifesting large stitching needles composed of spirit energy to do their necessary work. An eseneth appears as a slim, hairless, gray-skinned humanoid with no facial features. Patches of dark, raised flesh dot their upper chest and shoulders.

Many psychopomps are intimately involved with the Boneyard's massive bureaucracy. Few pursue mercy, justice, or personal gain; their duties to Pharasma and her Boneyard are supreme. Nevertheless, individual psychopomps interpret their duties in different ways, which might put them in conflict with mortals or even with each other.

Mend Soul.name: Mend Soul
Mend Soul.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The eseneth restores @Damage[25[healing]] HP to itself or an incorporeal creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Seize Soul.name: Seize Soul
Seize Soul.description:
Requirements The eseneth has a corporeal creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The eseneth tries to yank the soul out of the required creature. The eseneth attempts an Athletics check against the target's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success The eseneth grabs the target's soul. The body is released and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 2 rounds. When the body ceases being paralyzed, its soul returns instantly, and the target wakes. The soul—grabbed by the eseneth—is incorporeal, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, has a fly Speed equal to the creature's Speed, and otherwise has all the same statistics. It can't attack, cast spells, or attempt any skill checks that require a physical body other than checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} (DC 38), and it must always maintain line of effect to its body.

Success As critical success, but the paralysis ends after 1 round.

Failure The target remains grabbed or restrained, but its soul remains in its body.

Critical Failure The target is no longer grabbed or restrained.

Shepherd's Touch.name: Shepherd's Touch
Shepherd's Touch.description: A eseneth's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal @Damage[2d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[2d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

Shred Soul.name: Shred Soul
Shred Soul.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The eseneth has an incorporeal creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The eseneth deals @Damage[(3d10+14)[force]] damage to the required creature.

Spirit Grasp.name: Spirit Grasp
Spirit Grasp.description: An eseneth can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} incorporeal creatures despite being corporeal. The eseneth uses Athletics to Grapple incorporeal creatures as normal but can't use Athletics for other actions against incorporeal creatures, like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip}.

Rune Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: 古符文龙施法者 Rune Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Rune Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 符文龙天生对符文的力量有着深刻的洞察。大多数符文龙的鳞片上刻有各种符文，它们的身体可以魔法般地增强这些符文的力量。符文龙通常不自己施法，而是依靠它们即兴创造符文的能力来产生所需的效果。符文龙常常把自己的财宝称为图书馆，因为它们的财宝中充满了由不同文化的人们使用多种语言写成的重要历史文献、戏剧、演讲、教科书和法术书。尽管它们通常可以借助魔法说某种语言，但它们更喜欢在讲者的语境中学习语言，以便理解其中隐藏的细微差别和符号中的魔力。

equipment-Common runes of 14th level or.name: 刻在鳞片上的常见符文（14级或更低） Common runes of 14th level or lower etched upon their scales

Magic Sense.name: 魔法感知 Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: 符文龙能感知到列出范围内所有激活的魔法能力与效果。当符文龙进行搜寻时，它在列出范围内获得4环级侦测魔法法术的效果（此外还获得搜寻的正常好处）。

Runic Scales.name: 符文鳞片 Runic Scales
Runic Scales.description: 符文龙的鳞片作为符文石存在。符文龙不能使用蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文的效果或能力，但它们可以将其转移到适当的物品上。以这种方式向物品转移或从物品上转移一个符文需要1分钟，在此期间符文龙处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。该过程自动完成无需检定，但如果符文龙在此过程中停止或受到打扰，符文将被摧毁。符文龙可以在其鳞片上蚀刻任意数量的符文，但它们通常一次只在鳞片上蚀刻少数符文。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Canceling Rune.name: 抵消符文 Canceling Rune
Canceling Rune.description:
触发 符文龙成为一个需要豁免的法术的目标

效果 符文龙尝试瓦解法术的基础符文。它尝试反制该法术（反制环级10环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+33 #Counteract]]{+33}）。若成功，符文龙不受该法术影响；其他目标正常受到该法术影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Canceling Rune]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用抵消符文。

Retributive Rune.name: 惩戒符文 Retributive Rune
Retributive Rune.description:
触发 一个15尺内的生物对符文龙造成伤害

效果 伴随着符文魔法的爆发，符文龙对触发生物使用爆裂符文能力，若符文未自动引爆则立即将其引爆。

Detonating Rune.name: 爆裂符文 Detonating Rune
Detonating Rune.description: 符文龙的打击与能力可以在目标身上留下一个爆裂符文。如果一个生物在已经拥有一个爆裂符文的情况下将要获得另一个爆裂符文，则不会新增一个符文，而是会激活其当前的爆裂符文，消耗该符文并对目标造成@Damage[6d6[untyped]]伤害。爆裂符文的伤害类型与符文龙当前变幻符文的类型一致。生物可以使用一个交互动作移除该符文。如果爆裂符文没有引爆，则在1分钟后消散。

Entangling Rune.name: 束缚符文 Entangling Rune
Entangling Rune.description: 符文龙在60尺内创造一个@Template[type:burst|distance:10]范围的大型陷阱符文。除符文龙外的任何生物进入该区域或在其中结束回合时，会激活符文并受到束缚。该生物必须通过@Check[reflex|dc:41]豁免，否则将被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]1分钟或直到其成功逃脱。该符文每次只能束缚一个生物。符文在生物豁免成功、逃脱成功或1分钟后消散。与符文相邻的生物可以使用一个交互动作来移除符文。

Runic Breath.name: 符文吐息 Runic Breath
Runic Breath.description: 符文龙释放数百枚一触即爆的符文，在@Template[type:cone|distance:50]范围内造成@Damage[17d6[untyped]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。此能力的伤害类型由变幻符文决定。豁免失败的生物还会受到爆裂符文的影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Runic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用符文吐息。

Shifting Runes.name: 变幻符文 Shifting Runes
Shifting Runes.description: 符文龙选择酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰或音波伤害类型。蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文随之变幻，形成该能量类型的符文。符文龙获得对该伤害类型的免疫，且其爆裂符文与符文吐息均造成该类型伤害。任何在奥法上受训的生物无需检定即可立即识别蚀刻符文的能量类型。

Trail of Runes.name: 符文踪迹 Trail of Runes
Trail of Runes.description: 符文龙行走并在每个经过的空间留下符文。符文龙可以选择留下爆裂符文或束缚符文。每个符文龙行走过的空间，包括被生物占据的空间，都将获得一个符文。这些符文会在除符文龙外的生物进入该空间或在其中结束回合时自动激活。这些符文可以像正常情况一样被移除或消散。

Improved Push 15 feet.name: 精通推离15尺 Improved Push 15 feet

Gutter Ooze.name: Gutter Ooze
Gutter Ooze.publicNotes: These small masses of protoplasm are considered the lesser "cousins" to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.9InGpxq5xbbHaL9f]{sewer oozes}, emerging from the drainage culverts beneath a city after a rainfall to feed on bits of organic matter that collect in streetside gutters. As they collect just about everything—pebbles, bits of broken glass, and other trash—some cities consider them to be more helpful than detrimental.

Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
Motion Sense.description: A gutter ooze can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

Slip Up.name: Slip Up
Slip Up.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature damages the gutter ooze with a melee Strike

Effect Some of the gutter ooze's watery protoplasm gushes out beneath the triggering creature's feet. They must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:15] save or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Detritus.name: Detritus
Detritus.description: Due to all the random trash that collects in a city's gutters, whenever a gutter ooze makes a pseudopod Strike, the type of damage is chosen randomly between bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing.

Weak Acid.name: Weak Acid
Weak Acid.description: A gutter ooze's acid damages only organic material—not metal, stone, or other inorganic substances.

Hellcat.name: Hellcat
Hellcat.publicNotes:
Hellcats are devious predators native to the fiery pits of Hell. While the fiendish creatures resemble undead skeletal smilodons, bones smoking with heat and dripping with boiling blood, they're actually living hellspawn whose transparent flesh reveals their burning skeleton. A typical hellcat is 9 feet long and weighs 1,000 pounds.

Left to their own devices, hellcats spend their time hunting. As fiendish creatures, they don't need mortal sustenance but devour prey for the sheer pleasure of inflicting pain. They're also far more intelligent than most assume, and they resent being treated as unintelligent animals; those who treat a hellcat thusly might find themselves made into a trophy for its pack, as a hellcat will go to great lengths to coordinate elaborate revenge upon any who fail to show them proper respect.

Though they can't speak, hellcats know Diabolic and can communicate by telepathy with any creature capable of speech. They rarely say much except to whisper threats and acknowledge the orders of their diabolic masters.

Hellcats are quick to retreat if clearly outmatched or up against foes they're unable to reach, but they never forget prey that escapes them.
Hellcat.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Fiendish Telepathy 100 feet.name: Fiendish Telepathy 100 feet
Fiendish Telepathy 100 feet.description:
This functions as telepathy, except that the hellcat can speak mentally to any creature, regardless of language. This doesn't grant the hellcat the ability to understand what the other creature is thinking, unless that creature also understands Diabolic.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Telepathy]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Elusive Terror.name: Elusive Terror
Elusive Terror.description: A hellcat can live within the fears of others and use their dread to hide from sight. The hellcat can Hide in the presence of frightened creatures. If successful, the hellcat becomes Hidden from frightened creatures as if it moved behind cover or into concealment, but must otherwise Hide normally from non-frightened creatures.

Fearful Attack.name: Fearful Attack
Fearful Attack.description: The hellcat deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures.

Hell Pack Mindlink.name: Hell Pack Mindlink
Hell Pack Mindlink.description: The hellcat telepathically links its senses to all other hellcats within 100 feet for 10 minutes. It loses this contact with any hellcat that moves out of a 100-foot radius. While linked to at least one ally, the hellcat can't be flanked and gains a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws.

Menacing Growl.name: Menacing Growl
Menacing Growl.description:
The hellcat produces a low growl to disorient and frighten foes. The hellcat can cause this vocalization to originate from somewhere else within 30 feet. Non-fiends in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save. The hellcat can't issue another Menacing Growl for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The hellcat Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the hellcat began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the ability's Strike.

Jorogumo.name: Jorogumo
Jorogumo.publicNotes:
Appearing as beautiful, well-dressed humans, jorogumo lurk in the high mountains and prey on travelers, often through words and charm. These cruel creatures can fully change into a giant spider or sprout spider legs from their backs, and they often keep giant spiders as pets. Jorogumo usually eat their prey, but some humanoids meet an even more gruesome fate as living incubators for jorogumo eggs.

When they encounter a tengu, jorogumo fly into a rage and attempt to murder them as quickly as possible, for they insist that tengu can see through their trickery with a mere glance and are immune to their venom, but it isn't clear to outsiders if this is the whole story behind their single-minded hatred. Though most jorogumo are solitary creatures, some worship Norgorber and serve as valuable allies to thieves' guilds following that god's guise as the Gray Master.

Darting Legs.name: Darting Legs
Darting Legs.description:
Requirements The jorogumo has their spider legs extended or has Changed Shape

Trigger The jorogumo is targeted with an attack

Effect The jorogumo raises a leg, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The jorogumo takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium spider. This doesn't change their Speed or Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Jorogumo Venom.name: Jorogumo Venom
Jorogumo Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and stupefied 2 (1 round)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for [[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}

Spider Legs.name: Spider Legs
Spider Legs.description:
Requirements The jorogumo is in humanoid form

Effect Eight large spider legs sprout from the jorogumo's back, granting a 40-foot climb Speed and allowing them to use the Darting Legs reaction.

Web Trap.name: Web Trap
Web Trap.description: A creature hit by the jorogumo's web attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface, preventing the creature from moving. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} the web trap is 32.

Raelis.name: Raelis
Raelis.publicNotes:
Formed from the souls of storytellers, these boisterous azatas roam the planes, seeking out ever more impressive stories to collect. They attempt to spread joy by sharing these tales and righting wrongs they encounter. Their constant search for tales brings raelises to the mortal Universe more often than other azatas.

A raelis is generally knowledgeable about trails and directions, as their journeys take them to a variety of different locales. Raelises prefer to avoid taking the same journey twice and will go out of their way to avoid doing so. After millennia of constant journeys, a raelis becomes a living atlas, something they take great pride in.

Raelises adore brawling and wrestling, and often travel in mortal guises so as not to unduly infuence the events they chronicle. Their ability to travel discreetly among settlements make raelises excellent spies and discreet agents for gods with similar interests.

Spell Effect: Unfettered Movement.name: Spell Effect: Unfettered Movement
Spell Effect: Unfettered Movement.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement}

You ignore circumstance penalties to your Speed.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The raelis can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid, or any Medium or smaller animal. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but might change the damage type their Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Recount Epic.name: Recount Epic
Recount Epic.description:
The raelis recounts a tale to inspire their allies to heroic feats. For the next minute, all allied creatures who heard the epic gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics, Athletics, and Performance checks.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.82PN02Yy4GXcswy1]{Effect: Recount Epic}

Siphon Scroll.name: Siphon Scroll
Siphon Scroll.description: The raelis Casts a Spell from a scroll within 60 feet that they've read with Word Caller; this scroll must be divine. If this spell has the holy or vitality trait, they Cast it as one spell rank higher. This expends the scroll as normal.

Word Caller.name: Word Caller
Word Caller.description: The raelis senses the presence of words around them within 60 feet, reading up to 100 pages of nonmagical writing or automatically succeeding at a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} to identify 1 magical scroll.

Flaming Skull.name: Flaming Skull
Flaming Skull.publicNotes:
More dangerous than simple severed heads, these skulls are wreathed in unearthly flames.

Beheaded are the reanimated heads of decapitation victims. These mindless undead fly through the air or roll around to attack their prey.

Fiery Explosion.name: Fiery Explosion
Fiery Explosion.description: When destroyed, a flaming skull explodes in a blast of fire and bone that deals @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d6[fire]]{1d6 piercing damage plus 1d6 fire damage} to each adjacent creature (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save).

Flaming Shroud.name: Flaming Shroud
Flaming Shroud.description: A flaming skull is shrouded in hideous flames. It deals @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage to any unattended item it touches and on a forehead Strike. On a critical hit with a Strike, the target catches fire, taking @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]].

Shade (Axis).name: Shade (Axis)
Shade (Axis).publicNotes:
The remade appear as parchment-skinned humanoids covered in lines of close black script.

When a mortal dies, their soul travels to the Boneyard in the Outer Planes where they're judged by Pharasma, the goddess of the dead. Once judged, their soul is sent on to their final reward or punishment and, in the process, transformed into a creature known as a shade. This transformation grants the soul a new body, one whose shape is determined by the prevailing philosophical forces of the plane to which they're sent. A shade's memories from their former life usually fade, reduced to a few hazy fragments akin to half-remembered dreams. Regardless of the shade's size, power, or nature in life, they're a Medium creature in their afterlife.

Existence as a shade can last for eons but isn't necessarily eternal. Deities, powerful denizens of the Great Beyond, or even the Outer Planes can further alter a shade's nature by either reducing them into raw quintessence, spiritual essence that's then used to expand a plane's physical manifestation, or by transforming them into a new form of supernatural life such as a celestial, monitor, or fiend. Should a shade die, their body breaks down in a process akin to decay, their form reverting to the elements that make up their plane. This represents the true end of a soul's journey—their life essence reuniting with the heart of the Great Beyond to be recycled into Creation's Forge, fueling the creation of new souls.

Planar Incarnation - Axis (The Remade).name: Planar Incarnation - Axis (The Remade)
Planar Incarnation - Axis (The Remade).description:
All shades are formed from and personify the nature of the plane on which they manifest, and their statistics are adjusted as summarized below. They also gain any trait associated with creatures from their plane.

Axis (The Remade) The remade appear as parchment-skinned humanoids covered in lines of close black script

  • Language Utopian;
  • Additional Ability immune to emotion and fear
  • Melee fist +7, Damage 1d8+2 bludgeoning

Deep One Hybrid.name: 深潜者混种 Deep One Hybrid
Deep One Hybrid.publicNotes:
无论是源于对大衮的虔诚信仰，还是自身血脉传承，某些人类身上都显露出与深潜者存在联系的生理特征。

这种笨重，两栖，不灭的类人生物被称作深潜者，栖息于格拉利昂的沿海地带与深海海沟。尽管多数只求独善其身，仍有部分成员不遗余力地扩张族群规模。

Natural Swimmer.name: 天生泳将 Natural Swimmer
Natural Swimmer.description: 深潜者混种能在水下屏息10分钟，且游泳时在先攻骰和反射豁免上获得+2环境加值。

Ocean's Call.name: 大洋的呼唤 Ocean's Call
Ocean's Call.description: 深潜者混种如果在离海不低于10英里的地方待上24小时，会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}。此效果只会在混种返回大海时移除。

Silvanshee.name: Silvanshee
Silvanshee.publicNotes:
Silvanshees are a stealthy and extremely inquisitive contingent of agathions who gather information about the mortal world for other agathions. While they love to explore the Universe and sate their curiosity, they're generally reclusive and skittish. These dual instincts war with each other whenever something exciting piques their interest. Because of their small size, they don't pose a combat threat to most creatures; instead, silvanshees act as Nirvana's eyes and ears in the mortal world, reporting back to superiors or calling for help should they run into danger.

Silvanshees appear indistinguishable from domestic felines, save for their violet eyes and the telltale blaze of differently colored fur on their chests. Of course, fying gives them away outright, so if at all possible, they only do so while in trusted company to avoid detection.

Their fur color runs the spectrum of normal feline colorations. They can also transform into mist when necessary to maintain discretion or make a hasty getaway.

Cat's Curiosity.name: Cat's Curiosity
Cat's Curiosity.description: A silvanshee's core value is curiosity. This enables them to seek out new experiences and information beyond their current understanding. A silvanshee can use trained skill actions for all skills, even if they're untrained.

Cat's Poise.name: Cat's Poise
Cat's Poise.description: When a silvanshee uses their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form} spell, the mist form remains roughly the size and shape of a cat, and the silvanshee retains their fly speed in this form.

Living Thunderclap.name: Living Thunderclap
Living Thunderclap.publicNotes:
A living thunderclap is a small storm cloud (sometimes in the vague shape of a humanoid) that cracks and booms with thunder.

Some elementals embody aspects of air, such as smoke, lightning, and fog.

Swiftness.name: Swiftness
Swiftness.description: The living thunderclap doesn't trigger reactions when it moves.

Thunderbolt.name: Thunderbolt
Thunderbolt.description: The living thunderclap emits a bolt of lightning that crashes with deafening thunder. The living thunderclap makes a lightning bolt Strike that deals @Damage[1d12[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage. If it hits, the target and any creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] around the target take @Damage[2d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic] save). Any creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Velociraptor Pack.name: Velociraptor Pack
Velociraptor Pack.publicNotes: Velociraptors are clever pack hunters who generally subsist off small herbivores but are not afraid to take on larger prey as a group. Bigger populations of velociraptors are more dangerous when they coalesce into a swarm to protect their young. Even in large numbers, these feathered raptors remain uncannily nimble and can lunge suddenly at their enemies. Emboldened by their increased numbers, the swarms will lash out fiercely with their talons and doggedly pursue any perceived threat.

Bites and Talons.name: Bites and Talons
Bites and Talons.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The pack makes a melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d4[precision]]{1d6 piercing or slashing damage and 1d4 precision damage}

2 @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d4[precision]]{2d6 piercing or slashing damage and 2d4 precision damage}

3 @Damage[3d6[piercing],2d4[precision]]{3d6 piercing or slashing damage and 2d4 precision damage}

Puff Up.name: Puff Up
Puff Up.description: The velociraptors ruffle their plumage to appear larger. They ignore the –4 penalty to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} for not knowing the same language as their target.

Raptor Leap.name: Raptor Leap
Raptor Leap.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The pack Strides, ignoring difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain). At the end of this movement, each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save).

Blizzardborn.name: Blizzardborn
Blizzardborn.publicNotes:
Freezing and thawing in a near-constant loop, blizzardborn resemble humanoid forms composed of a mixture of partially melted snow and sleet. These elementals move with crunching strides, their bodies constantly sloshing and sloughing off shards of ice. Because of their ability to refreeze, blizzardborn can travel into warmer environments safely, though they tend to look more like slush in these areas.

Water elementals that become infused with cold or mist have increased mobility in regions outside of bodies of water.

Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: The blizzardborn ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from falling snow.

Shattering Ice.name: Shattering Ice
Shattering Ice.description:
Trigger An enemy hits the blizzardborn with an attack that deals physical damage

Effect A portion of the blizzardborn's body shatters into an explosion of razor-sharp ice crystals and blinding snow that deals @Damage[2d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage to opponents in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:blinded] save). Anyone who fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (3 rounds on a critical failure).

Ice Burrow.name: Ice Burrow
Ice Burrow.description: The blizzardborn can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through ice or snow with a Speed of 20 feet. It moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Kitsune Trickster.name: Kitsune Trickster
Kitsune Trickster.publicNotes:
With minor magic and shapeshifting capabilities, these tricksters love to play mostly harmless pranks for their own enjoyment.

Kitsune are shapeshifting, fox-like humanoids who have been blessed by the spirits. They can shift from the form of a fox-headed humanoid into a specific alternate form unique to each kitsune, usually either a tailless form—such as a humanoid body without any fox features (typically of the prevalent ancestry where they grew up)—or a fox form. Kitsune revel in joy and beauty, often practicing storytelling, dance, and other creative arts. However, they also have a penchant for playing pranks on the joyless and self-important, earning them a reputation as tricksters. Favored by the goddess Daikitsu, kitsune seem to be almost supernaturally lucky, perpetually dodging danger by the narrowest margins.

While kitsune settlements do exist, most kitsune are incredibly curious and often leave home at a young age to encounter new people and sights. Some kitsune spend years in their tailless form, living disguised among humanoids in urban or rural societies whose inhabitants have no clue of their true nature. Others go to the opposite extreme, spending most of their lives in the form of a fox, only to reveal themselves at the most opportune moment. For many kitsune, revealing their true form to someone is a sign of great trust, but it's also not uncommon for kitsune to display their dual nature openly.

Kitsune's connection to the spiritual world grants them a number of magical abilities. Aside from their innate shapeshifting powers, kitsune naturally develop more potent magic as they mature, and they seem to effortlessly pick up skills that would rival the most practiced spellcasters. Those who truly apply themselves to honing their magic usually become remarkable at their craft.

A kitsune is born with one tail, but as their magical powers grow, so do their number of tails. Elders blessed with great magical wisdom can have as many as nine, though according to popular legend, this level of power can take up to a thousand years to achieve.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The kitsune trickster transforms into the tailless form of a specific Medium human. The tailless form can't be altered and resembles the kitsune's fox-like humanoid form. While the kitsune trickster's alternate form is a Medium human, some kitsune have tailless forms of other humanoids, or a fox alternate form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Owb.name: Owb
Owb.publicNotes:
Commonly called owbs, or lesser owbs by more powerful owb prophets, most of these mysterious creatures focus on manipulating caligni culture. Among calignis, an owb hides from mortals they deem beneath them-even including calignis in their charge. An owb prefers to select one caligni leader to control from the shadows, manipulating them using charisma and magic. Through coersion of such agents, owbs maintain a steady hand in the politics of the community, either blessing and breaking pacts with other creatures or acting as intermediaries and ambassadors between calignis and powerful external entities.

These ancient denizens of the Netherworld appear as grayish humanoid torsos covered in translucent funereal veils of shadow. Silent and mysterious, they float about, absent of legs to hold them aloft. Never speaking a word aloud, they instead reach into the minds of nearby creatures to whisper curses, threats, and strange bits of forlorn augury.

These haunting creatures are revered by calignis as proxies of the Forsaken—a strange array of ancestor-like demigods whom many calignis worship. Some even believe owbs are the Forsaken manifested, and that they are able to subtly manipulate creatures on the Netherworld without leaving behind any indication.

A multitude of owbs visit and even remain to advise caligni communities, as varied in personality as the Forsaken. All owbs share a hatred of light and color, except for the flickering glow of the burning cold magic they can hurl as a weapon. Owbs who live among calignis tend to prohibit the use of light and color, using their curse of darkness to quench violators if necessary. The only other similarity across all owbs is their entrenched desire to manipulate their charges through mind-reading and deception, though such manipulation can be either subtle or overt.

Curse of Darkness.name: Curse of Darkness
Curse of Darkness.description:
The owb inflicts a curse on one creature taking persistent cold damage from their burning cold Strike, stealing the victim's vibrancy. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save.

On a failure, the creature gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]{Light Blindness} and its coloration turns to washed out shades of gray, along with all equipment it carries, wields, or wears. These effects have an unlimited duration. Regardless of the result of its save, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

If the owb uses this ability on a caligni, the curse can't be removed short of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual or similar powerful magic.

Filth Fire.name: Filth Fire
Filth Fire.publicNotes:
These creatures look like roiling clouds of black smoke churning above a mound of burning refuse. Leering faces form and fade in the smoke above, while the burning detritus writhes in spasmodic lurches, obviously alive.

Destructive manifestations of the Plane of Fire, fire elementals sometimes incorporate burning materials into their being or superheated matter, such as molten rock or searing smoke. In combat, they tend to be aggressive and somewhat reckless. Their attacks can sometimes cause major destruction to the surrounding environment, and many fire elementals seem to enjoy seeing their flames spread far and wide.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The filth fire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Noxious Burst.name: Noxious Burst
Noxious Burst.description:
Toxic materials and churning rubbish within the filth fire's body explode in one of three ways. The filth fire chooses the effect, but it can't make the same choice twice in a row.

  • Fiery Beam (fire, primal) The filth fire expels a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of flame that deals @Damage[3d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save.
  • Shrapnel Blast (primal) The filth fire shoots jagged rubbish out in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] that deals @Damage[2d12[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save.

  • Toxic Fumes (poison, primal) The filth fire belches a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] of toxic smoke that deals @Damage[2d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:21|basic] save). A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Pakalchi.name: Pakalchi
Pakalchi.publicNotes:
Pakalchis strive to intensify their preys' inherent insecurity over personal and emotional bonds, playing on the threat of those relationships falling into ruin. These sahkils are among the most manipulative of their kind, pulling strings both literal and figurative on their victims over stretched-out periods of time, exhilarating in the despair and fear for as long as possible.

Ages ago, when this cycle of the multiverse was still adolescent, a cabal of psychopomps who already felt bored and restrained in their role of ushering souls to their ultimate resting place rebelled against their station. It was this corruption of the cycle of souls that spawned the first sahkils.

Ambivalent to the prescribed order of the multiverse and spiteful of mortals, sahkils delight in spreading fear and unease to all beings, clogging up the metaphysical cycle with anxiety-ridden mortals too scared to achieve their potential. These fiends have drastically changed from their dedicated psychopomp predecessors. They are creatures of spite and torment, fear and disgust. They exploit the most common and rare fears for their own perverse satisfaction, and they want nothing more than to frighten mortals and make them quetion their reason for existence.

Most sahkils lurk on the Ethereal Plane, but they frequently invade the Material Plane to torment mortals and spread terror. They use their innate ability to slip between the veils of the Ethereal and Material effortlessly, often stalking their targets for days or weeks before enacting their devious plots.

Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
Easy to Call.description: A pakalchi's level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle}ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM's discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

Entangling Train.name: Entangling Train
Entangling Train.description:
Trigger A creature moves adjacent to the pakalchi

Effect Writhing, pitch-black vines wrap around the creature. The creature takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage and takes a -15-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dNs30jfFOJqhjFW7]{Effect: Entangling Train}

Betrayal Toxin.name: Betrayal Toxin
Betrayal Toxin.description:
A creature affected by betrayal toxin hears whispers of incessant doubt in their head and can't treat any creature as their ally

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Skip Between.name: Skip Between
Skip Between.description: The sahkil moves from the Universe to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa. While in the Ethereal Plane, they're unable to affect anything in the Universe, and they cannot be seen by beings or abilities in the Universe, unless these have an ability that can gaze into the Ethereal Plane. While on the Material Plane the inverse is true for anything on the Ethereal Plane. A summoned sahkil can't use Skip Between.

Jyoti.name: Jyoti
Jyoti.publicNotes:
Jyotis are sometimes called "false phoenixes" (a term they find insulting) by the ignorant or willful. These avian humanoids are native to Creation's Forge, where they are the caretakers of the tree-sized, crystalline flowers within the Garden of Creation's Forge. These physical manifestations of mortal souls that ascended to divinity are protected and venerated by jyotis. They rarely leave this enigmatic realm and view visitors from other planes as stains on the purity of their home. Jyotis particularly distrust divine spellcasters and religious warriors, seeing them as inclined to take credit for manifesting a life force that, from a jyoti's perspective, is as plentiful and ubiquitous as water is to fish.

Despite their distrust of intruders, jyotis rarely attack unprovoked when their homes are not threatened. However, they don't tolerate intruders into their palace dwelling of crystallized light and captured flame. They often chase even those who come bearing gifts away; few visitors have anything they desire, for what they desire most is to be left alone. Jyotis' full wrath is reserved for natives of the Netherworld and the Void. Historically, the promise of battle with the gargoyle-like sceaduinars, whom they consider it their duty to oppose, has been the only thing to lure jyoti armies beyond Creation's Forge.
Jyoti.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +2 status to all saves vs. divine magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine Magic.name: 对抗神术全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine Magic

Vitality Energy Affinity.name: Vitality Energy Affinity
Vitality Energy Affinity.description: Vitality healing effects always heal the jyoti for the maximum amount. It doesn't gain the automatic Hit Points or temporary Hit Points from being on a plane with the vitality planar essence trait.

Breath of Burning Life.name: Breath of Burning Life
Breath of Burning Life.description: The jyoti breathes a blast of searing flame infused with vitality energy in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] that deals @Damage[8d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage plus @Damage[4d6[vitality]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save). The jyoti can't use Breath of Burning Life again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Burning Life]]{1d4 rounds}.

Infuse Weapons.name: Infuse Weapons
Infuse Weapons.description: Any weapon a jyoti wields becomes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} weapon while the jyoti holds it.

Shae.name: Shae
Shae.publicNotes:
Shae are wispy, tenebrous creatures native to the Plane of Shadow. Their amorphous bodies appear in constant states of flux. They cast no shadows of their own, instead gaining and losing umbral energy to nearby shadows that shrink and grow alongside them.

Most shae wear clothing spun from shadows that shift with them, though diplomats sometimes don more conventional garments while entertaining outsiders. Their most distinctive apparel are their white stone masks, which shae don only when they must put on a discernible "face" for interacting with humanoids and similar creatures. They do so begrudgingly, as they consider themselves superior to humanoids, but donning their masks allows them to be more easily understood and thus keeps their interactions with their lessers as brief as possible.

The dynamic between a shae and humanoids shifts when humanoids come to worship a shae, however. A mortal who shows a shae their due deference is worth keeping around, so many shae collect cults of personality or expansive entourages. Even getting a meeting with such a self-important shae can present a challenge that requires one to deal with many layers of hangers-on who insist on vetting the newcomer before wasting the shae's precious time.

According to shae lore, they've transcended the material world and now embody a cosmological equilibrium of reality and illusion. Their claims to metaphysical ascendance and knowledge of the secrets of shadows entice many mortal supplicants to join shae courts and cults. In the shae language, their name means "unbound," in accordance with their belief that their ephemeral nature makes them free of the moral and social strictures that bind other sentient creatures, and they essentially make a virtue of capriciousness. Shae feel little obligation to follow through with oaths or obey laws, so sealing a compact with a mortal means little to them.

Shadow Shift.name: Shadow Shift
Shadow Shift.description: Being made partially of shadow themselves, shae are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} in dim light or darkness even to creatures that can see clearly in those light levels.

Counterattack.name: Counterattack
Counterattack.description:
Trigger The shae is targeted by an attack from an adjacent creature that misses due to the shae being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}

Requirements The shae is aware of the attack

Effect The shae makes a Strike against the attacker.

Slip.name: Slip
Slip.description:
Trigger A creature moves adjacent to the shae

Effect The shae teleports to a clear space adjacent to another creature they can see within 30 feet.

Bide.name: Bide
Bide.description: The shae prepares to take action against their foes, watching their opponent and waiting for the right opportunity to respond. The shae gains a second reaction until the start of their next turn, though they still can't use more than one reaction on the same triggering action.

Tenebral Form.name: Tenebral Form
Tenebral Form.description: The shae can Fly at full Speed in @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form}.

Curl Up.name: Curl Up
Curl Up.description:
Trigger The trilobite takes damage

Effect The trilobite gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of its next turn.

Quick Escape.name: Quick Escape
Quick Escape.description: The trilobite Swims up to double its Speed and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}.

Cinder Dragon (Young).name: 青年灰烬龙 Cinder Dragon (Young)
Cinder Dragon (Young).publicNotes: 在所有龙类之中，灰烬龙体型最为庞大，亦是最为凶猛的种类之一。它们通常性情暴躁易怒，要求他者给予敬畏——乃至臣服。灰烬龙的外貌正如其体内的烈焰，鳞片上常呈现红、橙、黄交错的火焰纹理。许多灰烬龙居住在活火山或其他同样炽热的地域之中。它们偏爱那些能承受高温的宝藏，因此宝石、黄金与白银常见于其囤积的财宝中。

Smoke Vision.name: 烟雾视觉 Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: 烟雾不会妨碍灰烬龙的视觉；它能无视由烟雾造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: 对抗原能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Boiling Blood.name: 沸血 Boiling Blood
Boiling Blood.description:
触发 灰烬龙被一次近战攻击重击

效果 灰烬龙的高热之血飞溅至攻击者。该目标受到@Damage[6d6[fire]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic]豁免）。

Reactive Strike (Jaws only).name: 反应打击（仅颚咬） Reactive Strike (Jaws only)

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 灰烬龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 灰烬龙的打击重击时，恢复烈焰吐息的使用次数。

Pyre Breath.name: 烈焰吐息 Pyre Breath
Pyre Breath.description: 灰烬龙喷吐出一股灼热烈焰，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[9d6[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物会着火，受到@Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]]伤害。随后该区域被黑烟笼罩1分钟，效果与薄雾相同，但仅覆盖该锥形区域。灰烬龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Pyre Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用烈焰吐息。

Stoke the Flames.name: 煽燃烈焰 Stoke the Flames
Stoke the Flames.description: 灰烬龙激化周围的火势。所有在60尺范围内并正承受持续火焰伤害的敌人，额外受到@Damage[3d6[fire]]伤害。

Rune Dragon (Ancient).name: 古符文龙 Rune Dragon (Ancient)
Rune Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes: 符文龙天生对符文的力量有着深刻的洞察。大多数符文龙的鳞片上刻有各种符文，它们的身体可以魔法般地增强这些符文的力量。符文龙通常不自己施法，而是依靠它们即兴创造符文的能力来产生所需的效果。符文龙常常把自己的财宝称为图书馆，因为它们的财宝中充满了由不同文化的人们使用多种语言写成的重要历史文献、戏剧、演讲、教科书和法术书。尽管它们通常可以借助魔法说某种语言，但它们更喜欢在讲者的语境中学习语言，以便理解其中隐藏的细微差别和符号中的魔力。

equipment-Common runes of 14th level or.name: 刻在鳞片上的常见符文（14级或更低） Common runes of 14th level or lower etched upon their scales

Magic Sense.name: 魔法感知 Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: 符文龙能感知到列出范围内所有激活的魔法能力与效果。当符文龙进行搜寻时，它在列出范围内获得4环级侦测魔法法术的效果（此外还获得搜寻的正常好处）。

Runic Scales.name: 符文鳞片 Runic Scales
Runic Scales.description: 符文龙的鳞片作为符文石存在。符文龙不能使用蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文的效果或能力，但它们可以将其转移到适当的物品上。以这种方式向物品转移或从物品上转移一个符文需要1分钟，在此期间符文龙处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。该过程自动完成无需检定，但如果符文龙在此过程中停止或受到打扰，符文将被摧毁。符文龙可以在其鳞片上蚀刻任意数量的符文，但它们通常一次只在鳞片上蚀刻少数符文。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Canceling Rune.name: 抵消符文 Canceling Rune
Canceling Rune.description:
触发 符文龙成为一个需要豁免的法术的目标

效果 符文龙尝试瓦解法术的基础符文。它尝试反制该法术（反制环级10环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+33 #Counteract]]{+33}）。若成功，符文龙不受该法术影响；其他目标正常受到该法术影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Canceling Rune]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用抵消符文。

Retributive Rune.name: 惩戒符文 Retributive Rune
Retributive Rune.description:
触发 一个15尺内的生物对符文龙造成伤害

效果 伴随着符文魔法的爆发，符文龙对触发生物使用爆裂符文能力，若符文未自动引爆则立即将其引爆。

Detonating Rune.name: 爆裂符文 Detonating Rune
Detonating Rune.description: 符文龙的打击与能力可以在目标身上留下一个爆裂符文。如果一个生物在已经拥有一个爆裂符文的情况下将要获得另一个爆裂符文，则不会新增一个符文，而是会激活其当前的爆裂符文，消耗该符文并对目标造成@Damage[6d6[untyped]]伤害。爆裂符文的伤害类型与符文龙当前变幻符文的类型一致。生物可以使用一个交互动作移除该符文。如果爆裂符文没有引爆，则在1分钟后消散。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 符文龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 符文龙的打击重击时恢复其符文吐息的充能。

Entangling Rune.name: 束缚符文 Entangling Rune
Entangling Rune.description: 符文龙在60尺内创造一个@Template[type:burst|distance:10]范围的大型陷阱符文。除符文龙外的任何生物进入该区域或在其中结束回合时，会激活符文并受到束缚。该生物必须通过@Check[reflex|dc:41]豁免，否则将被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]1分钟或直到其成功逃脱。该符文每次只能束缚一个生物。符文在生物豁免成功、逃脱成功或1分钟后消散。与符文相邻的生物可以使用一个交互动作来移除符文。

Runic Breath.name: 符文吐息 Runic Breath
Runic Breath.description: 符文龙释放数百枚一触即爆的符文，在@Template[type:cone|distance:50]范围内造成@Damage[17d6[untyped]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。此能力的伤害类型由变幻符文决定。豁免失败的生物还会受到爆裂符文的影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Runic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用符文吐息。

Shifting Runes.name: 变幻符文 Shifting Runes
Shifting Runes.description: 符文龙选择酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰或音波伤害类型。蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文随之变幻，形成该能量类型的符文。符文龙获得对该伤害类型的免疫，且其爆裂符文与符文吐息均造成该类型伤害。任何在奥法上受训的生物无需检定即可立即识别蚀刻符文的能量类型。

Trail of Runes.name: 符文踪迹 Trail of Runes
Trail of Runes.description: 符文龙行走并在每个经过的空间留下符文。符文龙可以选择留下爆裂符文或束缚符文。每个符文龙行走过的空间，包括被生物占据的空间，都将获得一个符文。这些符文会在除符文龙外的生物进入该空间或在其中结束回合时自动激活。这些符文可以像正常情况一样被移除或消散。

Improved Push 15 feet.name: 精通推离15尺 Improved Push 15 feet

Blood Painter.name: Blood Painter
Blood Painter.publicNotes:
Simultaneously enamored with the natural world yet too alien to survive in it, blood painters are eight-limbed artists who stalk, kill, and dismember in search of pigment and sustenance alike. Blood painter physiology can't digest typical food, so the creatures feed by harvesting blood and using it to paint and animate something edible.

When not on the hunt, blood painters seek out beautiful vistas, which they placidly admire via the eyes in the hands of their uppermost limbs and then reproduce on canvas. Exceptional art endlessly fascinates these creatures, and skilled dancers and painters alike occasionally escape the aberrations by creating a new work to trade for their lives. Blood painters jealously guard these works, and much of their treasure consists of art. Blood painters tend to mastermind the periodic theft of masterpieces.

Bloodsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Bloodsense (Imprecise) 60 feet
Bloodsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: A blood painter can detect exposed blood as an imprecise sense at the listed range, including from creatures taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Easily Fascinated.name: Easily Fascinated
Easily Fascinated.description: When subject to a visual illusion with the incapacitation trait, the blood painter doesn't adjust their degree of success due to the incapacitation trait.

Dab.name: Dab
Dab.description:
Requirements The blood painter is within reach of an enemy taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Effect The blood painter touches the creature and applies blood to one of their four claws; the blood remains fresh for 1 minute. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the blood painter.

Paint.name: Paint
Paint.description:
Requirements The blood painter has fresh blood applied to a claw using Dab

Effect The blood painter expends the blood on one claw to paint an illusion with the efects of one of the following spells: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8SBoXiXQjlCKqly]{Illusory Creature}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2oH5IufzdESuYxat]{Illusory Object}. The Paint action gains the traits of the spell it's reproducing, and the blood painter can Sustain these efects. They use a spell attack modifer of @Check[blood-painter-paint|against:ac]{+20} and DC 28 for these efects, which are heightened to 5th rank.

If they have fresh blood applied to two or more claws, the blood painter can expend the blood on all of them to instead produce the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TCk2MDwf5L5OYjFC]{Cloak of Colors} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.RQjSQVZRG497cJhX]{Vibrant Pattern}.

Any effects produced by this ability have a +2 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, saving throws, skill checks, and AC against the creature whose blood was used to Paint. That creature also takes a –2 status penalty to Perception checks and saves against them.

Yamah.name: Yamah
Yamah.publicNotes:
Yamahs are devoted to protecting others from magic used for evil, particularly the kind that traps souls or controls a creature's free will. They relish taking a malevolent spellcaster's magic and turning it to virtuous purposes.

Yamahs often sport stern countenances but still enjoy moments of joy and whimsy like other azatas. In particular, they revel in lighthearted jokes and cheery songs when appropriate. Once they enter combat, however, their bright dispositions change to one of focus and determination. While fghting enemies of freedom, yamahs tend to attack from a distance, using their fight and ranged skills to harry foes. If a spellcaster is involved, yamahs move to the front line, attempting to intercede between their allies and the spellcaster's magic.

Lunar eclipses and other notable celestial events tend to draw yamahs to the Universe. These azatas appear more often during these events to aid the followers of deities with connections to such events, such as Desna and the empyreal lord Ashava. Tales among these faiths speak of yamahs who ally with worshippers in their endeavors against evil fends. These stories inevitably end with the yamah departing after the task is complete, leaving the mortal worshipper without a word.

equipment-Forceful Quartz Bracelet.name: Forceful Quartz Bracelet
equipment-Forceful Quartz Bracelet.description: Each yamah wears a personalized bracelet, embedded with quartz gems that refect the cosmos. These are empowered by unseen magic, recharging when the yamah has 8 hours of rest. These bracelets have a unique divine connection to their respective yamah, and the bracelets only function for that yamah. On occasion, a yamah will gift the bracelet to a mortal, more as a symbol of trust and a sign that the individual is protected than an attempt to share power.

Crystallized Attack.name: Crystallized Attack
Crystallized Attack.description:
Requirements The yamah has a charged gem on its forceful quartz bracelet

Effect The yamah channels the magic from an active gem, causing its starknife to glow with unnatural brightness. Their next starknife Strike before the end of their turn deals an extra 1d6 force damage and increases its thrown range to 60 feet. This drains one of their quartz gems.

Free Mind.name: Free Mind
Free Mind.description:
Trigger An ally of the yamah's attempts a saving throw against an efect that has the mental trait

Effect The ally's gains a +4 status bonus to the saving throw. If the ally rolls a success, they get a critical success instead.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The creature's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Starstrike.name: Starstrike
Starstrike.description: Any non-magical starknife becomes a +1 striking returning weapon while a yamah wields it.

Steal Magic.name: Steal Magic
Steal Magic.description: The yamah makes a melee spell attack against a creature under the efects of a spell; a yamah automatically succeeds with this attack against a willing creature. On a success, the yamah's divine touch attempts to counteract the spell (counteract rank 3, counteract modifer [[/r 1d20+16 #Counteract]]{+16}). A successful counteract siphons the magical energy into one of the gems on its forceful quartz bracelet, recharging it.

Green Man.name: Green Man
Green Man.publicNotes:
Green men are ancient, enigmatic lesser deities of the primeval forests, living embodiments of nature and plantkind. When a forest or other woodland terrain generates enough nature spirits, beings of the same sort of vital essence that embodies leshys or answers the call of a commune with nature, they naturally coalesce together and apotheosize into a green man. Green men aren't concerned with all the multifarious processes of nature like Gozreh or many other nature deities. Instead, they focus nearly all their attention on the plants of their home, only concerning themselves with animals, minerals, and the like insomuch as they affect the plants. Despite their name, green men aren't necessarily male; as creatures of pure natural power, to many of them, the concept of gender holds no meaning, and to those that do, they can be of any gender.

Most green men are neutral and tend to ignore "animals," which to them include sapient creatures such as humans. However, good and evil green men do exist. These individuals are far more likely to attempt to spread their influence far and wide, either for good or ill. Good green men provide succor to all that come within their home, not only to plants, providing wisdom like a nurturing parent. Evil green men, however, allow rare and dangerous plants to thrive in their domains by spreading fear and devastation to all those who might threaten plant life, though they might keep a few animals around to hunt for sport.

Green Tongue.name: Green Tongue
Green Tongue.description: A green man can communicate with plants, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qvwIwJ9QBihy8R0t]{Speak with Plants}, and can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on plants and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request} things from plants.

Plantsense 60 feet.name: Plantsense 60 feet
Plantsense 60 feet.description: A green man can sense life force via plants. This allows them to observe a living or undead creature's vital essence within 60 feet of the green man, but they can also use this precise sense to observe any living or undead creature within 60 feet of any plant matter within 120 feet of the green man. This allows the green man to see living things through solid plant matter, as well as seeing through other barriers if there are plants on the other side.

Green Caress.name: Green Caress
Green Caress.description:
60 feet. Living creatures in the area other than plants slowly transform into non-creature plants. The green man can exclude creatures from this effect, but they must be aware of a creature's presence and location to do so. A non-plant creature in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:45] save immediately before the start of its turn.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected, or if it is slowed by green caress, it reduces its slowed value by 2.

Success The creature is unaffected, or if it is slowed by green caress, it reduces its slowed value by 1.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, or if it was already slowed by green caress, increases the slowed value by 1, as their body transforms more and more into a non-creature plant. If the creature ever becomes slowed to the point they have no actions left for their turn, they become an inanimate plant, a condition that can only be reversed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MLNeD5sAunV0E23j]{Primal Phenomenon} or similarly powerful magic.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (or increases the condition value by 2).

Root In Place.name: Root In Place
Root In Place.description:
Trigger A creature within the green man's reach uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The green man lashes out to hold the foe in place. The green man makes a vine Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack hits, the green man disrupts the action. If the creature was Flying when its action was disrupted, it falls.

Absorb Magic.name: Absorb Magic
Absorb Magic.description:
The green man's vines leach away magic and transform it into life essence for the green man. On a successful vine Strike, the green man attempts to counteract one spell active on the target (typically one vexing the green man, or determined randomly if they aren't aware of specific effects), with a counteract rank of 10 and a modifier of [[/r 1d20+38 #Counteract]]{+38}.

If the effect is counteracted, the green man gains [[/r 30 #Temporary Hit Points]]{30 temporary Hit Points} that last for 10 minutes.

Embed.name: Embed
Embed.description: The green man's thorns embed themselves into any creature they damage, taking root into the ground. A target damaged by a thorn has its Speeds halved, and it can't Step, Fly, or otherwise leave the ground until the thorn is removed. Removing a thorn requires 3 Interact actions, which don't have to be consecutive. If the creature performing the final action doesn't succeed at a @Check[medicine|dc:45] check as part of that action, the target takes @Damage[10d6[piercing]] damage upon the thorn's removal.

Focus Vines.name: Focus Vines
Focus Vines.description:
The green man focuses all their vines against a single vexing foe, making a single vine Strike.

On a success, the target takes 5d10 additional damage and is affected by Absorb Magic three times. Even on a failure, the target takes the normal effects of a hit with a vine Strike, but on a critical failure, the vines miss completely.

Green Grab.name: Green Grab
Green Grab.description: A green man can use their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.i18TlebMzwONyPhI]{Improved Grab} action against a creature of any size.

Green Rituals.name: Green Rituals
Green Rituals.description:
A green man can perform all their rituals without secondary casters, relying on their own primal ties to the vital essence in spirits of nature.

A green man's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B4dDkYsHFo1H0CIF]{Awaken Animal} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pZc8ZwtsyWnxUUW0]{Primal Call} rituals work on plants instead of their usual range of choices.

Most green men also know the ritual to create various types of leshys and possibly even magic allowing the creation of arboreals or more powerful plant creatures.

Vine Forest.name: Vine Forest
Vine Forest.description: The green man lashes out with all six vines to attack many opponents. They make up to six vine Strikes, each against a different target; this counts as one attack for their multiple attack penalty, increasing only after all the attacks are made.

Mist Stalker.name: Mist Stalker
Mist Stalker.publicNotes:
The tentacled mist stalker shrouds itself in a cloak of mist through which its single, never-blinking eye can see with clarity, allowing it an advantage when stalking prey.

Water elementals that become infused with cold or mist have increased mobility in regions outside of bodies of water.

Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: The mist stalker ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from mist and fog.

Mist Cloud.name: Mist Cloud
Mist Cloud.description: 15 feet. The mist stalker is surrounded by mist. Creatures in the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. If wind disperses the aura, it returns automatically at the start of the mist stalker's turn. This cloud is suppressed in water.

Solidify Mist.name: Solidify Mist
Solidify Mist.description: The mist stalker makes its mist cloud congeal, causing the aura to be difficult terrain until the start of the mist stalker's next turn. In addition, the mist stalker can make the mist even thicker around a single Medium or smaller creature within the cloud. The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes or is no longer in the mist cloud's emanation.

Adamant Sentinel.name: 精金哨兵 Adamant Sentinel
Adamant Sentinel.publicNotes: 精金哨兵使用一种极其稀有近乎坚不可摧的金属制成，唯有最强大的敌人才能将其摧毁。制作一台精金哨兵需要极其大量的精金，以至于需要组织采矿远征队前往遥远的行星，土元素位面或外环位面才能收集到。

Repair Mode.name: 修理模式 Repair Mode
Repair Mode.description: 当精金哨兵降为0HP时，它不会被摧毁。相反，它进入修理模式，此期间它陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，无法使用反应动作，并且只能使用自我修复动作。一旦它的生命值大于等于30点，它能进行除了反应动作之外的其他动作，但是仍陷入缓慢1，并且直到它的下回合开始之前无法使用反应动作。如果精金@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]武器对精金哨兵造成重击且将其降至0HP，或当它已经为0HP时，被精金斩首武器击中，则哨兵被摧毁。

Destructive Strike.name: 毁灭打击 Destructive Strike
Destructive Strike.description: 当重击时，精金哨兵的拳头打击除了对目标造成伤害外，还能破坏目标的护甲（如有的话）。如果目标举起盾牌，则它改为破坏盾牌。

Inexorable March.name: 势不可挡 Inexorable March
Inexorable March.description:
精金哨兵行走至多其速度的距离，向后推离路径空间上的所有生物，如果他们尝试停下其移动，就会受到伤害。生物可以尝试通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:45|options:damaging-effect]检定来阻挡其前进。

大成功 哨兵停止移动，且不能进入生物所处方格

成功 同大成功，但阻挡的生物受到@Damage[(3d10+17)[bludgeoning]]伤害

失败 阻挡的生物受到@Damage[(3d10+17)[bludgeoning]]伤害，并且其护甲（如果有的话），变为破损。如果阻挡的生物举起盾牌，则哨兵改为破坏盾牌

Vent.name: 喷气 Vent
Vent.description: 哨兵对@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围喷出炉心中的过热蒸汽。对锥形范围内所有生物造成@Damage[15d6[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。哨兵在[[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Vent]]{1d6轮}内无法再次进行喷气。

Despair Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: 古绝望龙施法者 Despair Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Despair Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 恐惧是最强烈的情感之一，而绝望龙是将恐惧和绝望之情引导为自己利益的高手。像其他异能龙一样，绝望龙也有一种与生俱来的冲动，那就是激起他人的恐惧。绝望龙通常会定居在城镇附近，以便从周围的恐惧中汲取力量。绝望龙的财宝中最常见的物品是卷轴、典籍和遗物，这些物品是它们研究的材料。通过这些，绝望龙能了解到当地的民间传说、都市传说等，从而更好地困扰它们的目标。

Fearsense.name: 恐惧感知 Fearsense
Fearsense.description: 绝望龙能够感知所有处于惊惧状态的生物，范围如上所述。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Consume Fear.name: 吞噬恐惧 Consume Fear
Consume Fear.description:
触发 绝望龙60尺内的一个生物失去惊惧状态

效果 绝望龙从失去惊惧状态的生物体内汲取恐惧，获得7d8临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Unbidden Thoughts.name: 无声思绪 Unbidden Thoughts
Unbidden Thoughts.description:
触发 绝望龙被武器或无武装攻击重击

效果 攻击者的心智被关于他们最深层恐惧的幻象所占据，导致感官超负荷。攻击者必须选择以下结果之一：该次攻击变为普通成功，或者该次攻击保持重击但攻击者陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

Look Behind You.name: 看你背后 Look Behind You
Look Behind You.description:
触发 绝望龙成功对一个90尺内的生物进行躲藏

效果 绝望龙传送至目标生物的正后方的空间。除非目标位置有掩蔽或其他可以保持@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]的方法，否则绝望龙会立即被侦测。

Shrieking Breath.name: 尖叫吐息 Shrieking Breath
Shrieking Breath.description: 绝望龙发出由它从恐惧敌人那里汲取的尖叫所组成的刺耳音波，在@Template[type:cone|distance:50]范围内造成@Damage[17d6[sonic]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。 豁免失败的生物必须在下一回合开始时将第一个动作用于尖叫。绝望龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Shrieking Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用尖叫吐息。

Tongue Decoy.name: 舌头诱饵 Tongue Decoy
Tongue Decoy.description:
绝望龙将其舌尖的数个囊泡充气，以制造出一个生物的基本形态。这个过程需要1分钟才能完成，在此期间绝望龙处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。如果绝望龙在此过程中停止或被打断，囊泡会泄气，绝望龙必须重新开始。一旦过程完成，绝望龙可以无限期保持充气状态，并且可以使用解消动作使囊泡泄气并收回舌头。

充气后的舌头呈现出动物或类人生物的基本形态，体型可以是小型或中型。该形态与生物的轮廓相似，但仔细检查并成功通过@Check[perception|dc:35]检定可以识别舌头的真面目。在充气时，绝望龙可以通过舌头发出声音，但保持舌头充气会让说话变得困难，导致绝望龙在任何与说话相关的检定上（如欺骗检定）受到-4环境减值。

绝望龙的舌头最多可以延伸90尺，并可以作为充气过程的一部分将舌头完全伸展。充气后的舌头部分可用一个动作（具有专注、操作和移动特征）将充气部分移动最多15尺。在延伸状态下，舌头的膨胀末端会占据一个相应体型生物的空间，但舌头的其余部分不会以任何方式阻碍或阻挡移动。绝望龙的灵敏嗅觉感觉可以通过舌尖的纤毛发挥作用，但除此之外，绝望龙没有其他途径感知舌头附近的事物。

攻击舌头视同攻击绝望龙本体，唯一不同的是舌头始终处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。如果舌头受到任何伤害，它会立即泄气并保持延伸状态。绝望龙会在舌头延伸时持续处于措手不及状态，但可以通过连续两个交互动作来收回舌头。如果舌头受到伤害，绝望龙在1天内无法使用舌头诱饵。

Wayang Whisperblade.name: 剪影人低吟之刃 Wayang Whisperblade
Wayang Whisperblade.publicNotes:
剪影人会利用自身与阴影的联系，在战斗中智胜对手、抢占先机。

那些迷信的大人时常会用低沉的嗓音讲述起那些有关剪影人的故事，告诉他们那些活着的影子是如何出没在三更半夜，吃掉那些不听话的小孩。大多数情况下，这些故事只不过是人们恐惧心理作祟而虚构出来的事物，但事实是，游走于光明与黑暗之间的阴影生物——剪影人，的确存在。现代剪影人的祖先大约在一万年前开始了一场大逃亡，从那时起他们他们离开了自己的故乡——影界，开始寻找新的家园。而在格拉利昂，他们发现一场大灾变所带来的烟云与灰烬遮盖住了太阳的光芒，这颗星球仿佛笼罩在了无尽的黑夜之中。然而等到光明重现人间，剪影人又不得不躲进他们所能找到的那些阴暗角落之中，避免与人类以及其它沐浴光照的族裔产生接触，而一个很大的原因就是：在那段困难的岁月里，剪影人这种矮小而枯槁的生物在这些族裔的眼中，活脱脱就是倾注怀疑的最好对象。

许多剪影人群体都过着游牧的生活，但也有相当数量的剪影人选择了定居。他们有些人居住在天然洞穴之中，用石笋以及其它自然地貌来创造艺术。还有些人则住在雨林的树梢村落之中，在那里，茂密的树冠遮挡住了几乎所有的阳光。剪影人的定居点主要位于天夏（Tian Xia）东南部，尤其是那里的民那塔（Minta）群岛（又称"漂流诸岛" Wandering Isles），不过有时，剪影人们也会前往更遥远的地方。

尽管剪影人在外人嘴中声名败坏又行踪神秘，但实际上他们是一群悠然自乐的生物，喜欢用低吟之歌（whisper-song）、舞蹈以及皮影戏来讲述故事、传达情愫，他们还会用影魔法来增强自己的表演效果。同样，他们还会把影魔法融入到自己那致命的战斗技巧之中，但需注意的是，剪影人其实并不暴力，多数情况下，他们战斗只是为了捍卫自己所拥有的事物。剪影人会在他们那一头乱发上装点起各式珠子，又在他们黝黑的皮肤上刺伤白点组成的图案，用它们来诉说自己家族的历史以及对不同阴影之神的崇拜。
Wayang Whisperblade.allSaves: 对抗黑暗或阴影效果的全豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Darkness or S.name: 对抗黑暗或阴影效果的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Darkness or Shadow

Shadowplay.name: 皮影戏 Shadowplay
Shadowplay.description:
需求 剪影人上一个动作是一次成功对敌人造成了伤害的近战打击

效果 剪影人以+2环境加值尝试一次特技检定以@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]穿过敌人的空间。若检定成功，剪影人会在其原本所处的空间内留下一道朦胧的残影，这能为剪影人提供对该敌人的夹击，直到剪影人的下个回合开始（通常这会让敌人对剪影人的近战攻击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]）。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 剪影人对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]的生物额外造成1d6精准伤害。

Clockwork Mage.name: Clockwork Mage
Clockwork Mage.publicNotes:
A clockwork mage is a lethal blend of magic and machinery. Each of these clockworks is imbued with an arcane stone at its core that powers spells through the wand embedded in its chest.

Intricate, complex machines, clockworks are built with care by highly skilled engineers. Though their creation involves some amount of magic, they're primarily mechanical, packed with precision-tuned gears and springs working in concert.

The sturdy mainspring within a clockwork must be wound to provide the energy needed to power the device. Some larger clockworks contain a series of springs for different limbs that each need to be wound. A clockwork's crafter creates a unique metal key while building the clockwork; winding the clockwork usually involves inserting the key into the machine's back and turning clockwise. Larger clockworks require greater strength to turn the key, and typically have larger keys to allow for more torque-some even accommodating a team of winders rather than an individual. Programming a clockwork requires both the key and the knowledge to set the program correctly, information usually reserved for the clockwork's creator or owner.

equipment-Clockwork Wand.name: Clockwork Wand
equipment-Clockwork Wand.description:
The clockwork wand is a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.vJZ49cgi8szuQXAD]{Magic Wand} containing the last 2nd-rank innate spell the clockwork mage cast (the GM determines the spell randomly if it has not cast any eligible spells). The spells are placed within the wand while the mage is created, and the creator can substitute other arcane spells of the appropriate rank.

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description:
24 hours, [[/act disable-device dc=26]]{DC 26 Thievery}, standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.

Clockwork Wand.name: Clockwork Wand
Clockwork Wand.description:
The clockwork mage uses a mechanical wand as a focus to channel magical energy. This wand is built into the clockwork mage's chest, with only the crystal at the end exposed. The mage can Interact to the remove the wand, or someone else can remove it with a [[/act disable-device dc=31]]{DC 31 Thievery} check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device}. The clockwork mage becomes unable to cast any spells except cantrips while the wand is removed.

When removed, the clockwork wand is a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.vJZ49cgi8szuQXAD]{Magic Wand} containing the last 2nd-rank innate spell the clockwork mage cast (the GM determines the spell randomly if it has not cast any eligible spells). The spells are placed within the wand while the mage is created, and the creator can substitute other arcane spells of the appropriate rank.

Energize Clockwork Wand.name: Energize Clockwork Wand
Energize Clockwork Wand.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes.

Effect The clockwork mage regains a spell it has already cast that day. It must spend 1 hour of its operational time, or 2 hours if the spell is 3rd rank or higher.

Shade (Plane of Water).name: Shade (Plane of Water)
Shade (Plane of Water).publicNotes:
Water pneuma appear as versions of their mortal selves formed of flowing water.

When a mortal dies, their soul travels to the Boneyard in the Outer Planes where they're judged by Pharasma, the goddess of the dead. Once judged, their soul is sent on to their final reward or punishment and, in the process, transformed into a creature known as a shade. This transformation grants the soul a new body, one whose shape is determined by the prevailing philosophical forces of the plane to which they're sent. A shade's memories from their former life usually fade, reduced to a few hazy fragments akin to half-remembered dreams. Regardless of the shade's size, power, or nature in life, they're a Medium creature in their afterlife.

Existence as a shade can last for eons but isn't necessarily eternal. Deities, powerful denizens of the Great Beyond, or even the Outer Planes can further alter a shade's nature by either reducing them into raw quintessence, spiritual essence that's then used to expand a plane's physical manifestation, or by transforming them into a new form of supernatural life such as a celestial, monitor, or fiend. Should a shade die, their body breaks down in a process akin to decay, their form reverting to the elements that make up their plane. This represents the true end of a soul's journey—their life essence reuniting with the heart of the Great Beyond to be recycled into Creation's Forge, fueling the creation of new souls.

Planar Incarnation - Plane of Water (Wat.name: Planar Incarnation - Plane of Water (Water Pneuma)
Planar Incarnation - Plane of Water (Wat.description:
All shades are formed from and personify the nature of the plane on which they manifest, and their statistics are adjusted as summarized below. They also gain any trait associated with creatures from their plane.

Plane of Water (Water Pneuma) Water pneuma appear as versions of their mortal selves formed of flowing water.

  • Language Thalassic
  • Additional Ability amphibious, swim Speed 20 feet
  • Melee current +7 (water), Damage 1d8+2 bludgeoning

Haniver.name: Haniver
Haniver.publicNotes:
Hanivers are the most benign type of gremlin—capricious fey who skim the waves on rubbery fin-wings. Though they don't actively sabotage their environment, sailors bemoan these gremlins' grasping fingers. Hanivers' incessant curiosity compels them to examine any object that draws their attention. Such treasures might include overturned fruit baskets, sacks of coins, or the gleaming teeth of a shark (often still in the shark's mouth, to the fey's regret). Should hanivers like what they find, they steal it, making them a bane to fishers and dockworkers everywhere.

Gremlins arose long ago in the First World, living embodiments of nature's ability to wear away, erode, and decompose. In the Universe, their encounters with mortal civilizations twisted them into creatures devoted to chaos, sabotage, and traps, each variety specializing in a particular brand of mayhem.

Rearrange Possessions.name: Rearrange Possessions
Rearrange Possessions.description:
1 or 2

The haniver attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} a small object off a target's person.

If they succeed, they also rifle through and rearrange the contents of the target's pockets, pouches, and other containers. The next time the target attempts to draw a weapon or retrieve a worn item, doing so requires 2 Interact actions instead of one.

The haniver can Steal an object that's closely guarded using this action without the –5 penalty, though not objects that would be extremely noticeable or time-consuming to remove. They can spend 2 actions instead of 1 to use this ability to Steal from a creature in combat or otherwise on guard.

Mi-Go.name: Mi-Go
Mi-Go.publicNotes:
Mi-gos are both scientists and colonists, yet their extraterrestrial nature and malevolent motives color their investigations with cruelty. While their shape resembles that of an arthropod, mi-gos are in fact a highly evolved and intelligent fungus.

In mi-go society, the pursuit of secular knowledge and religious epiphany has no distinction and inspires their pursuits in tandem. They view the Outer Gods and Great Old Ones less as gods to obey and more as muses or figures of inspiration. This results in a strange blend of magic and technology they use to create bizarre organic items that are grown and spliced together as much as crafted in the traditional sense.

Mi-gos can survive the void of outer space and fly through the vacuum at incredible speeds—though these journeys still can take months within a single solar system and years to travel beyond. When they come to new planets to mine resources rare on their home worlds, they use clever disguises that mix technology and magic to appear as creatures of that world. While there, mi-gos will choose the planet's greatest minds, extract their brains, and preserve them as trophies within an eldritch cylinder.

No Breath.name: No Breath
No Breath.description: A mi-go doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as an inhaled poison).

Clever Disguises.name: Clever Disguises
Clever Disguises.description: A mi-go can use Deception to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} any Medium humanoid creature, although creating such a disguise takes 1 hour. It can't impersonate a specific individual with this ability.

Eviscerate.name: Eviscerate
Eviscerate.description:
