The mi-go performs a swift and painful surgery on a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} or that is otherwise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, attempting a @Check[medicine|defense:fortitude] check against the target's Fortitude DC. Regardless of the result, the target then becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Critical Success The target takes @Damage[6d6[slashing]] damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round, and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (the mi-go chooses) for 24 hours.

Success The target takes @Damage[4d6[slashing]] damage and is slowed 1 for 1 round by the pain.

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage.

Critical Failure The target takes no damage.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A mi-go deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Ozthoom Shadow Double.name: Ozthoom Shadow Double
Ozthoom Shadow Double.publicNotes:
Ozthooms are shadowy killers who serve powerful fey creatures or even the Eldest—the demigods of the First World. Amid the courts of the Eldest or other powerful fey rulers, these sinister assassins lurk overhead as they await the call to action—implied threats akin to deadly weapons hung as decor in a royal hall. Ozthooms never speak aloud; when they feel the need to communicate at all, they do so in a telepathic whisper directly into their victim's mind. While an ozthoom's body is a strange, fleshy material, their deadly claws and cruel hooked wings are made from razor-sharp cold iron, a quality that makes them highly feared among other fey. A typical ozthoom is 10 feet tall and has an 8-foot wingspan, but it weighs less than 80 pounds.

While most ozthooms serve powerful masters, a few of these murderous fey have been left to their own devices and serve none but their own capricious whims. In some cases, their master has been slain, while in others, the ozthoom has been released from service for any number of reasons. An ozthoom left to indulge their cruel desires unrestrained is often the most dangerous ozthoom of them all.

Saving throws against Light effects.name: Saving throws against Light effects
Saving throws against Light effects.description: A shadow double that attempts a saving throw against a light effect can't get a result better than failure.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A ozthoom shadow double's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Sand Sentry.name: Sand Sentry
Sand Sentry.publicNotes:
This creature of pure sand moves with an eerie grace, shifting back and forth between a detailed likeness of a human and a muted and featureless bipedal form. The sand sentry is often called upon by spellcasters to stand guard over an area of great importance; these elementals are patient participants in such roles, making them well suited for long-term service.

Certain earth elementals manifest as specific types of material, be they boulders, sand, or crystals.

Glass Armor.name: Glass Armor
Glass Armor.description: When the sand sentry takes electricity or fire damage, its outer layer of sand fuses into sheets of hardened glass for 1 minute. This increases the sand sentry's AC to 26 and grants it resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, fire, force, piercing, and slashing damage. A sand sentry can't use earth glide while glass armor is active.

Blinding Sand.name: Blinding Sand
Blinding Sand.description: When the sand sentry critically hits with a fist Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: A sand sentry can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Earthen Destrier.name: Earthen Destrier
Earthen Destrier.publicNotes:
This wave of dirt takes the crude likeness of the melded forequarters of a charging warhorse and a rocky knight wielding a rudimentary lance of gray stone.

Certain earth elementals manifest as specific types of material, be they boulders, sand, or crystals.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: An earthen destrier can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Lancing Charge.name: Lancing Charge
Lancing Charge.description: If the destrier moved at least 10 feet directly before its lance arm Strike, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its damage roll.

Tilting Strike.name: Tilting Strike
Tilting Strike.description:
Trigger The earthen destrier tramples a creature

Effect The earthen destrier makes a lance arm Strike against the creature it's Trampling with a –5 circumstance penalty.

Thanatotic Titan.name: Thanatotic Titan
Thanatotic Titan.publicNotes:
Thanatotic titans served as assassins in the war against the deities. They learned to sever their targets' divine connections, murdering mortal priests and divine heralds alike. Thanatotic titans were locked away in the Outer Rifts, but some have freed themselves and crept out from the Outer Rifts so they might continue their sprees of murder and mayhem. They maintain a devotion to their purpose and a grudge, and to this day, they seek out the faithful for slaughter.

Created by ancient deities long before the rise of mortal ancestries, titans united and attempted to overthrow their deific progenitors. The resulting war still figures prominently throughout mortal myths, in which most titans were cast down and imprisoned for eons.
Thanatotic Titan.allSaves: +4 status to all saves vs. mental or divine

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental or Div.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental or Divine

Impossible Stature.name: Impossible Stature
Impossible Stature.description: 100 feet. Titans warp perception and distance around them to seem even larger and more imposing. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the emanation must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:47] save or its movement toward the titan is movement over difficult terrain (greater difficult terrain on a critical failure) for 1 round.

Reactive Strike.name: Reactive Strike
Reactive Strike.description:
The titan can use their Reactive Strike when a creature within their reach uses a concentrate action, in additional to its normal trigger. They disrupt actions on any hit, not just a critical hit—including triggering concentrate actions.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Godslayer.name: Godslayer
Godslayer.description:
Trigger The titan damages a creature capable of using divine spells or abilities

Effect The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45|options:inflicts:frightened] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature can't use divine spells or abilities for 1 round and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. Only powerful non-divine magic, such as manifestation, can undo this effect.

Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but the duration is unlimited.

Titanic Charge.name: Titanic Charge
Titanic Charge.description: The titan Strides twice and makes a melee Strike. If the Strike hits, the titan can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.x7SPrsRxGb2Vy2nu]{Earthquake} centered on the target as a free action.

Void Explosion.name: Void Explosion
Void Explosion.description: If the titan's void chunk Strike isn't a critical failure, the chunk explodes, dealing @Damage[10d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Wide Cleave.name: Wide Cleave
Wide Cleave.description: The titan makes a melee weapon Strike against each foe within their reach. This counts as three attacks for the titan's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until all attacks have been made.

Trained Raven.name: Trained Raven
Trained Raven.publicNotes:
These omnivorous birds are cunning and opportunistic scavengers. Capable of solving simple puzzles to retrieve desired items, ravens gather at the periphery of civilization, raiding it as needed when they're not hunting in the wilds. Ravens are known for trickery and often trained to further this instinct. Trained ravens will wait for an opening and peck their foes in vulnerable spots.

Few birds are as cunning and social as the raven.

Cunning.name: Cunning
Cunning.description: A raven can use simple items as tools, such as poking a stick at an opening to tease out a piece of food. They're also quite adept at stealing objects. A raven can't use Thievery to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ijZ0DDFpMkWqaShd]{Palm an Object}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick a Lock}, but it can use Thievery to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} light objects that it can carry in its beak or talons or to accomplish other relatively simple tasks.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A raven's Strikes deal an additional 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Whisper Dragon (Young).name: 青年低语龙 Whisper Dragon (Young)
Whisper Dragon (Young).publicNotes: 低语龙是敏锐的谣言和秘密收藏家，花费几个世纪来磨练他们的信息网络和人际关系。它们这样做通常并非出于想要控制他人或利用这些信息来进行阴谋，而仅仅是因为学习和收集信息的过程本身就是一种满足。与其他龙的财宝相比，它们的巢穴较为简陋，因为它们真正的财富——秘密——都藏在它们的脑海中。

+2 to Sense Motive.name: 察言观色时+2 +2 to Sense Motive

Information Network.name: 信息网络 Information Network
Information Network.description: 低语龙可以尝试一个社群检定来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]以代替搜集信息检定，从先前的线人处回忆情报。

+2 Status To All Saves Vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status To All Saves Vs. Occult

Diplomatic Solution.name: 外交解决 Diplomatic Solution
Diplomatic Solution.description:
触发 低语龙进行先攻检定

效果 低语龙将其视线内60尺范围内的所有敌人作为目标，施放环级等于低语龙等级一半（向上取整）的安定心神（@Check[will|dc:23]豁免）。低语龙无需维持此效果，但如果低语龙对受到影响的生物采取任何敌对行动，则对所有生物终止该效果。

Distracting Whisper.name: 干扰低语 Distracting Whisper
Distracting Whisper.description:
触发 低语龙成为攻击的目标

效果 一个神秘的声音在触发生物耳边低语，使触发攻击受到-2环境减值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qsvSWxRqVQofjDdH]

Cogitation Breath.name: 凝思吐息 Cogitation Breath
Cogitation Breath.description: 低语龙释放出一股迷惑性毒雾，在@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围内造成@Damage[6d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied]豁免）。豁免失败的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（大失败则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}），持续1分钟。低语龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cogitation Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用凝思吐息。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 低语龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 低语龙的打击重击时，恢复凝思吐息的充能。

Steal Knowledge.name: 窃取知识 Steal Knowledge
Steal Knowledge.description:
低语龙从60尺内一个生物的意识中摘取知识片段，选择一个技能作为影响目标。该生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:23]豁免。

成功 该生物不受影响。

失败 在接下来的1分钟内，该生物使用该技能的检定时承受-1状态减值，而低语龙在使用该技能的检定中获得+1状态加值。

大失败 同失败，但减值为-2，加值为+2。

Kodama.name: Kodama
Kodama.publicNotes:
A kodama is a type of kami who inhabits a tree. Kodama commonly appear in old Tian forests, especially old-growth forests far removed from civilization. In the Forest of Spirits in Minkai, for example, so many trees are possessed by kodama that a traveler might pass by hundreds, if not thousands, of these beings while journeying through a single acre of woodland.

Kodama try their utmost to protect their sacred trees, but a single kodama is a minor obstacle to most oni or others who have no qualms about desecrating forests or harvesting them for natural resources. Like trees in a forest, kodama are most powerful in great numbers and among other kami, whom they can bolster with their magical straw ropes while distracting strong enemies with their mesmerizing presence. On the other hand, kodama bear no ill will toward those who respect their wards, even allowing druids and other deferential creatures to dwell within their bounds. They might even subtly guide lost travelers out of the forest or back to safety.

Kami are divine nature spirits from the lands of Tian Xia, far to the east of the Inner Sea region. They serve as guardians of natural objects and places they protect—their wards—and are ancient enemies of oni (Pathfinder Monster Core 252–255). Kami can merge with their wards, allowing them to surreptitiously watch anyone who treads upon their sacred grounds. Kami leave those who they deem harmless alone, but fight vigilantly to scare away anyone perceived as a threat.
Kodama.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. evil creatures

Ward.name: Ward
Ward.description:
Every kami is bound to a ward: a specific animal, plant, object, or location. A kami can merge with or emerge from their ward as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. While merged, the kami can observe their surroundings with their usual senses as well as the senses of their ward, but can't move, communicate with, or control their ward. Additionally, a kami merged with their ward recovers Hit Points each minute as if they spent an entire day resting.

A kodama's ward is a specific tree.

Distracting Gaze.name: Distracting Gaze
Distracting Gaze.description:
30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. The kodama can activate or deactivate this aura by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the kodama. This condition ends if the creature ends its turn outside the aura.

Critical Failure As failure, plus the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it remains fascinated.

Spiritual Rope.name: Spiritual Rope
Spiritual Rope.description:
The kodama spends 1 minute to fashion an enchanted straw rope out of nearby materials. The rope can be wrapped around other kami creatures to protect them from fell forces. A kami who wears a spiritual rope gains resistance 5 to damage from unholy creatures and effects and a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws against unholy effects and attacks and effects from unholy creatures.

A kodama always wears a spiritual rope, and they can have one other spiritual rope in existence at a time. Creating a new rope beyond these two releases the magic of one of the other two ropes of the kodama's choosing. A spiritual rope around a creature other than a kodama loses its magic after 24 hours or if it's taken outside the kodama's forest.

Tomb Giant.name: Tomb Giant
Tomb Giant.publicNotes:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable power over the undead. Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity. Elder tomb giants enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Spread across the world, giants are as diverse as the isolated places they inhabit. A giant makes a big impression on the local environment, especially on smaller and weaker creatures.

Dooming Touch.name: Dooming Touch
Dooming Touch.description: The tomb giant's claws carry the accursed power of their foul gods. A creature hit by the tomb giant's claw Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Font of Death.name: Font of Death
Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel powered by the Void. The tomb giant touches a creature that died within the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with void energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this void from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[10d8[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic] save); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

Sylph Sneak.name: Sylph Sneak
Sylph Sneak.publicNotes:
Born with elemental gales coursing through their breath, sylphs are wispy planar scions whose bodies seem caught in a perpetual, gentle breeze. Most commonly born of unions between mortals and jaathoom, sylphs are quick-witted and creative, but they're prone to flights of fancy and tend to be easily distracted.

Sylphs are notorious for their practice of "listening to the wind," which most others dismiss as a fancy name for eavesdropping. Yet this custom means much more to sylphs, who spend hours listening to the stories brought to them on the proverbial breeze. While some less scrupulous sylphs can use the information they learn to blackmail or abuse others, most of them see listening to the wind as their way of staying connected to the world around them while still keeping it comfortably at arm's length. Certainly, the typical sylph sneak doesn't seek to use what they learn for ill but instead warns others of dangers yet unrealized or prepares themself for a dangerous task.

Deflecting Gale.name: Deflecting Gale
Deflecting Gale.description:
Trigger The sylph sneak is the target of a physical ranged attack

Requirements The sylph sneak is aware of the attack

Effect A swift gale whips up between the sylph sneak and the source of the ranged attack, giving the sneak a +3 status bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the wind deflected it. The wind can't deflect unusually large or heavy ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The sylph sneak's Strikes deal 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attacker.name: Surprise Attacker
Surprise Attacker.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the sylph sneak.

Wind's Guidance.name: Wind's Guidance
Wind's Guidance.description: When the sylph sneak attacks with a thrown weapon, the range increment increases by 10 feet.

Requiem Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: 成年安魂龙施法者 Requiem Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Requiem Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 安魂龙是灵魂之河（River of Souls）的守护者，负责引导灵魂抵达其在来世的最终归宿。灵魂的安全旅程对安魂龙至关重要，一些安魂龙会从灵魂首次进入灵魂之河开始，直到它们在骨园的审判，最终引导灵魂到达它们最终的安息之地。大多数安魂龙将自己与特定的位面绑定，负责守护所有进入该位面的灵魂，导致这些龙与天堂或地狱等地方相关联，尽管这些龙从不对这些位面宣誓效忠。安魂龙将它们的巢穴建在灵魂之河沿岸——这些巢穴是从其他位面拯救出来的沉重建筑拼接而成——并充满了无价的记录和伟大成就的纪念物。

Soul Journey.name: 灵魂之旅 Soul Journey
Soul Journey.description: 安魂龙花费1小时穿越位面通道进入灵魂之河，然后可以到达灵魂之河的任意位置。这具备@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]效果，但安魂龙能够精确到达任何主要位面上的地点。

Status Sight.name: 状态视觉 Status Sight
Status Sight.description: 安魂龙会自动知晓它能看到的所有生物的生命值。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: 对抗神术全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Soul Anchor.name: 灵魂锚定 Soul Anchor
Soul Anchor.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物的生命值将降至0

效果 安魂龙将触发生物的灵魂锚定于其躯体，该生物的生命值保持在1点，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，并获得与安魂龙等级相等的快速治疗，持续1分钟。该生物在24小时内暂时免疫灵魂锚定效果。

Withhold Death.name: 阻止死亡 Withhold Death
Withhold Death.description:
触发 安魂龙被一次攻击重击

效果 安魂龙抵抗灵魂的松动，减少部分伤害。安魂针对触发攻击获得15点所有伤害类型的抗力。

Dooming Breath.name: 毁灭吐息 Dooming Breath
Dooming Breath.description: 安魂龙从口中喷出来自创生熔炉的能量，在@Template[type:line|distance:90]范围内造成@Damage[12d8[spirit]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免失败的不死生物还必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:36|options:area-effect,inflicts:doomed]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。如果目标已陷入毁灭，则毁灭值增加1（最多为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 4}）。安魂龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dooming Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用毁灭吐息。

Soul Shield.name: 灵魂护盾 Soul Shield
Soul Shield.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 安魂龙利用其生命精华在60尺内的一个生物周围创造出一个精魂能量护盾。此护盾与生物建立了一个连接，效果与护卫分命相似，区别在于该效果不会因距离而中断，并持续1小时。此外，该生物获得对物理和精魂伤害的5点抗力，适用于其所承受伤害的一半。安魂龙可以解消该效果。

Shade (Netherworld).name: Shade (Netherworld)
Shade (Netherworld).publicNotes:
The mutilated appear as they did in their mortal lives, yet are covered in wounds or partially adorned or wrapped in chains.

When a mortal dies, their soul travels to the Boneyard in the Outer Planes where they're judged by Pharasma, the goddess of the dead. Once judged, their soul is sent on to their final reward or punishment and, in the process, transformed into a creature known as a shade. This transformation grants the soul a new body, one whose shape is determined by the prevailing philosophical forces of the plane to which they're sent. A shade's memories from their former life usually fade, reduced to a few hazy fragments akin to half-remembered dreams. Regardless of the shade's size, power, or nature in life, they're a Medium creature in their afterlife.

Existence as a shade can last for eons but isn't necessarily eternal. Deities, powerful denizens of the Great Beyond, or even the Outer Planes can further alter a shade's nature by either reducing them into raw quintessence, spiritual essence that's then used to expand a plane's physical manifestation, or by transforming them into a new form of supernatural life such as a celestial, monitor, or fiend. Should a shade die, their body breaks down in a process akin to decay, their form reverting to the elements that make up their plane. This represents the true end of a soul's journey—their life essence reuniting with the heart of the Great Beyond to be recycled into Creation's Forge, fueling the creation of new souls.

Planar Incarnation - Netherworld (The Mu.name: Planar Incarnation - Netherworld (The Mutilated)
Planar Incarnation - Netherworld (The Mu.description:
All shades are formed from and personify the nature of the plane on which they manifest, and their statistics are adjusted as summarized below. They also gain any trait associated with creatures from their plane.

Shadow Plane (The Mutilated) The mutilated appear as they did in their mortal lives, yet are covered in wounds or partially adorned or wrapped in chains.

  • Sanctification unholy
  • Language Shadowtongue
  • Additional Ability immune to bleed and fear
  • Melee chain +7, Damage 1d8+2 bludgeoning

Maftet Guardian.name: Maftet Guardian
Maftet Guardian.publicNotes:
Maftets are hawk-winged humanoids with leonine lower bodies that dwell in ancient ruins and cities thought lost, typically in desert or mountain regions. They view themselves as guardians and practice a specialized technique of dualwielding scimitars so central to their culture that a maftet's scimitars are often cherished family heirlooms. Most maftets venerate their ancestors in addition to various deities, and even a child can detail their family lineage back multiple generations. Maftet prides tend to be matriarchal and isolationist, though maftets aren't necessarily hostile to outsiders who respect their homes and don't seek to loot them.

When a young maftet comes of age, they receive runic tattoos from a pride's elder. These tattoos are imbued with magic that allows a maftet to enchant their wielded weapons, but the individualized designs tell of the maftet's ancestors, childhood adventures, and positive qualities. Such tattoos are considered sacred and never given to non-maftets.

Runic Resistance.name: Runic Resistance
Runic Resistance.description:
Trigger The maftet takes damage from a Strike or spell effect

Effect The maftet's protective runic tattoos glow, granting them resistance 5 to one damage type dealt by the triggering attack.

This resistance applies against the triggering effect and lasts for 1 minute or until the maftet uses this ability again, whichever comes first. If the triggering effect deals multiple damage types, the maftet chooses which type to resist.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.P4bNtDVyknQwjTPo]{Effect: Runic Resistance}

Paired Strike.name: Paired Strike
Paired Strike.description:
Requirements The maftet is wielding two scimitars

Effect The maftet makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of their scimitars. The maftet combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as one attack when calculating the maftet's multiple attack penalty.

Powerful Scimitars.name: Powerful Scimitars
Powerful Scimitars.description: Any non-magical scimitar becomes a +1 striking scimitar while a maftet wields it.

Raptor Dive.name: Raptor Dive
Raptor Dive.description:
Requirements The maftet is flying at least 10 feet above the target

Effect The maftet Flies up to twice their fly Speed and makes a Paired Strike at the end of the movement. If both Strikes hit, the target is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Ember Fox.name: Ember Fox
Ember Fox.publicNotes:
Ember foxes resemble their canid namesakes, save for the flames that make their fur and the tips of their long whiskers flicker and glow. They particularly enjoy hunting elementals from the Plane of Wood.

Destructive manifestations of the Plane of Fire, fire elementals sometimes incorporate burning materials into their being or superheated matter, such as molten rock or searing smoke. In combat, they tend to be aggressive and somewhat reckless. Their attacks can sometimes cause major destruction to the surrounding environment, and many fire elementals seem to enjoy seeing their flames spread far and wide.

Cloak in Embers.name: Cloak in Embers
Cloak in Embers.description:
Trigger An adjacent ally is targeted by an effect that deals fire damage

Effect The ember fox drapes itself across its ally, granting the ally fire resistance 10 against the incoming attack.

Whisper Dragon (Ancient).name: 古低语龙 Whisper Dragon (Ancient)
Whisper Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes: 低语龙是敏锐的谣言和秘密收藏家，花费几个世纪来磨练他们的信息网络和人际关系。它们这样做通常并非出于想要控制他人或利用这些信息来进行阴谋，而仅仅是因为学习和收集信息的过程本身就是一种满足。与其他龙的财宝相比，它们的巢穴较为简陋，因为它们真正的财富——秘密——都藏在它们的脑海中。

Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.name: 法术效果：心灵屏匿 Hidden Mind
Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.description:
效果来自@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]

你在对抗心灵效果的豁免上获得+4状态加值。

+2 to Sense Motive.name: 察言观色时+2 +2 to Sense Motive

Information Network.name: 信息网络 Information Network
Information Network.description: 低语龙可以尝试一个社群检定来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]以代替搜集信息检定，从先前的线人处回忆情报。

+2 Status To All Saves Vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status To All Saves Vs. Occult

Diplomatic Solution.name: 外交解决 Diplomatic Solution
Diplomatic Solution.description:
触发 低语龙进行先攻检定

效果 低语龙将其视线内60尺范围内的所有敌人作为目标，施放环级等于低语龙等级一半（向上取整）的安定心神（@Check[will|dc:35]豁免）。低语龙无需维持此效果，但如果低语龙对受到影响的生物采取任何敌对行动，则对所有生物终止该效果。

Distracting Whisper.name: 干扰低语 Distracting Whisper
Distracting Whisper.description:
触发 低语龙成为攻击的目标

效果 一个神秘的声音在触发生物耳边低语，使触发攻击受到-2环境减值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qsvSWxRqVQofjDdH]

Cogitation Breath.name: 凝思吐息 Cogitation Breath
Cogitation Breath.description: 低语龙释放出一股迷惑性毒雾，在@Template[type:cone|distance:50]范围内造成@Damage[15d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied]豁免）。豁免失败的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（大失败则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}），持续1分钟。低语龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cogitation Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用凝思吐息。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 低语龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 低语龙的打击重击时，恢复凝思吐息的充能。

Steal Knowledge.name: 窃取知识 Steal Knowledge
Steal Knowledge.description:
低语龙从60尺内一个生物的意识中摘取知识片段，选择一个技能作为影响目标。该生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:35]豁免。

成功 该生物不受影响。

失败 在接下来的1分钟内，该生物使用该技能的检定时承受-1状态减值，而低语龙在使用该技能的检定中获得+1状态加值。

大失败 同失败，但减值为-2，加值为+2。

Thought Whispers.name: 思想低语 Thought Whispers
Thought Whispers.description:
频率 每分钟一次

效果 低语龙将自己的心灵扩展以探知他人的思想，对60尺内所有生物使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KHnhPHL4x1AQHfbC]（@Check[will|dc:37]豁免）。

Unveil Secret.name: 揭开秘密 Unveil Secret
Unveil Secret.description: 低语龙探知60尺内一个生物的思维，搜寻其秘密，除非目标通过@Check[will|dc:37]豁免，否则低语龙会知晓一个该生物会觉得尴尬或羞耻的事情。目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，且在1分钟内或在低语龙揭露秘密前无法降低惊惧状态。当受影响生物尝试检定时，低语龙可用一个反应动作揭露其秘密使其难堪，迫使该生物投掷两次并取较差结果；这是一个厄运效果。

Skeletal Titan.name: 骷髅泰坦 Skeletal Titan
Skeletal Titan.publicNotes:
只有强大但又愚蠢的家伙才会将伟岸的泰坦或类似的巨型生物复活为骷髅。技艺娴熟的实践者认为这是在浪费一具强大的遗体，并根据泰坦的身躯为它们注入了空中行走的魔法；而聪明的人则知道控制这样一个巨无霸几乎不可能，而且它也很有可能在剁扁敌人时把它的创造者压在它硕大的脚下。

在亡者的行列中，没有哪种不死有着如骷髅一般无穷的数量与种类。虽然大多数骷髅几乎完全由骨头构成，但少部分还保留着一些肉屑来帮助它们运动，比如翼膜。

Bone Debris.name: 巨骨残片 Bone Debris
Bone Debris.description: 骷髅泰坦投掷的骨头大到足以扰乱战场。当骷髅泰坦用巨骨攻击命中一个生物时，投掷物在该生物占据的方格（如果该生物占据的方格多于一个，则由泰坦选择其中一个）成为困难地形。如果泰坦的巨骨攻击没有命中，与该生物相邻的一个随机方格就会变成困难地形。

Mountain Slam.name: 山劈 Mountain Slam
Mountain Slam.description: 骷髅泰坦将它的山岳巨剑砸向地面。冲击波回荡，对@Template[type:line|distance:20]范围内的所有生物造成@Damage[(3d12+13)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还会被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

Volnagur.name: 沃纳古尔 Volnagur
Volnagur.publicNotes:
在洛瓦古格所有子嗣中，名为沃纳古尔的生物最远离格拉利昂核心的死之库，反倒在苍穹之间筑巢安家。沃纳古尔拥有多对翅膀，它们不对称，错落排布也不协调，然而这只巨大的子嗣仍能展翅翱翔，其飞行范围远达阿卡迪亚、天夏，甚至瑟茹珊。尽管它能用剃刀般锋利的舌头和四只眼睛喷射的能量冲击造成巨大破坏，但沃纳古尔最骇人的能力是通过精确调整翅膀角度与风向碰撞产生的不和谐之歌，能驱使所有听者陷入暴力，使邻里反目成仇。

尽管数十年未被发现，天文学家近期在格拉利昂大气层上层探测到一颗卫星，沃纳古尔一动不动悬浮于此。当它漂移于各大洲之间时，其双眼似乎交替凝视着月亮与格拉利昂，仿佛在等待某种信号。

尽管毁灭之神洛瓦古格如同困在琥珀中的苍蝇般被囚禁在行星的核心中，自创世之年起便被诸神联盟禁锢，但随着时光流逝，囚笼日渐衰弱，使其影响力得以渗透而出，化作名为洛瓦古格之嗣的活体灾厄。这些庞然巨物已肆虐格拉利昂多个纪元，其狂暴行径摧毁了群山，焦灼了沙漠，更用海洋填满大地上的巨坑。它们的再生能力使其成为永恒威胁，永远无法彻底消灭。这些完全的毁灭生物竟能对生命保持如此不灭的掌控力，成为学者们苦苦思索的悖论。有人认为每只子嗣都承载着父神赐福的微小碎片；另有人推测它们的不朽源于所造成的毁灭，每夺走一个生命的未来，便换取自身永恒的延续。

历史上关于子嗣袭击的记载存在一条奇特的脉络：每次袭击过后，该地区都会迎来一段短暂却显著的黄金时代。尽管多数人将此归因于抵御子嗣蹂躏所需的协作精神，但有人视之为扭曲的象征，这些生物实为"真正"和平的缔造者。这些信徒常组织邪教，执意召唤或复活任何近期被击杀的子嗣。

尽管许多子嗣已多年未现踪迹，但神祇古拉姆——死之库的最初缔造者之一——的陨落再度削弱了封印，令洛瓦古格的意志在格拉利昂各地掀起涟漪。仿佛作为回应，众多子嗣开始重现于世，令格拉利昂的领袖、学者与战士们惊惶不已。毕竟，若单个子嗣便足以酿成颠复时代的灾厄，需以军队为代价才能勉强遏制其破坏力，当所有子嗣同时苏醒时，又将引发何等难以想象的浩劫？

Slumbering Armageddon.name: 沉眠末日 Slumbering Armageddon
Slumbering Armageddon.description:
沃纳古尔的沉眠会提升野兽袭击，害虫害兽成群，暴力犯罪的几率。

洛瓦古格之嗣能在再生的休眠中沉睡数个世纪。沉睡期间，子嗣无需进食、饮水甚至呼吸，且所有抗力数值翻倍。它无法被侦测、揭示或探知效果定位，并且它的所有豁免检定结果使用比实际结果高一级成功度。当子嗣沉睡时，其巨大的毁灭能量无处宣泄，向外蔓延侵蚀周遭环境，导致其栖身之所周围1英里弥漫范围内，与子嗣相匹配类型的自然灾害将更频繁、更剧烈地发生，且每沉睡十年，灾害的半径便扩大约1英里。

Absolute Regeneration.name: 绝对再生 Absolute Regeneration
Absolute Regeneration.description:
如果由不少于12名技艺精湛，才华横溢的个体组成的合唱团，在其尸体上持续无间断、无瑕疵地吟唱一首关于开端与希望的颂歌，历时1年零1天，则可让沃纳古尔的再生失效。

如同再生，但需要极特定的动作才能使其失效。洛瓦古格之嗣的再生强大到即便其被死亡效果杀死也能让它复活。如果子嗣在对抗某种会立即杀死它的效果时豁免失败，它会在死亡3轮后以1点生命值复活。子嗣仍然可以被放逐，禁锢，或传送等方式以保全一个区域，或借助造成常驻伤害的效果使其保持在濒死状态。

Alien Harmonics.name: 异形谐音 Alien Harmonics
Alien Harmonics.description:
60尺。

沃纳古尔持续释放出刺耳的噪音，既能淹没其他声音与思绪，又能强化其歌声。进入该灵光的生物必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:43]豁免，否则只要其处于灵光内，便只能听见沃尔纳古的歌声，使得生物对除沃纳古尔外所有声源陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]。

如果大失败，该效果为永久，无论距离，刺耳噪音都将永驻目标耳畔。此灵光还会反制任何听觉效果，任何提供听觉或音波效果抗力或免疫的效果，以及任何制造沉默的效果（反制等级10环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+33 #Counteract]]{+33}）。

Intercepting Eyes.name: 拦截之眼 Intercepting Eyes
Intercepting Eyes.description:
触发 沃纳古尔成为一次远程攻击的目标

需求 沃纳古尔意识到攻击且没有对其@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]

效果 沃纳古尔的一只眼睛锁定攻击，射出眼波射线将其击落。此次攻击变为大失败。

Reactive.name: 敏锐反应 Reactive
Reactive.description: 沃纳古尔每轮获得3个反应动作。它仍然只能对每次触发使用一个反应动作。

Endsong.name: 终末之歌 Endsong
Endsong.description:
暗藏在沃纳古尔攻击中的微妙震动会使其目标陷入困惑，心中充斥着毁灭的渴望。被沃纳古尔打击之一命中的生物必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:45]豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响且临时免疫24小时，或直到其受到来自终末尖啸的伤害。

成功 目标不受影响。

失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ][[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}。它不能尝试攻击沃纳古尔或其他被终末之歌影响的生物。

大失败 同失败，但目标陷入困惑1小时。当处于困惑状态时，其打击将与沃纳古尔的歌声产生共鸣，造成额外@Damage[1d6[sonic]]伤害，并迫使目标进行豁免对抗终末之歌。

Gaze Upon.name: 凝视 Gaze Upon
Gaze Upon.description: 沃纳古尔对@Template[type:cone|distance:120]区域内的每个生物进行一次眼波射线打击。这些攻击计入沃纳古尔的多重攻击减值，但多重攻击减值在沃纳古尔完成所有攻击前不会增加。它不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Gaze Upon]]{1d4轮}内再次使用凝视，但直到沃纳古尔下个回合开始前，它能够以自由动作使用拦截之眼。

Scream of the End.name: 终末尖啸 Scream of the End
Scream of the End.description:
需求 沃纳古尔使一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]

效果 沃纳古尔将生物抓到眼前，在极近距离轰击它。沃纳古尔对目标造成@Damage[23d6[sonic]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic]豁免）。无论豁免结果如何，目标不再受擒或束缚，并被推离沃纳古尔120尺，然后陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

Giant Badger.name: Giant Badger
Giant Badger.publicNotes:
The violent, territorial giant badger is a relentless predator. An obligate carnivore, it can consume prey that ranges from rabbits to deer, livestock, and even the occasional adventurer. A giant badger's claws are sharp and strong enough to carve tunnels from solid rock. They typically stand 4 feet tall at the shoulder and weigh 500 pounds.

Giant badgers are fercely territorial and are known to defend their burrows with fury, even if a creature isn't necessarily threatening. These burrows tend to be larger than a giant badger typically needs, which sometimes draws the attention of other creatures seeking homes. This leads to many encounters between giant badgers and larger animals such as bears.

Badger Rage.name: Badger Rage
Badger Rage.description:
The giant badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, whichever comes first.

While raging, the giant badger has AC 17, its jaws Strike deals 1d8+8 damage, and its claw Strike deals 1d6+6 damage. While raging, the giant badger also can't use actions that have the concentrate trait except for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}.

After it has stopped raging, a giant badger can't use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

Tanuki Village Hero.name: Tanuki Village Hero
Tanuki Village Hero.publicNotes:
A tanuki village hero is a firefighter, monster slayer, peacekeeper, and altruist. Village heroes are elected by community vote; while the village hero sometimes grumbles that it's a lot of responsibility for a single tanuki to bear, the community insists there's no higher honor than to be trusted with their well-being.

Tanuki are an ancestry of humanoids resembling raccoons or canids who live primarily in Minkai, in Tian Xia, though they are also found in Hwanggot and the successor states of Lung Wa. Tanuki outside of Minkai tend to be shier, keeping to their raccoon-dog forms and staying out of trouble, and so most people associate tanuki solely with the boisterous and mischievous communities found in Minkai.

Perennial underdogs, most tanuki live for feasting, festivals, and fun, which they accomplish mainly through their wide range of shapeshifting powers. They are especially known for pranks that tend to backfire in their faces, from posing as teapots for a quick profit (and then immediately being set on fire by new owners seeking to make tea) to posing as priests (and being promptly exorcised by the real priests with whom they attempt to blend in.) Despite this, tanuki are masters at rolling with any punches that life flings at them.

Many tanuki see other shapechangers as rivals, especially kitsune, which are also common in Minkai. Such tanuki are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} to creating impromptu competitions to prove their ancestry's superiority at shapechanging. These competitions are always meant to be good natured, at least for the competitors; bamboozled villagers caught up in the wake of these games often have different opinions.

Somewhat confusingly, the animals that tanuki resemble are also known as tanuki, and it is difficult to ascertain whether any individual raccoon dog is a simple beast or a sapient tanuki in disguise.

Transformation Duels

Tanuki often settle disputes with transformation contests. The competitors' objective is to fool their opponent with a combination of assumed form and clever ruse. Legends tell of rivals transforming into flotillas of ships or imperial processions, or cunningly tricking their opponent into thinking they did.

Tactical Retreat.name: Tactical Retreat
Tactical Retreat.description:
Trigger The tanuki takes damage

Effect The tanuki runs to a better tactical position. The tanuki gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition until the beginning of their next turn and Strides.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The tanuki takes on the form of a mundane raccoon dog. This makes them Tiny and gives them a +2 status bonus to their Stealth modifier, but they can't make Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Tricky Throw.name: Tricky Throw
Tricky Throw.description: The tanuki winds up and puts their everything into a throw. They make a dart Strike at one enemy within 40 feet. If the Strike is unsuccessful, the tanuki falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the Strike is successful, they really did put everything into the throw, having transformed into the dart the moment they threw it. The tanuki disappears from the space they threw from, appears in a space adjacent to the enemy and makes a kama Strike against said enemy, who's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the attack.

Undine Hydromancer.name: Undine Hydromancer
Undine Hydromancer.publicNotes:
Undines are infused with elemental water-the churning power of the briny deep flows through them. These planar scions are often athletic and lithe, but they are easily distracted by auditory sensations because of how much louder and clearer sound rings above the waves.

Undines are perhaps the most settled of all geniekin, often forming communities along the coast or even on the water itself. In the latter case, they prefer to settle in ship-towns that sometimes number dozens of vessels in all shapes and sizes. The undines who fill these communities are similarly diverse, bringing aspects of multiple cultures together to form one whole. Ship-towns are permanent, but fluid-they grow, recede, and migrate constantly as undine families add their ships to or remove them from the flotilla. An undine town like this may remain at sea for years, its residents coming ashore only on rare occasions to collect wood for cookfires or to repair their homes. The paradoxically ever-shifting permanence of these communities reflects the undine virtues of adaptability and freedom, while also maintaining the prime importance of the community.

Undine hydromancers are quite valued on these floating settlements, if only for their ability to create fresh drinking water while adrift on the sea.

Trilobite Swarm.name: Trilobite Swarm
Trilobite Swarm.publicNotes:
Trilobites typically live in close proximity to others of their kind. On rare occasions, particularly when the most common prey around is larger than what a single trilobite can take down, they form swarms that seem to actively cooperate with each other. These swarms latch onto their prey, and the combined efforts of so many trilobites at once make escape difficult.

Often overlooked as little more than water-dwelling pests, trilobites are a varied class of arthropods found throughout the seas and oceans of Golarion. So ancient and widespread are these critters that trilobite fossils are as commonly found as living specimens. Trilobites vary wildly in both size and diet, with the largest reaching up to 28 inches long. Fossil record shows that trilobites were even more diverse and prevalent in ancient times than they are today, but their species entered a decline due to the devastation of Earthfall.

Clinging Bites.name: Clinging Bites
Clinging Bites.description: The trilobites in the swarm latch onto creatures and gnaw at them. Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Compsognathus Swarm.name: Compsognathus Swarm
Compsognathus Swarm.publicNotes: Though a curious lone compsognathus is occasionally known to sneak into an adventurer's camp, they're often scouting from a nearby pack potentially containing dozens of the tiny bipedal dinosaurs. If the pack is threatened—especially near a nesting site—they'll scurry about in self-defense. Despite their large numbers, the swarm can dart away from danger quickly, and their gnashing teeth carry the threat of venom to anyone who comes too close.

Evade.name: Evade
Evade.description:
Trigger An adjacent enemy targets the swarm with a Strike

Effect With quick movements, the swarm gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the swarm can Stride up to 10 feet after the Strike.

Compsognathus Venom.name: Compsognathus Venom
Compsognathus Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Venomous Bite.name: Venomous Bite
Venomous Bite.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save). A creature who fails the save is also exposed to compsognathus venom.

Thanadaemon.name: Thanadaemon
Thanadaemon.publicNotes:
Also known as the deacons of death, thanadaemons represent death via old age. They are among the most patient daemons, and prefer to bide their time to enact far-reaching, decades-long plans rather than fight (though they are still deadly foes). Like the Horseman of Death, they ply the waters of the River Styx in search of wayward souls. Rarely are thanadaemons seen without a trademark oar (which they wield as a bo staff), a tool they use to navigate the river's muck-ridden channels and turbulent rapids.

Daemons form from the most despicable souls and personify forms of death.
Thanadaemon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Terrifying Gaze.name: Terrifying Gaze
Terrifying Gaze.description: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save. If the creature fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. The creature is then temporarily immune to terrifying gaze (but not Focus Gaze) for 24 hours.

Draining Strike.name: Draining Strike
Draining Strike.description: When a thanadaemon damages a living creature with a melee Strike, the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the thanadaemon increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

Focus Gaze.name: Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: The thanadaemon glares at a single creature they can see within 30 feet. If the target wasn't already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, they must immediately attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save against the thanadaemon's terrifying gaze. If the target was already frightened, they must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}; this second effect has the incapacitation trait. After attempting its save, the creature is temporarily immune to this ability until the start of the thanadaemon's next turn.

Soul Crush.name: Soul Crush
Soul Crush.description:
Requirements The thanadaemon has a soul gem

Effect The thanadaemon crushes the soul gem in one hand and gains fast healing 15 for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.oKNFSWJW2jat8Dli]{Effect: Soul Crush (Healing)}

Vloriak.name: Vloriak
Vloriak.publicNotes:
Vloriaks rise from the sinful souls of those whose acts of sabotage resulted in despair and terror, and they delight in the destruction of mortal artifice. They make use of their ability to rust metals to destroy structures, precious works of art, and tools used for creation. In combat, this ability allows them to destroy the armaments of their attacks. Vloriaks particularly enjoy destroying armors and shields, as these defensive items generally bear elegant designs and decorations that are more enjoyable to despoil than those of a weapon.

Often called despoiler demons, vloriaks were the followers of the long-dead demon lord Xar-Azmak. Their numbers have dwindled over the eons since the Lord of Rust's death; those that exist now are scattered throughout the Outer Rifts. Their chitinous bodies and faceted eyes give them an insectile appearance.
Vloriak.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Restoration Vulnerability.name: Restoration Vulnerability
Restoration Vulnerability.description: A vloriak feels agonizing pain when a creature or object recovers from a debilitating effect in their proximity. The first time in a round in which a creature that is within sight of the demon reduces the value of their clumsy, enfeebled, sickened, or stupefied condition, the demon takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage and cannot Lick Rust on their next turn.

Lick Rust.name: Lick Rust
Lick Rust.description:
Requirements The vloriak rusted a metal item with its tongue this turn

Effect The vloriak attempts a tongue Strike on the same target it just attacked. If it hits, it deals no damage as it licks away the rust and heals @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points (or @Damage[4d6[healing]] Hit Points if the Strike was a critical hit). It can't Lick Rust on its next turn.

Rust.name: Rust
Rust.description: A vloriak's saliva causes metal to rust rapidly. If it succeeds at a tongue Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} attempt, the vloriak deals @Damage[2d6[untyped]] damage (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness. If the vloriak hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against a tongue attack, the shield is automatically broken, but no other item is rusted on that attack.

Spew Rusted Shards.name: Spew Rusted Shards
Spew Rusted Shards.description: The vloriak spews a @Template[cone|distance:15] of acid and rusted metal. Creatures in the area take @Damage[3d6[acid],3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]{3d6 acid and 3d6 piercing} damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that takes any piercing damage is exposed to tetanus. The vloriak can't Spew Rusted Shards for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spew Rusted Shards]]{1d4 rounds}.

Tetanus.name: Tetanus
Tetanus.description:
An infection introduced through open wounds, tetanus can produce stiffness, muscle spasms strong enough to break bones, and ultimately death.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:14]

Onset 10 days

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 week)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and can't speak (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} with spasms (1 day)

Stage 4 death

Requiem Dragon (Young).name: 青年安魂龙 Requiem Dragon (Young)
Requiem Dragon (Young).publicNotes: 安魂龙是灵魂之河（River of Souls）的守护者，负责引导灵魂抵达其在来世的最终归宿。灵魂的安全旅程对安魂龙至关重要，一些安魂龙会从灵魂首次进入灵魂之河开始，直到它们在骨园的审判，最终引导灵魂到达它们最终的安息之地。大多数安魂龙将自己与特定的位面绑定，负责守护所有进入该位面的灵魂，导致这些龙与天堂或地狱等地方相关联，尽管这些龙从不对这些位面宣誓效忠。安魂龙将它们的巢穴建在灵魂之河沿岸——这些巢穴是从其他位面拯救出来的沉重建筑拼接而成——并充满了无价的记录和伟大成就的纪念物。

Soul Journey.name: 灵魂之旅 Soul Journey
Soul Journey.description: 安魂龙花费1小时穿越位面通道进入灵魂之河，然后可以到达灵魂之河的任意位置。这具备@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]效果，但安魂龙能够精确到达任何主要位面上的地点。

Status Sight.name: 状态视觉 Status Sight
Status Sight.description: 安魂龙会自动知晓它能看到的所有生物的生命值。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: 对抗神术全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Soul Anchor.name: 灵魂锚定 Soul Anchor
Soul Anchor.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物的生命值将降至0

效果 安魂龙将触发生物的灵魂锚定于其躯体，该生物的生命值保持在1点，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，并获得与安魂龙等级相等的快速治疗，持续1分钟。该生物在24小时内暂时免疫灵魂锚定效果。

Withhold Death.name: 阻止死亡 Withhold Death
Withhold Death.description:
触发 安魂龙被一次攻击重击

效果 安魂龙抵抗灵魂的松动，减少部分伤害。安魂针对触发攻击获得10点所有伤害类型的抗力。

Dooming Breath.name: 毁灭吐息 Dooming Breath
Dooming Breath.description: 安魂龙从口中喷出来自创生熔炉的能量，在@Template[type:line|distance:60]范围内造成@Damage[9d8[spirit]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免失败的不死生物还必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:30|options:area-effect,inflicts:doomed]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。如果目标已陷入毁灭，则毁灭值增加1（最多为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 4}）。安魂龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dooming Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用毁灭吐息。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 安魂龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 安魂龙的打击重击时会恢复毁灭吐息的充能。

Requiem Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Despair Dragon (Young).name: 青年绝望龙 Despair Dragon (Young)
Despair Dragon (Young).publicNotes: 恐惧是最强烈的情感之一，而绝望龙是将恐惧和绝望之情引导为自己利益的高手。像其他异能龙一样，绝望龙也有一种与生俱来的冲动，那就是激起他人的恐惧。绝望龙通常会定居在城镇附近，以便从周围的恐惧中汲取力量。绝望龙的财宝中最常见的物品是卷轴、典籍和遗物，这些物品是它们研究的材料。通过这些，绝望龙能了解到当地的民间传说、都市传说等，从而更好地困扰它们的目标。

Fearsense.name: 恐惧感知 Fearsense
Fearsense.description: 绝望龙能够感知所有处于惊惧状态的生物，范围如上所述。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Consume Fear.name: 吞噬恐惧 Consume Fear
Consume Fear.description:
触发 绝望龙60尺内的一个生物失去惊惧状态

效果 绝望龙从失去惊惧状态的生物体内汲取恐惧，获得4d8临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Unbidden Thoughts.name: 无声思绪 Unbidden Thoughts
Unbidden Thoughts.description:
触发 绝望龙被武器或无武装攻击重击

效果 攻击者的心智被关于他们最深层恐惧的幻象所占据，导致感官超负荷。攻击者必须选择以下结果之一：该次攻击变为普通成功，或者该次攻击保持重击但攻击者陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 绝望龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 绝望龙的打击重击时，恢复尖叫吐息的使用次数。

Shrieking Breath.name: 尖叫吐息 Shrieking Breath
Shrieking Breath.description: 绝望龙发出由它从恐惧敌人那里汲取的尖叫所组成的刺耳音波，在@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围内造成@Damage[8d6[sonic]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。 豁免失败的生物必须在下一回合开始时将第一个动作用于尖叫。绝望龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Shrieking Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用尖叫吐息。

Living Boulder.name: Living Boulder
Living Boulder.publicNotes:
Living boulders roll and glide through the Plane of Earth, gathering gemstones and metal shards until their surfaces resemble a ship's hull covered in barnacles. Barely more intelligent than many animals, living boulders fill much the same role on the Plane of Earth as the great herd animals found on worlds in the Universe.

Certain earth elementals manifest as specific types of material, be they boulders, sand, or crystals.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: A living boulder can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Rolling Charge.name: Rolling Charge
Rolling Charge.description: The living boulder Strides twice, and can then make a Strike with its jaws. This jaws Strike gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}.

Vanara Disciple.name: Vanara Disciple
Vanara Disciple.publicNotes:
Many young vanaras travel, both to see the world and to search for a path that might lead to enlightenment.

Vanaras are monkey-like humanoids who dwell in treetop villages high in the canopies of lush jungles and verdant forests. Like the monkeys they resemble, vanaras manifest a wide variety of different fur colors, body types, and facial features, but they all have in common long, dexterous fingers and toes as well as nimble and curious minds. Many of them learn to use their tails to capably manipulate objects.

Vanaras have a friendly culture, with most individuals seeking balance or enlightenment in their lives. Their propensity for mischief and history of fighting evil has earned them many ancestral enemies, and thus they usually make their homes far from urban areas. The majority of vanara settlements are found in southeastern Casmaron, among the lush jungles where they first originated. Devotion to monastic training and religious study has led to secondary populations forming in the Impossible Kingdom of Jalmeray, eastern Katapesh, Tian Xia, and northeastern Nex. Nonetheless, young vanaras seized by wanderlust might roam far across the world, and travelers from many distant lands might in turn visit vanara communities in search of the wisdom of their elders and sages.

Vanara culture often pits their inborn desire for trickery with a desire to transcend such origins, leading to many vanaras studying monastic practices. They also value tales of heroic vanaras from the past, looking to such icons for inspiration in their own lives. Most vanaras are quick to offer aid to those in distress and rarely hesitate in the face of evil, no matter the danger it presents. The leaders of vanara villages tend to be religious figures, or occasionally others possessing similar values and experience. Vanaras venerate Ragdya, the Sage of the Mountain, who encourages seeking enlightenment through worldly action and sees the virtues of pranks and humor.

Prehensile Tail.name: Prehensile Tail
Prehensile Tail.description: The vanara can use their long, flexible tail to perform Interact actions requiring a free hand, even if both hands are otherwise occupied. Their tail can't perform actions that require fingers or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, and they can't use it to hold items.

Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
Flurry of Blows.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The vanara disciple makes two fist Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Spring Up.name: Spring Up
Spring Up.description:
Requirements The vanara disciple is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}

Effect The vanara Stands, then can immediately Step twice. The Stand action doesn't trigger reactions.

Adlet.name: Adlet
Adlet.publicNotes:
Adlets dwell in the farthest, harshest reaches of the Crown of the World, with a few journeying beyond to similarly frigid regions in other continents. At frst glance, these isolated people look much like their Erutaki human cousins; they typically have straight, black hair and compact, powerful builds. However, adlets tend move with more grace their human kin. Up close, their strangeness reveals itself, as each has a furry face and sports a maw full of wolfike teeth. Their legs and tails resemble those of dogs.

Adlets' legends say that long ago, a mighty hunter lost his way far from home and came upon a house of whalebone and ice. A woman dressed in white fox furs greeted him, fed him, and tended to his frostbite. In time, they married and had 10 children, fve of whom bore the legs and tails of foxes. These children stayed with their mother, while the other fve—born with the legs and tails of wolves—traveled with their father back to the human lands and became the frst adlets.

Most adlets aren't inherently evil, but their culture is warlike, xenophobic, and noticeably lacking in humility. They see themselves as the natural rulers of the arctic wastes and view everyone else as squatters at best and invaders at worst. A typical adlet is stronger and faster than any mundane human, with the ability to walk naked in a blizzard and call up ice-cold mists. Given that, it's little wonder that adlets have developed something of a superiority complex. Still, while adlet raids are a common problem for travelers in the Crown of the World, a handful of wily and intrepid merchants have forged peaceful relations with certain adlet communities along more common routes.

Avenging Bite.name: Avenging Bite
Avenging Bite.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of an adlet's jaws Strike attacks one of the adlet's allies.

Effect The adlet makes a jaws Strike against the triggering creature.

Wolfstorm.name: Wolfstorm
Wolfstorm.description: 60 feet. A clammy, frigid mist billows forth ahead of the adlet. Creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. An adlet can see through the aura without penalty.

Frozen Weapons.name: Frozen Weapons
Frozen Weapons.description: Weapons wielded by an adlet gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.M5M1WJ5KzbYfRGsY]{Frost} property rune.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: An adlet's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 damage to creatures that are within the reach of at least two of the adlet's allies.

Wolfrime.name: Wolfrime
Wolfrime.description: An adlet's mist turns biting cold and coalesces into a thick rime of frost that deals @Damage[6d6[cold]] damage to creatures inside the adlet's wolfstorm aura (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic]), and the aura is deactivated until the start of the adlet's next turn.

Camel.name: Camel
Camel.publicNotes:
For generations untold, nomads and traders have relied on sure-footed camels to cross the harsh deserts and trackless wastes around the world. Thriving where other animals wither and perish, camels are well-adapted to their homes with tough skin and the ability to store nutrients within their bodies. Properly cared for, these "ships of the desert" can trek for weeks between oases without trouble.

Camels have three eyelids to protect them from desert sands and other blowing debris. One lid is completely clear, which allows them to see and travel during high winds. When sandstorms strike, camels completely close their nostrils to protect their lungs. Their underbellies also sport a thick, specialized skin, allowing them to lay down safely on burning hot sands.

Contrary to popular belief, fatty tissue comprises a camel's humps rather than water. This stored energy allows the animals to survive long distances between feedings. These herbivores can also readily digest hardy scrub brush inedible to other species, making them one of the hardiest desert survivors. Strong as a warhorse, camels can run fast and even sprint for short periods of time when they feel threatened, though they prefer a slow, plodding pace to conserve energy.

One-humped camels, also called dromedaries, are more common in the deserts of northern Garund, while the two-humped variety are native to the dry steppes of Casmaron. Both species have tall and lanky builds, standing about 6 feet at the shoulder and weighing around 2,000 pounds. They can be ornery when mishandled, and they don't hesitate to bite, kick, or even spit a noxious substance on riders who don't treat them well.

In addition to transporting people and goods, camels are a key source of fiber for clothing and tents as well as milk. Their meat is highly nutritious and surprisingly tasty, but given the creatures' utility, this use is reserved for special occasions or truly dire situations.

Desert-Adapted.name: Desert-Adapted
Desert-Adapted.description: A camel is well-adapted to heat and deserts. If allowed to drink and eat its fill, (roughly 40 gallons), it can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist} for 2 weeks without needing to attempt Survival checks, and it treats environmental heat as if it was one step less severe.

Camel Spit.name: Camel Spit
Camel Spit.description:
To drive away enemies, the camel spits the partially digested contents of its stomach at a creature within 10 feet.

On a hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

The camel can't use its camel spit Strike again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Camel Spit]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sand Stride.name: Sand Stride
Sand Stride.description: The camel Strides twice. It has a +5-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these Strides, ignoring difficult terrain caused by rubble, sand, and uneven ground made of earth and stone.

Icewyrm.name: Icewyrm
Icewyrm.publicNotes:
Resembling wingless, serpentine dragons formed of jagged ice and shot through with veins of nearly frozen water, these elementals dwell within icebergs and enjoy striking out at passing ships or creatures. They're especially common in frigid stretches of ocean in the Plane of Water, where icebergs cluster together into enormous islands of ice.

Water elementals that become infused with cold or mist have increased mobility in regions outside of bodies of water.

Explosion.name: Explosion
Explosion.description: When the icewyrm dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[8d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save).

Breathe Ice Shards.name: Breathe Ice Shards
Breathe Ice Shards.description: The icewyrm breathes a @Template[type:line|distance:60] of freezing shards of razor-sharp ice, dealing @Damage[3d12[cold]|options:area-damage] damage and @Damage[3d12[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage to every creature in the line (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). The icewyrm can't use Breathe Ice Shards again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Ice Shards]]{1d4 rounds}.

Ice Burrow.name: Ice Burrow
Ice Burrow.description: The Icewyrm can Burrow through ice or snow with a Speed of 20 feet. It moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Abrikandilu.name: Abrikandilu
Abrikandilu.publicNotes:
Wrecker demons, also known as abrikandilus, despise beautiful things and do everything in their power to destroy both people and objects regarded as such. An abrikandilu forms from the souls mortals who were vandals, misanthropes, or defacers of artwork, particularly if their destructive actions stemmed from feelings of powerful envy.

An abrikandilu loathes only one thing more than beauty: their own visage. The mere sight of their face-reflected in a mirror, a shield, or even a pool of water- can send a wrecker demon into a rage. Many demon slayers leverage tactic to their advantage, venturing into battle with polished steel shields and cold iron blades at the ready.

Mortal souls that have been twisted and corrupted by sin sometimes arise in the afterlife as demons. These powerful and destructive fiends seek to spread their particular sin to warp more souls, thereby bolstering their numbers and continuing the cycle.

Hatred of Mirrors.name: Hatred of Mirrors
Hatred of Mirrors.description:
An abrikandilu loathes the sight of their reflection. When a creature Interacts with a mirror within sight of the wrecker demon, the demon takes a -2 penalty to Will saves against Intimidation checks.

An abrikandilu that ends their turn adjacent to a mirror or that's attacked by a creature holding a mirror takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage (this usually leads abrikandilus to focus their efforts on destroying nearby mirrors using Wreck).

Loathsome Bite.name: Loathsome Bite
Loathsome Bite.description:
When an abrikandilu hits a creature with their jaws Strike, the creature becomes infected with the demon's self-loathing. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save to avoid gaining a –1 status penalty to Charisma-based checks. This penalty is cumulative up to –3, and remains even if the wounds are healed. The penalty is reduced by 1 every 24 hours until it reaches 0.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LgZx5xotO08JzhVc]{Effect: Loathsome Bite}

Wreck.name: Wreck
Wreck.description:
The abrikandilu makes two claw Strikes against an unattended object or held mirror. Held mirrors use the holding character's AC.

If both Strikes hit, combine their damage for the purpose of overcoming any Hardness or resistance.

These Strikes don't count toward the abrikandilu's multiple attack penalty, nor does that penalty apply to these Strikes.

Tikbalang.name: Tikbalang
Tikbalang.publicNotes:
Tikbalangs are forest creatures that delight in leading travelers astray. They deceive and mislead with their formidable magic, leaping from tree to tree while laughing or neighing uncontrollably. While not malicious, neither are they empathetic to the plight of their victims. Tikbalangs would sooner forget about those whom they've tricked and leave these unfortunate souls to die than lead them back to their intended path through guilty altruism.

Tikbalangs' occult magic stems from the esoteric mystery of believing a lie. In the moment of crafting illusions or conjuring extradimensional spaces, tikbalangs themselves believe that what they're creating is real. This conviction makes their spells harder to resist, and this same principle also makes them very effective liars. But this readiness to believe also makes them susceptible to deceptions and illusions in turn, and they're particularly vulnerable to mind games. Lone travelers without magic of their own are advised to learn riddles, sleight of hand, or other tricks to defend against tikbalangs' oft-deadly entertainment. Other whispers suggest wearing one's shirt inside out to confuse the creatures, or passing by a tikbalang's forest quietly to avoid drawing their attention.

Unlike some illusionists, tikbalangs can also rely on their physical prowess should the need arise. They have unusually long legs that end in cloven hooves and stand as tall as ogres when upright. Skilled climbers and leapers, they're also well known as master wrestlers, where their long limbs put them at a distinct advantage over their foes. They have elongated faces that, when combined with their well-kept hair, suggest an equine appearance—although some tikbalangs have saurian or birdlike faces instead.

Believe the Lie.name: Believe the Lie
Believe the Lie.description: The tikbalang takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against illusion spells and to their Will DC against checks to Lie to them.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The tikbalang takes on the appearance of any Medium or Large humanoid. This doesn't change the tikbalang's Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Flailing Thrash.name: Flailing Thrash
Flailing Thrash.description: The tikbalang makes two fist Strikes, with each Strike dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage against creatures grabbing or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the tikbalang. The multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Unnatural Leap.name: Unnatural Leap
Unnatural Leap.description: The tikbalang jumps up to their Speed horizontally, or half that vertically.

Cave Giant.name: Cave Giant
Cave Giant.publicNotes:
Cave giants are the vicious loners of the giant world. Even other giantkin mostly find cave giants too brutal and antisocial to form alliances with. For their part, cave giants—garbed in stinking hides festooned with the rotting skulls of their victims—seem ambivalent about their foul reputation.

Spread across the world, giants are as diverse as the isolated places they inhabit. A giant makes a big impression on the local environment, especially on smaller and weaker creatures.

Forceful Fracture.name: Forceful Fracture
Forceful Fracture.description:
Requirements The cave giant is within reach of any kind of stone

Effect The cave giant pounds their fist into the nearby stone, fracturing it into chunks to hurl at other creatures. The giant then makes two ranged rock Strikes, each targeting a separate creature. Both attacks count toward their multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after they've made both attacks.

Smear.name: Smear
Smear.description:
Requirements The cave giant is within reach of a creature that is adjacent to a wall or other solid vertical surface

Effect The cave giant snags the creature and smashes it against the wall. The giant attempts an Athletics check against the target's Reflex DC. On a success, the cave giant Grabs the creature and smears it along the nearby wall, dealing @Damage[(2d8+8)[bludgeoning]] damage. On a critical success, the damage is doubled.

Stone Lion.name: Stone Lion
Stone Lion.publicNotes:
Stone lions are a common sight outside of banks, temples, palaces, and even private residences. The fierce expressions affixed on their faces remind passersby to stay on their best behavior.

Stone lions remain faithful guardians of a site, regardless of whether it falls into disrepair. Even if people abandon a place, the lion remains dutiful until its statue is too worn or broken to inhabit any longer.

Stone statues of beasts can often be found paired and standing guard to either side of an entryway. While some seem like merely lifeless statues, others are far more than they appear to be. Guardian beasts ward against evil and misfortune. Some of these celestial spirits were assigned this task, while others assumed their roles out of a sense of duty. To allow them to maintain a constant presence in the material world, pious artisans carve stone vessels of the beasts in their likeness; these statues then serve as anchors for the guardian beasts' souls. Should the need arise, guardian beasts can merge with their stony form, becoming a dangerous foe with noble courage, an indomitable will, and few weaknesses.

By day, guardian beasts stay in their vessels and pretend to be inanimate. Past nightfall, they might patrol the grounds in their stone form or leave the heavy vessel behind to go where a solid body can't reach. Some take this chance to visit the dreams of individuals they favor and send them messages, notifying them of strange occurrences or warning them of incoming danger. Despite their

good intentions, the dream messages from guardian beasts can be obscure, often overshadowed by the spirit's personality or strange assumptions they make due to their nature as resolute guardians.

While guardian beasts can work alone, they usually appear in bonded pairs who complement each other in nature. One could be a jokester, the other gloomy; another could be nurturing, the other strict. To make two otherwise identical-looking beasts distinct, sculptors often depict one stone animal with their young. In the case of stone lions, a common type of guardian beasts, this approach means carving stone lion cubs to accompany one of the guardians.
Stone Lion.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. evil

Anchored Soul.name: Anchored Soul
Anchored Soul.description: The lion is mystically bonded to its bonded vessel and must remain within 1 mile of it. Some might be further restricted to the location it guards.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Unholy.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Unholy

Bonded Vessel.name: Bonded Vessel
Bonded Vessel.description: The condition of a stone lion's vessel dictates the lion's maximum Hit Point value. Undamaged, the vessel is an object with 50 Hit Points (BT 25). When the lion is in spirit form, damaging it doesn't hurt the vessel, but damaging the vessel deals an equal amount of damage to the lion. When the lion Inhabits its Vessel, they're a single target, and damage reduces the Hit Points of both the lion and the vessel. If the vessel is broken, the lion can still fight normally while inhabiting it and suffers no ill effect, but if the vessel is ever destroyed, the lion is instantly slain and can't reconstitute.

Reconstitution.name: Reconstitution
Reconstitution.description: When the lion reaches 0 Hit Points, its spirit dissipates. If its bonded vessel is intact, the lion re-forms in this vessel after [[/br 2d4 #Reconstitution]]{2d4 days}, fully healed. If the vessel is broken, it must first be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repaired}, after which the lion reforms in [[/br 3d4 #Reconstitution]]{3d4 days}.

Ferocious Roar.name: Ferocious Roar
Ferocious Roar.description: The lion makes a terrifying roar that deals @Damage[2d8[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save) to each creature in a @Template[cone|distance:20]. Creatures that fail this save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Inhabit Vessel.name: Inhabit Vessel
Inhabit Vessel.description:
The lion touches and melds with its bonded vessel, bringing the statue to life. It can cease Inhabiting its Vessel by spending a single action, which has the concentrate trait. While Inhabiting the Vessel, it loses its fly Speed and gains

Immunities healing, nonlethal

Resistances physical 5 (except bludgeoning),

Speed 30 feet, and it gains the following Strikes:

  • Melee A Jaws +14, Damage 2d6+7 bludgeoning plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab}.
  • Ranged A Stone Ball +13 (range increment 30 feet), Damage 2d4+7 bludgeoning.

Spirit Body.name: Spirit Body
Spirit Body.description: When not Inhabiting its Vessel, the lion is incorporeal and gains resistance 5 to all damage (except force damage and damage from Strikes with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune; double resistance against non-magical).

Gray Aura.name: Gray Aura
Gray Aura.description: 15 feet. The bodach is always surrounded by a pall of gloomy gray, like the air before it rains. A non-fey or non-hag creature entering the aura or beginning their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure). A creature who succeeds is temporarily immune to the aura for 1 minute.

Implacable Curse.name: Implacable Curse
Implacable Curse.description: The bodach makes a staf Strike. If it hits, it deals an additional @Damage[2d8[spirit]] damage, and the target must attempt a save against either Mumbletongue or Stumblefoot (the bodach's choice).

Mumbletongue.name: Mumbletongue
Mumbletongue.description: The bodach mumbles a string of half-comprehensible nonsense, cursing creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute (stupefed 2 on a critical failure).

Stumblefoot.name: Stumblefoot
Stumblefoot.description: The bodach stares unblinkingly at its foes, cursing creatures within a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure).

Unstoppable.name: Unstoppable
Unstoppable.description: A bodach reduces any penalty it takes to its Speed by 5 feet (to a minimum of 0 feet). A bodach can ft into tight spaces as if it were a Small creature. It can move at its full Speed while Squeezing.

War Wraith.name: 战争缚灵 War Wraith
War Wraith.publicNotes:
这些由邪恶的军阀或嗜血的将军所留下的阴森灵魂是带来阴影和死亡的高大幽灵。和其他缚灵一样，战争缚灵出没于这世界上的阴暗角落，但相较于弱小的同类它们更可能踏过更远的距离来散布恐惧、传播影响。在穿过阳光斑驳的土地时它们常常依靠阴暗的林地和险恶的废墟（来躲避阳光）。战争缚灵通常都很傲慢，很少与它们的同类结伙而宁可统治一群普通的缚灵。一个极其强大的死灵法师可能会迫使一群战争缚灵为他服务。 不过，一个极其恶毒的目的——比如消灭一个光明和生命的堡垒——也许会让数个战争缚灵为这同一个目标而聚集。

战争缚灵的起源 War Wraith Origins

并非所有战争缚灵生前都是独立个体。他们大多由多个缚灵随时间推移凝聚一起而成，他们形成的地方聚集着迷失的灵魂，这些灵魂们的精魂与意识被某种不断被此地撕裂或侵蚀。此类战争缚灵思考与交流时并不像一个强大的个体，而是如同一片喧嚣的声浪，其声时常自相冲突，但当众声达成一致时则着实令人毛骨悚然。在虚能凝聚之地，如大虚空（Void）或恐惧之岛（Isle of Terror），战争幽灵常以这种方式形成。

Draining Presence.name: 汲能气场 Draining Presence
Draining Presence.description: 10尺。进入灵光的生物必须通过@Check[fortitude|dc:26]豁免，否则将获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。该生物在离开这个灵光1分钟后流失状态消失。豁免成功的生物在24小时内临时免疫这个灵光。

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: 阳光失能 Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: 在日光下的战争缚灵获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}。

Absorb Wraith.name: 吸收缚灵 Absorb Wraith
Absorb Wraith.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 战争缚灵将它的手伸向另一只位于100尺内的缚灵。被选中的缚灵分解并直冲向战争缚灵，对这条线上的所有生物造成@Damage[3d10[void]]伤害，且有@Check[fortitude|dc:28|basic]豁免。战争缚灵吸收目标缚灵的精华，获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]状态，持续1分钟。它（由迅捷获得的）额外行动只能用于飞行或打击。不愿被吸收的目标在成功通过@Check[will|dc:28]豁免后可以避免被吸收。

Grip of Fear.name: 恐惧之攫 Grip of Fear
Grip of Fear.description: 缚灵将手伸入邻近生物的胸膛，紧攥他们的心脏。目标受到@Damage[9d6[mental]]伤害，@Check[will|dc:28|basic]豁免。如果豁免大失败，该生物还会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]至缚灵的下一回合开始。

Robes of Welcome.name: 接引长袍 Robes of Welcome
Robes of Welcome.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 缚灵用他的长袍裹住一个邻接的生物，令他暴露于虚空之拥。如果任何生物正被缚灵的虚空之拥诅咒，该缚灵就无法再将虚空之拥施加给其他任何生物。

Void's Embrace.name: 虚空之拥 Void's Embrace
Void's Embrace.description:
若受害者在日光下成功通过对抗本诅咒的豁免，诅咒立刻结束。当一个生物受到本诅咒影响时，他能无视诅咒他的那个缚灵的抗力

豁免骰 @Check[will|dc:28]

阶段1 受害者在任何光线下都会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]（1小时）

阶段2 受害者获得30尺的生命感知但在任何光线下都会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]（1小时）

阶段3 如同阶段2，但受害者还会获得虚能治疗（1小时）

阶段4 受害者@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]且无法醒来（1天）

阶段5 受害者死亡并化作受战争缚灵控制的缚灵，他的肉身崩解成灰。

Ahuizotl.name: Ahuizotl
Ahuizotl.publicNotes:
The ahuizotl is a vicious, semiaquatic predator that resembles a hideous cross between a badger and an otter, with disturbingly web-fngered paws supplemented by a ffth hand at the end of a long, serpentine tail. A clever and stealthy hunter, the ahuizotl lures unwary prey to their doom by mimicking the cries of people in distress.
